loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata I. is 28 years old, married, and has one child. Leata owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business. Leata is requesting a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business, estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week, to improve and expand her business.

Leata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Leata's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weed killers

loans.name: Nidy

texts.en:
Nidy lives in the village of Ciriaco Pastrano, Oroquieta City. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a retail store where she earns about 3,000 PHP a month. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC and is applying for a new one, for 14,000 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue improving and expanding her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has two children.

Ahmad is a butcher. In 2006, he opened his shop where he sells meat. He has more than five years experience in this field, and has a good reputation and he is well known.

He is requesting $3,000 to repair his shop’s walls and floors. He is aiming to expand his business so he is able to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To repair his shop’s walls and floors.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mr. Hoa is a 32-year-old married man who is blessed with four children who are teenagers. He lives in Kompong Chhnang province. Mr. Hoa currently works as a domestic construction foreman who is able to hire employees to help provide his services. His wife is a rice farmer who sells a few produce items in a small store in front of her home. Mr. Hoa’s business has been very busy recently because there are many clients who need his services to build houses. However, he lacks construction materials. That is why Mr. Hoa has requested a loan to provide the capital to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rosa Olivia

texts.es: Rosa Olivia tiene su pulpería, tiene más de 22 años de tener este medio de vida. Ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos diarios de su hogar, tiene 6 hijos y solamente 3 están bajo su cargo. Con iniciativa propia es que ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio, Su meta es apoyar su crecimiento para cada día ganar más rentabilidad y muy seguramente lo logrará, porque es una madre de familia, muy organizada y trabajadora. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, pan y sopas.
texts.en:
Rosa Olivia owns a store and has earned her living in this manner for more than 22 years. She started this business because she needed to cover the daily expenses of her household. Rosa has six children, but only three are still under her care. Through her own initiative, she has been able to succeed in her business. Her goal is to grow each day so that her business is more profitable and more secure in its operation. Rosa is a mother who is very organized and hardworking.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, detergents, candy, soft drinks, bread, and soups.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, detergents, candy, soft drinks, bread, and soups.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 29-year-old husband and taxi driver; he drives passengers inside the city where he lives. Muhammad has no children.

Muhammad wants to renew the taxi license and insurance and can't pay the fees at once, but paying back on a monthly basis to FATEN is going to be possible as the income of the taxi is barely enough for their household expenses.

Muhammad is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: to pay for taxi license and insurance fees.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
El  señor Francisco José  vive en la cuidad de Managua, labora como ayudante de mantenimiento desde 15 años.
Es padre  de familia de tres  menores a los que les proporciona las condiciones necesarias de vida. Visitó las instalación de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito  ya que lo necesita para invertir en las mejoras para su vivienda.

La inversión del crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de cemento, arena, bloque, y pago de mano de obra.
El señor Francisco Jose  agradece a Ceprodel por el crédito ya que gracias al financiamiento va a mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Francisco José lives in the city of Managua; he has a spouse.  He’s worked for 15 years as a maintenance assistant.  He’s the father of three minors, all of whom are dependent on him.  He visited our installation to request a loan because he needed the loan to invest in home improvements.  He will use the loan to buy cement, sand, concrete blocks and to pay labor costs.  Francisco José is grateful to Ceprodel for the loan it granted him because thanks to the loan he will be able to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia, es viuda desde hace 18 años y ha tenido que criar a sus 7 hijos como madre soltera. Su hijo más joven de 19 años ha ingresado a estudiar para ser Policía. El resto de sus hijos son taxistas, y sus hijas venden en el mercado. Teodora va a utilizar su préstamo para su negocio de mantas, en la cual lleva más o menos tres años. Ella compra las mantas de Juliaca y las manda al penal para que las aborden, luego ella viaja a Lima donde las vende en la calle.  Teodora ha sido socia de FINCA Perú por más de cinco años. Lo que más le gusta son los ahorros que le han servido para comprarle a su hijo su uniforme de Policía y su laptop. Su nueva meta es ahorrar para su terreno para construir una casa más grande porque ahora en su casa pequeña, en donde vive con sus hermanos, viven muy apretados.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Magnolia Communal Bank.  She has been a widow for 18 years, and she has had to raise her seven children as a single mother.  Her youngest child is 19 years old, and he has enrolled in studies to be a policeman.  The rest of her sons are taxi drivers, and her daughters sell at the market.

Teodora will use the loan for her blanket business, which she has had for more or less three years.  She buys the blankets from Juliaca, and she sends them to the prison to be embroidered.  She then travels to Lima where she sells them on the street.

Teodora has been a member of Finca Perú for over five years.  What she likes the most are the savings that she used to buy her son a police uniform and a laptop.  Her new goal is to save for land in order to build a bigger house because her current house is very small.  She lives there with her siblings, and they are very cramped.

loans.use: to buy blankets wholesale.

loans.name: Bakir

texts.ru:
Bakir jenat i imeyet 4 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. Bakir 45 let. 
On uje 11 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki yego taxi. On ochen dobrosovestniy i trudolubiviy chelovek.
texts.en:
Bakir is married and has four children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and beloved children.  Bakir is 45 years old. 
 
He has been driving a taxi for eleven years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his taxi.  He is a very honest and hard-working man.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Ke, 58, is a motorbike taxi driver and has three children, all of whom are married. His wife, Sophal, is 53 years old and owns a small shop selling groceries and meals for breakfast and lunch. Their children are all working in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. Ke is looking for a loan of US $700 to buy more ingredients and local needed products for his wife's shop. His future dream is to have a bigger house and bigger shop for his wife.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for his wife's shop

loans.name: María Elva

texts.es: María Elva vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar D. su residencia donD. venD. todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, churros, pan, galletas, jugos entre otros, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela últimamente pues ella siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita a precios realmente accesibles además María les ofrece un servicio excelente pues su carisma y amabilidad la impulsan a recibir a su clientela con gran alegría, María Elva piensa que si somos dueños D. nuestro destino, somos dueños D. nuestra felicidad; el aumento D. la demanda en la tienda ha impulsado a María para hacer crecer el negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, pan, medicinas al por mayor a fin D. obtenerlos a precios bajos para generar mayores ganancias. María Elva tiene confianza que D. esta forma lograra llevar seguridad económica a su hogar y una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en: María Elva lives with her partner and their children. She has a store in her house where she sells all kinds of basic products, such as chips, bread, cookies, and juices, among other things. She has acquired many new customers lately because she always has what people need at accessible prices. Also, María offers them excellent service. Because her charisma and friendliness, she tends to her customers joyfully. María Elva thinks that if we are the owners of our destiny, then we are the owners of our happiness. The increase in demand at her store has motivated María to make her business grow. So, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that would allow her to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, and medicines at wholesale price so that she can generate greater earnings. María Ela has confidence that in this way she will be able to achieve economic security in her home and a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, and medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to ensure distribution of farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds, at low prices during the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
KOTOGNOGONTALA est un groupe constitué de  4 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, en moyenne 4 enfants et qui vivent dans des  familles polygames dans la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  Tous les quatre prêts antérieures ont été correctement remboursés.
AWA, la deuxième à gauche, en boubou noir, fait le commerce d’habillements et de légumes dans ce groupe de femmes KOTOGNOGONTALA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, une soixantaine  de mètres de bazins. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et effectue sa vente de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, sur commande et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, essentiellement au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Kotognogontala is a group composed of four married women, who are on average 36 years old with four children. They live in polygamous families in the town of Sikasso.
To better satisfy customer demand, they are on their fifth loan with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso. All four previous loans have been repaid punctually.
In this group of women, Kotognogontala, Awa retails clothing and vegetables; she is the second woman from the left, wearing a black caftan.
With her loan, she is planning on purchasing about sixty meters of damask. She gets her supplies from the great market in the town of Sikasso and sells door-to-door in various districts of the town of Sikasso, on orders and within families. Her clientele is composed of men and women, and mostly pays her cash.
She is counting on an average monthly benefit of 37,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan with interests, with the remainder being destined for her savings.

loans.use: to buy damask (fabric).

loans.name: Howieda

texts.en:
Howieda is a 24-year-old woman who is married and has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver and the income he gets is the only source of income for the family. Howieda wants to help her husband to pay for purchasing a new engine for the taxi the family owns in order to improve it, but she has not enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

When Howieda gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband and pay to purchase new engine for the taxi. This will improve the taxi's capacity for working and enable her husband to work extra hours to increase the family income and offer to them better living conditions. Howieda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed next to the taxi.


About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Alegres"se originó a través de promociones que se hicieron en el barrio de las miembros. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra. Blanca es la presidenta del grupo, esta trabajando en la venta de ropa. Comenta que por medio de su sacrificio y trabajo ella ha podido sobresalir y ayudar a su familia. El deseo de ella es que todas las miembros puedan aumentar sus ingresos para el buen pago de sus obligaciones y logros de los objetivos del grupo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, ya que estamos a punto de recibir a esa estación del año y siempre en esa época tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Alegres" community bank was formed through some promotional work which was carried out in the neighborhood where the bank's members live.  The goals of each of the members are to work as part of a team, to promote a supportive spirit and to reach the top level of the program.

Blanca is the president of this group.  Her business is selling clothes.  She says that through her sacrifice and work, she has been able to do well and help her family.  Her wish is for all the members of her group to increase their incomes so that they can meet their repayments and achieve the aims of the group.

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy summer clothes as we are about to enter that season and she always has a lot of orders at that time of year.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié , père de 6 enfants dont 4 élèves.Il exerce le métier de charpentier notamment la construction et la réparation de pirogues de pêche.Il pratique cette activité depuis 1983 alors qu'il était encore  jeune apprenti de son père qui lui a appris le métier.Aujourd'hui, il a son propre atelier et parvient à entretenir sa famille et à satisfaire ses besoins avec les revenus tirés de la charpenterie.Pour augmenter ses capacités de production , il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter des planches et des troncs d'arbres morts.Son ambition est de construire un grand dépot de bois de menuiserie et de charpenterie.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married man and the father of six children, of whom four are students. He works in the trade of carpentry, especially in construction and in repairing fishing boats. He has working at this since 1983 while he was still a young apprentice of his father's, who taught him the trade. Today, he has his own workshop and manages to support his family and himself with the income derived from carpentry.

To increase his production capacity, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy boards and tree trunks. His ambition is to build a large warehouse for lumber and woodworking.

loans.use: to buy planks and tree trunks

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
For the past four years, Willy has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells soap, sugar and cooking oil. Willy is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. 

To help expand his business, Willy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for resale and will help Willy to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Willy hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Willy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves microentrepreneurs like Willy, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Mahoua

texts.fr:
Âgée de 44 ans, Mahoua est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle  réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Sikasso.
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, Mahoua s’est initiée depuis plus de dix années aux activités de petit commerce notamment à l’achat et à la vente d’habillements (pagne wax,  tissus brodé, etc.) et des sacs à main. Elle achète ses marchandises sur places auprès des commerçants grossistes de Sikasso et Bamako avant de les revendre à sa place au marché où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement de femmes de ménage et vendeuses de condiments) pour leurs qualités.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elle est à son deuxième crédit qu’elle compte utiliser pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 20 complets de tissus brodés, 15 pièces de pagne wax, 15 sacs à main et des colliers de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce deuxième crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mahoua is 44 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional family in Sikasso. After trying several activities without success, for the last 10 years Mahoua has been working as a small-scale retailer, buying and selling clothing supplies (wax cloth known as "pagne," embroidered fabric, etc) and handbags. She buys these items locally from wholesalers from Bamako and Sikasso then re-sells at the market where her products are very much in demand for their high quality. Most of her customers are cleaning ladies and sellers of condiments. 

In order to meet the demand from her growing number of customers, she decided to join micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Mahoua has properly repaid the first loan and is now on her second, which she will use to increase her working capital so she can  buy 20 outfits made from embroidered fabric, 15 lengths of "pagne," 15 handbags and women's necklaces. [With this first loan] she expects to make a profit of 175,000 CFA francs a month which she will mostly use to contribute to family expenses and  pay interest on the loan. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various items.

loans.name: Makina Shg Group

texts.en:
Milka is the facilitator of the Makina SHG group. Milka and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Milka is a mother of three children. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Milka had a very good maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Milka was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Milka and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Milka will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Makina SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 30-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in a little restaurant in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Martha requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Doussou Ba

texts.fr:
Mme Doussou  est une dame qui habite à environ 16 km de la ville principale dans un petit village très animé par le petit commerce. Elle est mariée et soutien de famille
Elle a monté son commerce depuis plus de quinze ans maintenant
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des denrées alimentaires manquants à sa boutique : du riz, du lait du sucre etc.… 
Mme Doussou est une brave femme qui participe à l’éducation de ses enfants puisqu’’ elle leur paie la scolarité.
Pour ses projets futurs elle aimerait faire du maraichage.
texts.en:
Doussou is a woman who lives in a small village that is bustling with small-scale retail businesses. She lives about 16 km from the region's main town. She is married and supports her family. She started her business over 15 years ago.

With the loan, she is going to buy foodstuffs that are missing from her shop: rice, milk, sugar, etc.

Doussou is a good woman who plays a role in the education of her children by paying for their education. With regard to future projects, she would like to take up small-scale truck farming.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs: rice, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria Yamileth

texts.es:
María, está solicitando otro préstamo, por el buen servicio y la necesidad que en estos momentos se representa, pues quiere comprar maíz, leña y otros materiales para la ejecución de su negocio como el gas, teniendo mayor seguridad en la producción para este mes de diciembre.
Ella considera que sus ventas han mejorado y que clientes está satisfecho con su servicio, esto le ha permitido tener mayores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
María is requesting another loan because of the good service and the need that she currently has.  She wants to purchase corn, firewood and other materials, like gas, to keep her business going.  Then she can be sure to have better production in this month of December.
María  feels that her sales have improved and that her customers are satisfied with her service.  This has allowed her to have an increased income and cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,ella alquila un taxi y lo hace trabajar en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia tambien esta vendiendo productos como panetones,champanes y vinos,ella vende en forma independiente,por medio de este negocio la socia puede salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda los productos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar panetones,champanes y vinos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the transportation business.  She rents out a taxi to work in different streets in the city of Cusco.  She also is selling products such as panettone, Champagne, and wine.  She sells independently.  With this business the member is able to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a place to sell the products.

She is requesting the loan to buy panettone, Champagne, and wine wholesale.

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy panettone, Champagne, and wine wholesale.

loans.name: Crispus

texts.en: Crispus  is a 41-year-old married man.  He has 2 children, 7 and 15 years old.  He describes himself to be an ambitious man. He operates a farm where he sells onions, tomatoes, etc.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a very productive area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the poor road network making it difficult to distribute the farm produce to the customers. He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern for his family members to use for lightining.  His business goal is to buy a motorcycle to assist in distributing farm produce to the customers within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will venture into the business of transportation by buying a motorcycle which will provide the service.

loans.use: buy a solar lantern

loans.name: Future Planners Group

texts.en: In the photo are members of the Future Planners group. They are small-scale businessmen and women based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. The leader of this group is . is age ; she was born in the town where she is currently residing together with her husband and children. Her husband is a businessman and of her children are attending primary school and secondary school. For ten years, she has been selling and . With this loan, she will buy at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Find Out

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en:
Miroslav G. has more than ten years working experience as a computer engineer in a state company.

In 1995 he decided o find his own business and started with a clothes trade at first, then sartorial business and now he keeps a computer club for games and internet services.

Miroslav is 44 years old economist by education and has a daughter. His wife is a school teacher.

Miroslav G. applies for an $ 800 loan to buy a new hardware.

loans.use: To buy a new hardware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to expand my business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has one daughter. She runs a business selling household plastic items, bathroom chemicals and laundry soaps. Tatyana has rich experience working in this sphere of trade. She has been in business for over ten years. Currently, she has about $1,600 in inventory. Her monthly gross income is about $2,000 and her net profit amounts to $240-250.

Tatyana is the caring daughter of elderly parents. She uses part of her income to support her parents as the retirement pay they receive is not enough to provide for their most basic needs. Tatyana is very responsible, modest and responsive. She has promptly repaid each loan she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”.

Today she is requesting a loan of $800 to increase her business capital and re-supply her inventory. This loan will help Tatyana finance the expansion of her product line and expand her business, helping to improve her family’s living standards and pay her daughter’s college fees. We believe that the perseverance and careful planning that characterize Tatyana as an entrepreneur will help her business to prosper and allow her to efficiently serve her niche market.

loans.use: Tatyana would like to increase the stock for her household wares store.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Born in 1960 in Kouve in the prefecture of Yoto, Mrs. Marie K. is married and the mother of two children. She also looks after one other person. She has a job selling general groceries that enables her to contribute to the household expenses, as her husband’s spare parts business is facing competition and poor sales. To meet customer demand, Mrs. K. is asking for a loan of $600 to build up a solid stock of merchandise so that she no longer runs out of anything and can increase her turnover.

Née en 1960 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto, Madame K. Marie est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants et une (1) personne à sa charge. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des produits d’alimentation générale afin de contribuer aux charges du ménage car son mari est confronté à la concurrence et à la mévente de ses pièces détachées. Pour être à la hauteur du marché, Madame K. Marie sollicite un apport financier de $600 pour faire un stock consistant de ses marchandises afin de mettre fin à la rupture de stock et accroître son chiffre d’affaire.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Stocking up on merchandise

loans.name: Aofialefagailaua

texts.en: Aofialefagailaua S. is married, and has four children. She is extremely interested in making and printing elei materials. She gained the experience from a village seminar. Even though she had the knowledge, she did not have enough money to begin her business. As a result, she applied for a loan of $300, which enabled her to purchase the necessary equipment. She is extremely happy for any financial aid she has enjoyed, and is grateful for the opportunity she was given.

loans.use: Provide materials and buy paints

loans.name: Demofila Susana

texts.es:
Demofila Susana is 33 years old, lives in the Centro Poblado Menor Piscopampa, Mache District, Otuzco Province, La Libertad State. Susana has one little boy who is 2 years old. She completed 5th grade in elementary school.

She began her business young, more or less at 16 years of age; her mother loaned her 150 soles and with that money she bought animals which she fattened and sold. With the earnings she bought sugar, rice, oil, matches, and started a grocery business in her mother's home.

Upon seeing her dedication and responsibility, her older sister had her join the Communal Bank "Mujeres de Trabajo" of which she too is a member. She received her first loan of 300 soles (approximately US$100), and with this money she bought shelves and tables to organize and show her products. Little by little she expanded her store, with other loans she bought guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, and turkeys to raise and sell. In addition she buys and sells grain wholesale.

With the currently loan from Manuela Ramos of 2000 soles (approximately US$667), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy food for her animals and sacks of grain wholesale.

Susana dreams of having her own home in which she can live peacefully with her son as she is a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Demofila Susana tiene 33 años de edad, actualmente vive en el Centro Poblado Menor Piscopampa del Distrito de Mache de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Susana tiene solo un hijito de 2 años. Ella estudió sólo hasta quinto grado de primaria.

Empezó su negocio desde muy joven, más o menos a los 16 años; su mamá le prestó S/.150.00 soles y con ese dinero compró animales los engordó y vendió, con las ganancias obtenidas compró azúcar, arroz, aceite, fósforos e inició la venta de abarrotes en la casa de su madre.

Al ver su dedicación y responsabilidad su hermana mayor la integra al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” del que también es socia; recibió su primer crédito de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100), con este dinero compró andamios y mesas para ordenar y mostrar sus productos. Poco a poco fue implementando más su bodega, con los otros préstamos compró cuyes, gallinas, patos, pavos los que cría y luego vende, además se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales al por mayor.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 667 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará alimentos para sus animales y sacos de cereales al por mayor.

La señora Susana sueña con tener su casa propia en la que pueda vivir tranquila con su niño ya que es madre soltera.

loans.use: Purchase of food for animals (chickens, guinea pigs, turkeys), purchase of grain at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Sovannary

texts.en:
Miss. T. Sovannary is single (aged 21) and lives with her parents, two brothers and a sister. She began her silk production business at home in 2002 after learning to weave silk from her elder sister. Today, besides engaging in farming activities, her mum and dad also weave silk at home.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA, her first, for $400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the existing loom and also to create another loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the existing loom and to create a new loom.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María P. Angola is married to a taxi driver and is a mother of 4 children. She bakes for a living, thanks to an industrial grade oven that she acquired not too long ago. With this tool, she prepares all sorts of products which she sells under contract and individual orders for either birthday parties, weddings and other events. The rest is taken to school kiosks in her area. In addition to this activity, she also buys a variety merchandise from Oruro, a city she travels to twice a month. She has done this kind of work for 6 years now and is turning out to be better than baking exclusively. For this reason, María requires capital in order to buy ingredients for baking, as well as buying more merchandise which she plans to sell on credit and recover more than her initial investment over a moderate period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

María P. Angola, casada con un chofer de taxi, y madre de 4 hijos, se dedica a la repostería, gracias al horno industrial que no hace mucho adquirió. Con esta herramienta ella se dedica a la preparación de todo tipo de productos, los cuales vende a contrato y pedido, ya sea para fiestas de cumpleaños, matrimonios y otros, y el resto lleva a los kioscos de las escuelas y colegios de su zona. Paralelamente a esta actividad, ella se dedica a comprar todo tipo de mercadería que trae de Oruro, ciudad a la que viaja dos veces al mes. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad, y al parecer le esta resultando mejor que solo dedicarse a la repostería. Por tal motivo, María precisa de capital, para poder acceder tanto a la compra de insumos para la repostería, como para la inversión en la compra de más mercadería, la cual piensa vender al crédito y recuperar mucho más de lo invertido en un mediano plazo.

loans.use: María requires capital in order to buy ingredients for baking, as well as buying more merchandise which she plans to sell on credit and recover more than her initial investment over a moderate period of time.

loans.name: Nabweru North B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mary B.. She is currently in the business of running a cosmetic shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to increase her stock. Mary is 28 years old and is a widow. She has 2 children ranging from age 4 to 7, all of whom go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her cosmetic business.

May is joined in her small group by Ritah N., Mariah N., Grace N., and Rose Nanutmbwe. Ritah N. is currently in the business of running a salon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy a hair dryer.

Mariah N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her charcoal business.

Grace N. is currently in the business of running a bar and is requesting a loan of UGX 100,000 to purchase more beer and drinks.

Rose N. is currently in the business of selling snacks and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to expand her snack business.

loans.use: To increase stock in the cosmetic shop

loans.name: Bernadeta's Maendeleo. Group

texts.en:
Bernadeta is 44 years old and is a widow. Her six children range in age from 20 to 28 years. Bernadeta also cares for two others in the same age group. Bernadeta is a teacher and business woman. She works daily from noon to 6pm at her business selling clothes and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales. Bernadeta now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Vetarina, who also sells clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Eufemia Magna

texts.es:
Eufemia Magna C. V. is 49 years old; she studied up to second grade of primary school. She has two children but only one still depends on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

Her business is the purchase and sale of curd, vegetables and raising barley, wheat, corn and potatoes. The people who know her always look for her to ask for these products. She offers vegetables as a ambulatory seller at the Otuzco market. She started her business with a small amount of curd and a small amount of grains that she harvested. As time went on and with loans she acquired through the "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" community bank, she has been able to make some profit and expand her business.

She used all of her first loan to buy curd. With another loan, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 200 units of curd, a variety of vegetables and fertilizer for her planting.

Her greatest hope is to have a stand at the wholesale market in the city of Trujillo because on the coast, business is better.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eufemia Magna C. V. tiene 49 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Tiene dos hijos en total pero uno aun depende de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio es la compra y venta de quesillo, verduras y siembra de granos de cebada, grano de trigo, chochos y papa. La gente que ya la conoce siempre la buscan para pedirle algunos de estos productos. La verdura la ofrece y vende en condición de ambulante en el mercado de Otuzco. Su negocio se inicio vendiendo con un poco de quesillo y con poco cereal que cosechaba; con el pasar del tiempo y con los préstamos que adquirió en el Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón de Jesús” ha podido hacer un capital propio y ha incrementado su negocio.

Su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 lo invirtió todo comprando quesillo. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 200 unidades de quesillo, una variedad de verduras y abono para sus siembras.

Su mayor sueño es tener un puesto pero en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Trujillo ya que por la costa hay mayor negocio.

loans.use: Buy curd and various other products.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is married with two children (aged 4 and 1). She makes a living by selling charcoal and firewood from 6am to 6pm everyday. From this business, which she started in August last year, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $25.

Zainab hopes for a loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood. She is a member of the loan group, Shida Huzaa M'fa. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is a woman with self-discipline and she is very dedicated to her work and her beloved children. She plants small flowers so that she can make decorative floral arrangements. This has she has become the activity that gives her the main source of income for her family. She hopes to increase her production and plant a larger quantity of flowers and decorative plants next year.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

NELLY, es una mujer abnegada y muy dedicada a su labor y a sus queridos hijos. Siembra plantitas para decorar los arreglos florales y se ha convertido su actividad en la principal fuente de ingreso económico para su familia. Desea seguir mejorando su producción y plantar la próxima temporada mayor cantidad de flores y plantas decorativas.

loans.use: Investment of capital to diversify her crop.

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Ol C. is a villager in Trapaing Chrov Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a subsistence farmer. In her farming, Mrs. Ol C. now has insufficient draft animals to plow her rice field in order to cultivate rice. Thus, she asks for a loan to buy an additional cow. Her husband, Mr. Rath Don, besides helping her in the farm, collects palm juice to produce palm sugar to sell.

Mrs. Ol C. is 44 and the mother of three children, one of whom works as a construction worker, while another is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one is attending the local school. Previously, Mrs. Ol C. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to cultivate rice. Her husband is presented in the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow to use as a draft animal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish building a room/Terminar construcción de un dormitorio

loans.name: Fruit Sales Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. She is the mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. Her daughter is in the 8th standard (grade). Her elder son is a daily wage laborer. The younger son works in a factory. Suraiya Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her brother, who lives with her and has a business of fruit selling. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell. Shabiran baji wants a loan to buy wires for her electric wire shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Haitboi

texts.en:
Y. Haitboi is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children. Haitboi has grown potatoes for more than 5 years. He has land of 1.8 hectares where he grows potatoes and other vegetables. In fact, he draws strength and vitality by  making his products the best in the city. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and a time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. 

Haitboi has a big family of 4 children, and they all go to school. Today he is requesting a loan of $1100 which he has committed to repay within 12 months. He wants to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables. The well-being of this family is on your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Haitboi’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Felipa

texts.es:
Con denodado esfuerzo, la señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de chanchos hace 17 años, también es Presidenta de un comedor popular al costado de su casa; ambas labores le deparan casi todo su tiempo pero ella lo hace porque detrás suyo hay 7 hijos y, como madre soltera, ella lo hace gustosamente para el bienestar de sus hijos. Aunque de sus 7 hijos, 3 ya sean mayores, aún viven bajo su techo y ella los acoge con el amor de siempre.

Con tantas trabas de por medio pero con más ganas que nunca, la señora Rosa necesita de 800 soles para emprender aquella travesía que la llevará, de la mano con sus hijos, hacia el éxito.
texts.en:
With a lot of effort, Mrs. Rosa has been selling pigs for 17 years. She's also the President of a popular restaurant, which is attached to her house. Together these jobs take up nearly all of her time, but Rosa does them because she is a single mother of seven, and she takes great pleasure in the wellbeing of her children. Even though three of her seven children are now grown-up, they still live with her and Rosa receives them with the same love that she always has. With so many obstacles in the way, but with more determination than ever, Rosa needs 800 soles to set her business on course, and hand in hand with her children, toward success.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in food for pigs that she'll sell during the Christmas season, when demand is high

loans.name: Maame Lolo

texts.en:
Maame Lolo H. is a widow with 9 dependents. She has received no formal education. Maame Lolo uses her income to pay her utility bills and the other expenses of her family.

Since 1991, Maame Lolo has sold corn at Adakope near Shama. She also prepares a local meal known as 'kenkey,' which is made out of corn. Kenkey is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country; it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish. Maame Lolo also sells smoked fish.

Maame Lolo will use the loan to purchase more corn, both for resale and for the production of kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Lolo plans to invest in her children's education and also save towards putting up a house for her large family.

In the photo, Maame Lolo is the lady in the green dress; the other person is a lady she has employed to assist her.

loans.use: To purchase more corn for resale and the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Darou Mboumbaye Group

texts.fr: L'écovillage de MbouM. est situé dans la région de Saint Louis à 300 km de Dakar. Les principales activités économiques dans la zone sont : le commerce, la pêche, le maraichage, l'élevage et l'extraction du sel. Les femmes du groupement de Darou MbouM.  ayant une trés grande expérience dans le domaine du maraîchage viennent auprès de Kiva pour solliciter un prêt. Avec le prêt, elles vont acheter des semences, de l'engrais, du fumier, des pulvérisateurs pour faire du maraîchage. Les produits récoltés, elles espèrent développer le marché local par la création d'un système d'approvisionnement et de commercialisation de fruits et légumes.
texts.en:
The ecovillage of MbouM. is located in the Saint Louis region about 300 kilometers away from Dakar. The main activities of the people inhabiting the region are: commerce, fishing, farming, raising animal and extracting salt. The women of Darou MbouM. have a lot of experience in farming and have come to Kiva in order to obtain a loan. With the money from the loan they will purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure and sprays to be able to grow fruits and vegetables. They are hoping that they will be able to create a local market and provide the local population with fruits and vegetables.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hồ Thị Vân 43 tuổi,  chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Hưng Nguyên Tỉnh Nghệ An.Năm 2001 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và nghề mộc sẵn có của chồng. Hàng tháng tổng thu nhập của gia đình chị từ chăn nuôi, làm mộc đạt 4.500.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua gỗ đầu tư phát triển xưởng mộc của gia đình...
texts.en:
Mrs. Ho Thi V. is 43 years old, she lives with her husband and two small children in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. In 2001, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in livestock raising and in the existing furniture workshop of her husband. The total monthly income of her family from livestock raising and furniture workshop reaches VND4,500,000.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy woods for the furniture workshop of the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy woods for the furniture workshop

loans.name: Juana Rina

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 51 años, tiene cuatro hijos de 28,27,24 y 10 años, los mayores trabajan y él último esta en la escuela.  

Juana llega del Cuzco a los 17 años, con su hermano,  entró a la preparatoria para ingresar a la universidad, para educación inicial, pero su esposo no la dejó estudiar, ni trabajar por que decía que las mujeres tienen que  estar en su casa dedicadas  a cuidar hijos.  Es así como ella pasó su vida, hasta que su esposo le permitió trabajar pero en la puerta de su casa, tiene un negocio de venta de picarones desde hace siete años, pero también aprovecha para vender   entradas como  papa rellena y  causa. 

Desde que esta en Finca recibe  préstamos los cuales  han ayudado mucho para surgir en su negocio, en el Bancomunal pasa tiempos bonitos, sé desestreza.
Juana necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para la compra de descartables, harina, saco de papas.
El sueño de Juana es abrir un restaurante. En su casa, sus vecinos le dicen que tiene buena sazón.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Juana has a life partner and is 51 years old. She has four sons of 28, 27, 24, and 10 years. The older sons work, and the youngest is in school. Juana arrived in Cuzco when she was 17 years old with her brother. She entered school to enroll in the university for education, but her husband did not permit her to study or work because he said that women should be in the house to care for children. This is how she spent her life until her husband allowed her to work from home. For seven years, she has had a business that sells fritters and also starters, such as stuffed potato and causa. Since she has been with Fina, she has received loans that have helped her greatly to succeed in her business. With Bancomunal, the time that passes is beautiful, and she relaxes. Juana needs a loan of $325 to purchase perishables, flour, and a sack of potatoes. Juana’s dream is to open a restaurant. In her home, her neighbors say that she has a good flavor.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishables, flour, and a sack of potatoes.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia SOLEDAD; Está situada en la comunidad de Tambo real en el distrito de Zurite de la provincia de Anta, está ubicado a 1 y 40 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; la socia tiene 24 años, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad.

Nuestra socia alterna sus obligaciones como madre, con la actividad ganadera, ella tiene junto a su conviviente 10 vacas holstein; las cuales le permiten a ella la elaboración casera de productos lácteos como yogurt naturales, manjar blanco, quesos y quesillos, y la distribución de leche fresca natural; la socia quiere invertir el préstamo solicitado en la construcción de su nueva casa, quiere terminar de comprar puertas, marcos, vidrios, entre otros acabados, para mudarse a su casa propia.

Esta socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y ratifica su compromiso de pagar el préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Soledad lives in the community of Tambo Real in the district of Zurite, Anta province, one hour and 40 minutes from the city of Cusco. Soledad is 24 years old and has an 8-year-old son. Soledad is both a mother and raises livestock. She and her partner have 10 Holstein cows from which she makes milk products at home: natural yoghurt, manjar blanco (caramel spread), cheeses. She also distributes fresh natural milk. Soledad wants to invest the loan she is requesting to build a new home: she wants to finish buying doors, doorframes, window panes, among others so that she can move into her own home. Soledad is grateful and appreciates the loan she has been given and reaffirms her commitment to repay the loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors, doorframes, window panes for her new home.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
A 56-year-old widowed individual, Mrs. Agustina A. resides in Polanco, Zambo Norte. She is struggling in her own effort to survive together with her mother. She is blessed with seven offspring but all of them have their own families.

She's been an active member of Paglaum Coop. for almost four years and already has had six loans. Her present economic activity is the growing and selling of rice. Her latest loan is intended to cover the cost of labor during cultivation of her rice farm and for the purchase of fertilizers. She hopes that despite the absence of her late husband, she will be able to provide their basic needs.

loans.use: Labor for rice cultivation and fertilizers

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a widow with eight children. She farms her rented plot with cassava (a starchy vegetable similar to a potato) and groundnuts (peanuts). She will use this loan to purchase these vegetables for planting, buy zinc to cover the roof of her house, and the last part, which is about $20 of the loan, will go towards her farm rent.

This is Pauline's second loan from Kiva partner, GHAPE, since she became a beneficiary in 2007. She has been successful in her farming business in the past and believes she will continue to be so. Pauline thinks she has a good site for her business and she knows that good customer relations keep her business fruitful.

Pauline has faced challenges in her life, including overcoming hunger and poverty. She understands the difficulties facing her customers, too, so when they need her products she is willing to sell them on credit. Pauline plans to put the profits from this loan towards her children’s school fees. She will also help support the older and sick members of her family. Pauline takes out GHAPE loans because she prefers the loan conditions.

More about GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff, and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cassava and groundnuts for planting, zinc for her roof, and pay farm rent

loans.name: Rahimchon

texts.ru: Сулаймонов Рахимчон-мужчина 25 лет. Женат одного ребенка. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Рахимчон также дополнительно ремонтирует легковые автомобили у своего дяди в автосервисе. У Рахимчона дома 2 средних бычка . Рахимчон хочет на полученный займ купит сена и жмых  продать когда они подрастут. Когда Рахимчон на работе жена и мать.
texts.en:
Rahimchon Suleymonov is a 25-year-old man. He is married and has one child. He raises and sells cattle. Rahimchon additionally repairs passenger cars for his uncle's service station. At home, Rahimchon has two medium-sized head of cattle. With the loan he has received, Rahimchon wants to purchase hay and cottonseed oilcake to sell once they are grown. When Rahimchon is at work, wife and mother ...

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: 34-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Linh T. Thị (216) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Linh is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 34-Nam Ngạn (17.08.34). Linh is married and has three school-aged children. Linh owns and operates a business making and selling food. She cooks soup (cháo: a rice product) to sell in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month. In 2008, Linh joined FPW to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from FPW. This previous loan was used to expand her business. Linh is now requesting a new loan of 1,963,500 VND which will be used to expand her business. The loan will be her 2nd loan from FPW. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Ngô Thị Hoa (226) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 1,963,500 VND loan to support her business cooking soup (cháo) to sell. 2. H. Thị Hường (228) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 1,963,500 VND loan to support her business buying medicines to resell in the market. 3. N. Thị Mai (215) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 1,963,500 VND loan to support her business buying many kinds of drink like Coca-Cola, beer, etc. to sell in her village. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Linh T. Thị (216) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Linh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 34-Nam Ngạn (17-08-34). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Linh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Linh kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2008, Linh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Linh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Ngô Thị Hoa (226) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Cô ấy nấu cháo để bán. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. H. Thị Hường (228) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Cô mua thuốc tây để bán. 3. N. Thị Mai (215) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.963.500 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Cô ấy mua nươvs giải khát để bán. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Mrs. Milagrosa M. has been selling snacks in her barangay (village) for almost ten years. Her family is also engaged in farming rice fields. She is 55 years old, married and has six children--some are adults. She is a resident of Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.

Mrs. M. became a member of the Coop in August, 2005 under the micro-finance program of PMPC called PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). During her membership, she has had nine previous loans, the last one for 5,000 PHP. This loan of 5,000 PHP is for buying ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, vanilla, etc. From the profits, she will buy fertilizers and chemicals for her rice field and cover their daily needs, especially for food.

loans.use: Capital for snack vending business

loans.name: Anaceta

texts.en:
Anaceta D. is from the town of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Anaceta is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Anaceta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from engaging in the buying and selling of dried fish in their village. She peddles her product every day. During our visit to Anaceta, her dried fish was already sold out. Anaceta has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. She is hoping for more improvement to her business.

In 2008, Anaceta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anaceta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anaceta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anaceta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel K. has a small boutique and sells shoes and other ladies clothing at Gabi in Kpando. Samuel has received a senior high education.  Samuel has been operating the boutique since 2002. He is responsible for his utility bills and other financial expenses. His loan will be used to buy more of the clothing to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in a different lucrative business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia T. is from the town of Tinaclaan Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Lilia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita R. is from the village of Usocan. She is 34 years old. Rosita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is a 30-year married woman with eight children aged between 8 years and 10 months old. Seven of her children go to school. Zulaika takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in an urban area.

Zulaika owns a taxi, hires a driver, and supervises the vehicle. The taxi operates in Kampala, an urban area. Zulaika has been in this business for one year and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her residence and school fees for her children. Her major challenge is paying for a stage where her vehicle parks.

Zulaika has been with MCDT for six years, is servicing her eighth loan and working with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to put her vehicle in good mechanical condition. Zulaika aspires to buy herself a plot of land.

loans.use: To put her taxi in a good mechanical condition.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: Yet S. is a widower, aged 42. He is a father blessed with two teenaged children who are going to school. He is currently a local teacher for a public school. Yet S. finds it hard commuting to work or anywhere else, because he doesn’t have his own vehicle for his traveling needs. Therefore, he requests a loan to add to his savings to buy a used motor which he will use to ride to school for his teaching job.

loans.use: To buy a used motor which he will use to ride to school for his teaching job.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheng S., age 49, is newly married. She has four children from a previous marriage: two sons and two daughters. Two of them have full-time employment in a restaurant, and other one is a construction worker. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

For 30 years, Chheng has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Chheng is requesting her first loan of $800 in order to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Doña  Candida 46 años de edad, reside en el barrio Raspan Norte en la capital de Managua, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 15 y 19 años los cuales trabajan para apoyarla, se ha dedicado a la venta de cosméticos como: perfúmenes, pinturas, shampoo y otros, vende al contado y al crédito, las dificultades que se le dan es cuando los clientes no pagan entonces pierde su inversión,  cuando inicio lo hizo con fondos en bancos comunales ,lo que mas desea es tener su propia tienda y obtener mejores ingresos. Con este préstamo comparara cosméticos, perfumenes para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad. Una de sus proyectos es poder mejorar su vivienda. Contenta con el financiamiento que la institución ha dado.
texts.en:
Doña Candida is 46 years old and lives in the Raspan Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is a single mother of two children (ages 19 and 15) who also work to support her. Candida sells cosmetics such as perfumes, nail polishes, shampoos, and other products. Her sales are made for cash and on credit. Difficulties arise when she loses money because customers do not pay.

When she started working with communal banks, Candida wanted to open her own shop so that she could generate a better income. With this loan, she will buy cosmetics and perfumes so that she can offer her customers a wider variety. One of her goals is to begin home improvements. She is satisfied with the financing the Institution has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & perfumes

loans.name: Violah Jerotich

texts.en:
Violah is 27 years old, married, and is blessed with one child. She runs a poultry business which is located at Cheplasgei in Eldoret.

Violah was introduced to KADET by a group member. With her loan, she intends to buy chick mash for her poultry. Her dream is to grow her business and be able to educate her child.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy chick mash to feed her poultry

loans.name: Judith Nyanchoka

texts.en:
Judith Nyanchoka B. owns the Swiss Salon where she provides the services of hair weaving, plaiting, manicure, pedicure and blow-drying to walk-ins and her steady clients. Her business challenges are lack of water and inability to pay the rent. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a flat iron, tong and steam machine. Her dream is to open a big training salon and employ more workers.

Judith is married with two children and describes herself as sociable, friendly and honest. She is secretary of a TSS group.

loans.use: To buy a flat iron, tong and steam machine

loans.name: Mrs. Son Hem Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan which consists of fourteen people, is located in Ta Reab Doun Sar village in Kandal province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Son H. is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. H. Keang, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow lotus. In this business, they do not have enough money to expend for growing. Thus, Mrs. Son H. decided to request a loan to grow lotus. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To request a loan to grow lotus.

loans.name: Maria Magadalena

texts.es:
La señora MARIA MAGDALENA MARTINES S. D. G. tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN D. FATIMA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente D. ella. 
Maria se dedica a la compra y venta D. carne, menudencia y fruta. 
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos S. comprò fruta, carne y menudencia al por mayor.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito D. 2,000.00 nuevos S. con los que comprarà carne, pollo, frutas y menudencia al por mayor para posteriormente venderla en la sierra una vez a la semana.
texts.en:
María Magdalena Martines S. D. García is 50. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Virgen D. Fatima Communal Bank. She has a high school education. She is in a common law marriage, and she has two children who are economically dependent upon her. María buys and sells meat, giblets, and fruit. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy fruit, meat, and giblets wholesale. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy meat, chicken, fruit, and giblets wholesale. She will then sell them in the mountains once a week.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, chicken, fruit, and giblets

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Pedro tiene 47 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos que dependen de él: Pedro Antonio tiene 24 años, José Francis y Adrian tiene 9 años. El socio Pedro vive en la ciudad de Pisaq departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Las reuniones de los socios se hace en la ciudad de Calca.  

El socio se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesanías. El socio nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño taller de fabricación de artesanía y también tiene un puesto de venta en la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad de Pisaq. El socio vende artesanía a personas que exportan los productos a los países como Chile, Argentina y Brasil. Ya son 5 a 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para la fabricación de artesanía como pintura, arcilla blanca y pigmentos y para el acabado, barniz, tintes, mates y laca. 
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Community bank member Pedro is 47 years old and is married with three sons who depend on him; Pedro Antonio is 24 years old, and José Francis and Adrian are 9 years old. Pedro lives in the city of Pisaq in the Cusco region and belongs to the community bank "MAMACHA ASUNTA" of the Arariwa association. The meetings of the bank members are held in the city of Calca.

Pedro makes and sells handicrafts. He tells us that he has a small workshop for the fabrication of handicrafts and he also has a stall on the Plaza de Armas in the city of Pisaq. He sells handicrafts to people who export these products to countries such as Chile, Argentina, and Brazil. He has already worked at this business for 5 to 6 years and it has gone very well for him, thanks to all the determination that he puts into his work. He is a hard-working and enterprising father who is advancing his family. He needs the loan to buy more materials for the production of handicrafts, such as paint, white clay and pigments, and for the finishing, varnish, dyes, matte finishes, and lacquer.

Pedro is thankful for the opportunity offered through this means and likewise promises to fulfill the corresponding payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Marciana's Group

texts.en:
