Marciana G. is from the village of Alibago in the Enrile municipality of Cagayan Province. She is 49 years old. Marciana is the group leader of a 10-member group offered a loan by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marciana is married and has four adult-age children. To make a living, Marciana owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Marciana has been engaged in her business for over one year, and she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marciana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciana is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marciana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melania

texts.en: Melania L. is a 59-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Poblacion 1, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living operating her general store and restaurant. Melania’s husband, Teotimo, helps his wife in running the business. They have seven children: some adults and some of school age. The children who are currently going to school also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Melania joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store and restaurant. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000. Melania is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations for her general store, and had a positive impact on both her business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 19,500 for her 13th loan which she intends to use on the general store and restaurant. Melania is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Maria Edi

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sol de Oro” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son independientes.
Maria es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y brinda servicio de atención de una persona mayor de 89 años de edad y también se dedica una su pequeño taller de confección de buzos. Ya son nueve años que participa de los bancos comunales de la Asociación de Arariwa. La socia Maria requiere el préstamo para comprar tela para confeccionar más buzos.
 
La socia Maria se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner Maria belongs to the Golden Sun Community Bank of the Arariwa Association and is 53 years old. She is married and has three grown children. Maria is a hard-working mother and a self-starter who works to support her family. She cares for a 89-year old person and also has a little shop where she sews sweatsuits. She has worked with the community bank of the Association of Arariwa for nine years. Maria wants a loan to purchase fabric to sew more sweatsuits. Maria is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for sewing

loans.name: Minne

texts.en:
Minne C. is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Cosmus with whom she has three children: Lewis, Isabella and Diana.

Minne is a businesswoman who sells secondhand clothes and this is her sixth year in the business. She earns a monthly profit of Ksh 12,000. Her business is in an area called New Market, Malindi and her target customers live in Malindi town. Her other sources of income include her spouse’s salary and they are also in the transport business.

Minne, who is on her third loan with KADET, has borrowed before from another institution and was introduced to KADET by an existing client. With this loan she plans to use Ksh 10,000 on women’s clothes, Ksh 10,000 on children's clothes, and Ksh 7,500 on underwear.

With the extra profit from this loan, Minne plans to complete rental houses she had already started building in Kisumu Ndogo-Malindi. Her future dream is to own a big boutique for new and used clothes in Malindi. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To add to her stock of women's clothes, children's clothes and underware

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: A. Léontine est née en 1960 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à HOLOGAN Etienne, Léontine est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mais Léontine vit seulement avec deux des enfants. La famille s'est installée au quartier Avakpa dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, depuis cinq ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Léontine n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Léontine vend de la nourriture (ignames frits, gâteaux de haricot et bananes frites) à Porto-Novo. Léontine s'approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Léontine a déjà obtenu deux crédits de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Léontine sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé, en vue d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Léontine A. was born in 1960 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Married to Etienne Hologan, Léontine is the mother of four children who are all educated. But Léontine only lives with two of her children. The family has lived in the Avakpa quarter, in Novo-Porto's third district, for five years. Together, the couple takes on the family's various responsibilities. Léontine did not go to school. To meet her needs, she sells food (fried yams, fried bean and banana cakes) in Porto-Novo. Léontine gets her supplies at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. Léontine has already received two loans from ALIDé which she has repaid in full. Faced with increased demand from her ever-growing clientele, she is asking for a third loan from ALIDé. Léontine would like to increase her stock of products and better meet the demand of her clients.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas and yams

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.es: La señora Fátima Maria posee un negocio que es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Ella tiene 33 años de edad madre de 2 hijos que estudian gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su esposo el cual trabaja como taxista. Doña Fátima sale a vender todos los días en su único medio de transporte que es una bicicleta, ella recorro distancias muy largas pero esto no la desanima para salir adelante pues siempre le ha gustado su actividad económica. Ella solicita este financiamiento para el mejoramiento del negocio ya que se aproxima la semana Santa y tiene muchos pedidos. Sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatima Maria selling clothing door-to-door. She is 33 years old and has two children who are studying. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Fatima goes out selling her products every day using her only method of transportation, a bicycle. She travels long distances, but this does not discourage her. She has always strove to succeed and has enjoyed working. She will use the loan to improve her business because Holy Week is coming up and she has many orders. She dreams of improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Laura Jose

texts.pt:
Laura José N. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos de 14, 10 e 04 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Licenciou na Universidade Pedagógica, ainda pretende dar continuidade com os seus estudos. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo com seus pais ainda muito jovem, tendo começado a trabalhar e iniciou com a construção da sua própria residência. Trabalha como docente na escola primária completa 1 de Junho ha mais de 15 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 11.430.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta Bancária (Barclays).
Ja teve empréstimos no Banco comercial “Millenium Bim” e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e abrir uma creche para servir a crianças e aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Laura José N. was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 37 years old, single, and has 3 children ages 14, 10 and 4. The two older children attend school. She has a degree from the Teachers University and would like to continue her studies. She lives in her own home with her children and she supports two brothers who live with her. She left Manjacaze for Maputo with her parents when she was very young. She started working and began building her own home. She has worked as a teacher in the 1 de Junho elementary school for more than 15 years and is part of the Ministry of Education. She does not have any employees, and her salary is 11.430.00mt per month, which she uses for her household expenses and saves a bit sometimes in her Barclays Bank account. She has taken out loans with the commercial bank "Millenium Bim" and decided not to continue. She learned about Hluvuku through work colleagues who are also Hluvuku customers. This is her first loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials (concrete block, sand, iron, etc.) to continue the construction of her home. She promises to pay the loan as agreed to have access to other loans. In the future she plans to ask for additional loans to finish her home and to open a daycare for infants and increase her family income.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construciton materials (concrete block, sand, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Sharol's Group

texts.en:
Sharol D. C. is from the village of Manaoag, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Sharol is the group leader of a 12-member group taking out a loan from ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Sharol is married and has three young children. To make a living, Sharol owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Sharol has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP monthly.

In 2007, Sharol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sharol is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Sharol from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: 17 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Panamericana, se reúne la Asociación Comunal 17 OCTUBRE, con 11 integrantes 
Una de las integrantes y presidenta  es Petronila A., de 49 años administra una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, cuenta con éste negocio hace 15 años el mismo le ha generado ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia ya que cuenta con 3 hijos, Petronila necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, específicamente tarjetas para llamadas.  
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con diversos negocios como la venta de pescado, tejido de manoplas, taller de bicicletas, costura de prendas de vestir, tejido de mantas, elaboración de pan, venta de zapatos y venta de ropa,  necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
In one of the central offices of “Pro Mujer Panamericana”, the 11 members of the communal association "17 Octubre" met. One of the members, and also the president, is Petronila A.. She is 49 years old and the administrator of a neighborhood store located within her home. She has owned this business for the past 15 years. The store has given her the income to cover the family expenses for her 3 children. Petronila requires the loan in order to acquire merchandise, specifically calling cards. The women members of this group have a variety of businesses: selling fish, knitting mittens, repairing bicycles, sewing articles of clothing, knitting blankets, making bread, selling shoes and selling clothing. They need the loan in order to acquire merchandise or raw materials according to which business they have.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Kituura Youth Development Group- Ibanda

texts.en:
Operating a food selling business has really transformed his life. This kind of business requires hard work and this young man has fortunately lived up to that billing. Having been encouraged by his fellow friends running businesses, T. Godfrey took the initiative and started this business four years ago in Kituura, Ibanda. His business has steadily been earning this 28-year-old dividends: it has been bringing him 50,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis.

Being a married father of two children, Godfrey has been able to cater for his family requirements including food and meeting the school fees of his children. This loan will enable him to expand his business through buying more cash crops like millet and maize for resale . This will enable him to earn more revenue in the long run.

loans.use: To purchase more produce like maize and millet to resale

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 3 est d’une Association  de femmes mariées du village de Djigonso de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 48 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement la  culture  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé  leur  prêt solidaire,  elles ont décidé de virer au prêt de campagne d'où leur premier prêt de campagne.
Djeneba Soukoulé compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz, des petits équipements et des intrants pour se rassurer d’une bonne récolte. 
Les achats se font  exclusivement  au grand marché de Bla ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Bla ,Yangasso et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is a credit association made up of married women from the Djigonso village in the San municipality, Segou region (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional households and are around 48 years old with 4 children. This group of women primarily cultivate peanuts for a living. In order to generate greater profits from their agricultural activities, the members of the group have decided to seek a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. They have already repaid their first loan, and so have decided to seek a second loan, which will be the first loan of their current campaign. Djeneba Soukoulé aims to use the loan to purchase an adequate quantity of rice grain, small tools and other inputs in order to secure a good harvest. The purchases are exclusively from the large Bla town market. After wintering the plants, the harvest is stocked for a while so that they might rise in value before being sold at Bla, Yangasso and in the other markets. They are sold for cash individually or in bulk to a customer base mainly in large towns. The members of the group aim to generate a profit of 25,000 FCFA which will be utilised to repay the loan and to meet their families' costs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, grain and small tools

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a widow. She lives with her daughter, who is disabled. Tatyana sells women's clothing at the central market in Kherson city. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. 

Tatyana is a very disciplined and responsible person. She knows her market sector and buys items that sell well. Tatyana would like to borrow 15,000 Ukraine Hryvnia (UAH) to purchase more inventory for her business and increase the sales.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rodina

texts.en:
Rodina S. is from the village of North Poblacion, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 23 years old. Rodina is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Rodina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rodina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rodina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rodina is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rodina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to increase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Riaz is a resident of Lahore, which is the second largest city in Pakistan and very famous for its culture and history. She is a 48-year-old housewife who lives in a three-room brick house with her husband and four children. All three of her sons have left school and have jobs in the factory.

Riaz’s husband has a business selling chicken meat. The demand for chicken increases in Ramadan season (the holy month when Muslims keep fast) so, in order to sell the desired amount of chicken meat, he needs to buy chicken in sufficient quantity. Therefore, Riaz has applied for a loan from Asasah to enable her husband to expand his business. She is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business with the help of this investment and his income will be increased.

Riaz’s only daughter is 17 years old and stays at home and manages the household chores. Riaz wants to marry her as she comes to marriageable age, for which she has started collecting dowry. She is very confident that the improvement of her husband’s business will help her in marrying her daughter.

Riaz  is on her 3rd loan and is a very responsible loan user of Asasah. She has maintained good credit behavior and has never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To purchase chickens in large quantity for her husband's business

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 25, is a garment factory laborer who sews clothes. S. has a life partner in her husband who is a metal polisher. He owns a machine to provide his service. The couple lives with two young children who attend the local public school. 

S. has been hiring taxis at a high price for the purpose of traveling. She is hoping to cut down this cost and is requesting a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring taxis. 

Note: Mrs. S. was busy at work when the photograph was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en:
Rawya is a mother of two daughters and two sons: Yousef, Amro, Suhair and Hadeel, her sons and daughters age between 20-25 years old, Yousef works in a bank while Amro works in a restaurant. Rawya's husband is a National Palestinian Authority employee.

Rawya started her small project at home, she rented a shop to sell chickens for the neighborhood, Rawya received a $1,000 loan from FATEN to purchase a larger number of chicken and increase her profit. Rawya dreams of having a family business where her husband, sons and daughters work with her and help her grow the project bigger.

Rawya's son Yousef appear in the picture here as Rawya doesn't want to have her picture online.

loans.use: Purchase chicken

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: Gulbahor K. is 40 years old. Her husband currently is working in Russia. Gulbahor is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Ten years ago, she got an idea to start raising the cattle to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Slowly, the number of cows increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, Gulbahor has finally decided to increase the number of livestock she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $1,500. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es: La Sra. Palmira vive en la localidad de el Torno, es nacida en la provincia Florida, de los valles cruceños, se dedica a la venta de patos, gallina, chancho, otros animales domésticos en el mercado de la comunidad, hace tres año que se dedica a esta actividad, vive en la casa de su hermana, ya que es separada de su esposo, no tiene hijos pequeño, el destino del crédito es para comprar animales, ya que se acerca las fiestas de fin de año y muchas personas compran pavos para la fiestas navideñas, también perritos y gatitos para regalar como mascotas,  esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Palmira lives in El Torno.  She was born in Florida province, in the Santa Cruz valley.  She sells ducks, chickens, pigs and other domestic animals in her community’s market.  She has been in this line of work for three years.  She lives in her sister’s house because she’s separated from her husband.  She does not have little children.

The loan will be used to buy animals because the end of year festivities are approaching and many people buy turkeys for Christmas as well as kittens and puppies to give away as pets.

She is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy domestic animals.

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
ESTA CLIENTA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE A SU CARGO  HIJOS LOS CUALES A CRIADO CON EL ESFUERZO DE SU TRABAJO CON LA VENTA DE LECHE POR LAS MAÑANA Y LA VENTA DE ROPA AMBULANTE .
EL CREDITO LO ESTA SOLICITANDO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA YA QUE SE APROXIMA LA TEMPORA ALTA QUE ES LA DE NAVIDA Y QUIERE SURTIR SU MERCADERIA TAMBIEN PARA AUMENTAR LA ENTA DE LECHE Y SUS DERIBADOS COMO QUESO Y CUAJADA.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother with children under her care whom she has worked hard to raise thanks to her jobs selling milk in the mornings and also selling clothing. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies because her busy season, Christmastime, is approaching and she wants to stock up on merchandise. She also plans to expand her milk sales to other dairy products like cheese and curds.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and milk products

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma has applied for a loan to expand her clothing sales business. She purchases clothes from Multan, which is famous for its embroidered clothes, and sells them to her neighborhood clients. She started this business four years ago and is hopeful that an additional investment will grow her business further, making her more income than before. 
Her husband is a poorly paid government employee. She has three children: two sons and a daughter. Her two elder children are getting their education while the youngest one has not started attending school yet. 
She lives in Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area named Civil Lines. She shifted here after her marriage to A. M. 13 years ago. 
This will be her third loan with Asasah. Previously, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Decsy Rossany

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Decsy,  ella tiene 38 años de edad y es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 18,16,  15 y 8 años, los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor aun en escuela. Nos cuenta que es una tarea muy dura ser padre y madre a la vez pero que siempre trata de hacer lo posible para que sus hijos tengan una muy buena educación.

Ella se dedica a la producción y comercialización de dulces, trabaja cuatro días en la semana, en las  mañanas se levanta a las 5am a preparar los dulces, una vez preparados los entrega a comerciantes que se los llevan a vender a Tosagua, Chone y otros cantones, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor.
 
Este crédito es para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para la fabricación de los dulces. Es fundadora del  Banco Comunal y está muy contenta ya que gracias a los créditos ha mejorado su negocio y ha salido adelante con sus hijos. Su sueño siempre han sido tener una microempresa con maquinarias para producir mayor cantidad de dulces.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the 'Mujeres Trabajadoras' (Hard-Working Women) community bank meets in Rocafuerte canton.  This area is known for the delicious desserts and sweets which its residents produce and which are known throughout the country.

Here we meet 38 year-old Decsy.  She is a single mother and has 4 children aged 18, 16, 15 and 8.  The three eldest are in school but the youngest is not yet in school.  She tells us that it is a very difficult job being both father and mother to her children but that she always tries to do everything she can so that her children have a very good education.

Decsy makes and sells sweets.  She works four days every week.  In the mornings she gets up at 5.00am to make her sweets.  Once they are ready she delivers them to salespeople who take them to sell in Tosagua, Chone and other cantons.  Her children help her in her work.

This loan will be used to buy the necessary ingredients for making her sweets.  Decsy is a founding member of her community bank and she is very happy because thanks to the loans she has been able to improve her business and get her children ahead in life.  Her dream has always been to have a small business with machinery so that she can make more sweets.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make sweets

loans.name: Teodosa

texts.en:
Teodosa is fifty-six years old.  She is a single mother and she lives alone with her sixteen-year-old daughter.  The family owns their home, which is located in the zone of San Miguel Alto Cruceta in the district of Tambogrande.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers.

Teodosa raises animals in corrals behind and around her home.  She has a number of cattle and sheep.  These animals she raises for meat and milk depending on the age and season.  In addition, she sells beer out of her home.  She attends to her small store  on Saturdays, Sundays, Mondays, and Tuesdays.

Teodosa has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past.  She has a good credit history and has always used her loans in a responsible manner.  She has requested this loan in order to expand her inventory of beer.  She hopes to grow her business and perhaps one day become a distributor.  She finds the profitability vs. risk is lower with the beer sales and therefore would like to increase the amount of investment in that activity.  She is a proud mother and a happy businesswoman.  We at Edpyme Alternativa are thankful for the opportunity to be able to work with women like Teodosa.

loans.use: Expand her inventory of beer

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.en:
Jyldyzkan A., 35, is an entrepreneurial woman who lives with her family in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She has four children aged four to ten and her husband works at the local state office as an accountant. In order to support her husband in covering all the family expenses, Jyldyzkan decided to start her own cattle breeding business. With 13,000 KGS as starting capital, she managed to develop a farm with four cows, forty sheep, five goats and five horses. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses.

Jyldyzkan plans to use this loan of 30,000 KGS to buy more cattle. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to expand her business and build a barn for her cattle.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. It uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Karem Lisbeth

texts.es:
Karem Lisbeth G. C. tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  No Tiene hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Klever Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un mejor nivel de vida.

Le gusta hacer ejercicios
texts.en:
Karem Lisbeth G. C. is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the Ventanas district of Los Ríos province.  She is single and doesn't have any children.

The members of Tierra Nuestra V.R.C. (rural loan group) are located in San Luís de Zapotal, an area in Ventanas. The group consists of 14 members who farm maize and rice during the short planting season. 

Karem is a farmer and plants maize and rice. She buys inputs from Ecua-Agro and sells her harvest there as well. She is requesting this loan to buy seed and supplies. The income generated through this loan will help her cover her basic expenses. Karem struggles with pests, crop diseases, and the unpredictable weather. Karem enjoys exercise and her dream is to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and supplies.

loans.name: Paulus

texts.en:
Paulus is a-46-year old man who is married to Yuke. They have been blessed with 6 children. They are:  Anggi, a 17 year old senior high school student; Marten, a 15 year old junior high school student; Ningsih, a 13 year old junior high school student; Eka, 9 years old elementary school student; Yessy, who is aged 4 years and Yastin who is 2 years old.
 
Paulus is a man who does not easily give up. Although many problems have happened in his life, he always deals with positive thoughts. To make a living, Paulus runs a small kiosk business. This is the main income source for his family. Paulus realizes that the income generated from his kiosk is limited as a result of the limited capital that he has. As a responsible father, Paulus wants to provide his children with access to school. He wants them to have a bright future. 

Paulus wanted to improve his kiosk but he did not have enough capital to do it. He ever tried to borrow from a cooperative with daily repayment. But there was no improvement in his business as the profit was used to pay the installments. Paulus then heard about TLM’s individual lending program and got interested in joining the program due to the monthly repayment system and achievable interest rate. He is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. He plans to use the loan to buy more stocks to sell at his kiosk.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell at his kiosk

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 56-year old single woman who supports her family by operating a business venture: buying & selling ready to wear clothing. She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Delia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 30000, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she could continue to save up for the future to improve living conditions. Delia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Provide additional working capital

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe LAFIA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. AMI D. fait le commerce de pagnes wax – real et tissus dans ce groupe de femmes LAFIA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  13 pièces de pagnes wax – real et 20kg de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso. Elle les revend au  marché de Kamalen Sirakoro, de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 57.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The group LAFIA has five members who are married women. They all have around 38 year-old and about 4 children. Most of them live within polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro; one of the popular district of the city of Sikasso. Sikasso is the third administrative region of Mali. The women are applying to their fourteenth loan with the microfinance instiution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their clients. Their past loans have been paid off. In this group of women, Madam Ami D. sells pagnes wax-real; a printed type of cloth and other cloth. She is planning of buying 13 pieces of pagnes wax-real and 20Kg of cloth with the loan. She gets her supplies at Sikasso's main market and sells at Kamalen Sirakoro's market with her family as an itinerant salesman. Her clients are men and women who pay cash. She plans of making a monthly profit of 57.000CFA. A part will be use to pay her family's daily expenditures, the other part will be saved. She wants to increase sales to better satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To buy pagnes wax-real, a printed type of cloth and other cloth

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a Ready to Wear (RTW) clothing business and a general store.  She lives in Lapu-Lapu, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Ready to Wear (RTW) and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Josefina De Jesus

texts.es:
Josefina de 15 años, es una mujer trabajadora que se inspiro en trabaja en ventas por catálogos de Yanbal por medio de su hermana que la incentivo que se inscribiera para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.

En la actualidad ella trabaja diariamente haciendo visitas a amigos y conocidos ofreciéndoles sus productos, realiza limpieza facial gratis y muestras de perfumes para obtener mayor volumen en las ventas.

Con el préstamo ella desea invertir en su mercadería la venta de perfumes para la mejora de su negocio. Una sus metas es llegar a ser Directora de Yanbal.
texts.en:
15 year old Josefina is a hardworking woman who was inspired by her sister to sell products from the Yanbal catalog so that she could improve her life and that of her family.
She currently works everyday, making visits to friends and acquaintances to offer them her products, give free facials, and demonstrate her perfumes so  that she will have a greater volume of sales.
She wants to use the loan to invest in more perfume supplies and improve her business. One of her dreams is to become director of Yanbal.

loans.use: to buy perfumes

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 60 years old and married. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for vegetables.

Edna has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to do some improvement of her livelihood and business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for vegetable garden.

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Dul N., 42, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known as one of Pre-Angkorean Temples. N. sells bananas, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 60 on other necessary expenses. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a tuk-tuk (three-wheeled motorized rickshaw) for one of her children to start a new business as a tuk-tuk driver. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a tuk-tuk for the children to start a new business.

loans.name: Edlie

texts.en:
Edlie Lapitan is married with four children. She is 47 years old and had a food selling business for five years.

Edlie sells food like Halo- Halo (a dessert or refreshment made of crushed ice mixed with milk and fruits) and barbecue to their village. Edlie has been in the business for five years.

Edlie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients like meat and soy sauce for barbecue and other fruit ingredients for halo-halo and refreshments.

In the future, Edlie hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for barbecue and for refreshment

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran operates a milk-selling business at her home. She keeps a buffalo for this purpose. She gets up early in the morning, milks her buffalo and sells to her community clients. Her husband is a clerk in a government organization. Manzooran has given birth to three children. Her eldest son operates a catering business while the other two are studying in a local school. 

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her son’s catering business. With the loan, he will buy catering items like tables, table covers, crockery, etc., to be able to fulfill his customers' needs and make more profit. He started doing this business some time ago, and Manzooran is hopeful that an investment will help him improve his business. 

Manzooran is a regular user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Manzooran.

loans.use: to buy catering items for a catering business.

loans.name: Irma Eudoxie

texts.fr:
B. est une cliente de Hope Congo âgée de 45ans célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont varie de 14ans à 22ans. par manque de soutien financier elle laisse ses études en classe de 5e et se lance dans la vente des sandales en gros comme en détail en 1992 avec un capital de 100.000frs CFA.

avec ce prêt elle aimerait renforcer son stock en achetant des sandale hommes, femmes et enfant.

elle a pour stratégie d'offrir des prix hors taxes à ses client afin de mieux attirer la clientèle. son souhait est de pouvoir être grossiste.

son ambition est d'acheter une parcelle et construire pour le bien être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
B. is a client of Hope Congo. She is 45 years old, single and the mother of two children, 14 and 22 years of age. Due to lack of financial support, she was not able to finish high school. In 1992, she started selling sandals, wholesale and retail, with a starting capital of 100,000 West African francs.
With this loan she would like to replenish her stock by buying more sandals for men, women, and children.

Her strategy is to offer tax-free prices   in order to attract more customers. She would like to be able to work as a wholesaler. Her goal is to buy a land plot and have a home built, for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted sandals

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
Rula is a young woman from Hebron and a mother of three daughters and three sons. All Rula's children are school students. Rula took out a loan from FATEN to paint the walls and fix the water pipes in the kitchen and bathroom.

The loan will help Rula fix her house and ease life for Rula and her children.

loans.use: to pay for painting the walls and fix kitchen and bathroom water pipes.

loans.name: Sidney's Communal Bank Group

texts.en:
Sidney, 39, is the president of this communal bank located in the city of San Lorenzo in northwest Ecuador. He lives with his wife and three children. His oldest child is 11, the middle one is 9, and the youngest is 4. Sidney is a good person who is responsible in both his family and his business. He likes to share what he has with others. 

Sidney’s business is a clothing store and he is seeking this loan to buy more merchandise to stock his store. He began his business by selling perfume and footwear. After six months, he began selling clothing as well. He has been able to hire one person named Jairo who helps Sidney every day. 

This is his first time soliciting a loan and he hopes that it will help improve his clothing orders and help him cover the costs of his children’s education. His dream is to see his business grow and be able to compete with the larger clothing stores in San Lorenzo. He also dreams of more education for himself as well as for his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to expand his clothing store's offerings.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.en:
Zoraida lives in a place where people are very happy since the town has two patron saints: Saint Antonio of Padua and Saint Antonio. She is married to Adiel and they have two children who are already married.

Zoraida buys and sells cheese.  She also buys coffee which she later sells in the same town.  She has been in this business for ten years and tells us that it is doing well since she makes a good income for her household.  For this reason, she continues working.  She has the support of her husband who works on the land.

Zoraida was motivated to work by her family.  In order to make a little more income, she had to have a business activity which would enable her to help and continue supporting her children who studied to become teachers.  With the help of God she has achieved this.

What Zoraida would most like is to use this loan so that she can continue working and getting ahead in life since it is through selling her cheese that she supports herself and makes income.

This group is called 'Las Perlas' and has three members.  The other two members are María Elisa, who buys live chickens which she later sells dressed and Oscar Alberto who will invest his loan in buying merchandise to stock his grocery store.

Translated from Spanish:

   La señora Zoraida,  vive en un lugar donde la gente es muy alegre ya que en su localidad hay dos santos San Antonio de Padua, y san Antonio, ella es casada con el señor Adiel y con quien procreo dos hijos quienes  ya están casados 

    Ella se dedica a la compra y elaboración de quesos, como también la compra de café para luego venderlo en el mismo municipio, en esta actividad lleva diez años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso en su hogar y por ello lo sigue trabajando, a u así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  quien trabajo en el campo.

    Ella lo motivo su familia ya que para tener un poco mas de ingresos, tenía que tener una  actividad en a que  se pueda ayudar y seguir apoyando sus hijos que estudio para maestro y con la ayuda de dios lo ha logrado.

    Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo  pueda seguir trabajando para seguir adelante ya que  con la venta de quesos es con lo que apoya para tener sus ingresos. 

     El grupo se llama las perlas y  se integra de tres personas y estas son los que hacen falta: María Elisa quien se dedica a la compra de pollos de rancho para luego venderlo aliñado y Oscar Alberto quien  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: to buy cheese and coffee.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is single and has no children yet. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for five years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy trousers to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, diversify to a transport business. He also sees himself married and taking care of his family.  He describes himself as hardworking, honest and resilient.

loans.use: to purchase trousers to sell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 50 years old, and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by buying and selling recycled waste. 

Thuy has supported her family by running a general store in front of her house for over three years. She sells daily necessities like milk, candies, snacks, washing-up liquid, and other things. She would like to expand her business to increase her income. Thuy plans to take a loan to buy basic goods such as detergent, shampoo, spices, sugar, and beverages. This will enable her to sell a greater range of goods from her general store and better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy different items to sell such as detergent, shampoo, spices, sugar, and beverages.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia de 41 años de edad, habita en su propia casa ubicada en zona urbana, con su esposo Ramón de 40 años y sus 2 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Juana se dedica  a la venta de ropa y sandalias para dama. Es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual hace todo por su familia. Para ella los días de vacaciones no existen ya que no pierde oportunidad ni tiempo para trabajar. Desde ya hace varios años que posee este negocio y gracias a Dios, empeño y creatividad en los negocios ha logrado mantenerlo activo hasta el momento. Cada día los clientes la prefieren más ya que ella siempre está un paso delante de la competencia. Siempre busca la forma de mantener lo más nuevo en el mundo de la moda en cuanto a ropa y sandalias. Todo esto ha hecho que Juana tome la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir, de tal modo que los cliente puedan encontrar todo lo que buscan y cada día sus clientela se vea aumentada. Con el crédito piensa comprar variedad de prendas de vestir para dama ya que es la que más se vende tales como: variedad de sandalias, blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, y de más artículos que a los clientes les parezca atractivos. Con todo esto espera que su situación económica y la de su familia se vean mejoradas.
texts.en: Juana Antonia is 41 and lives in her own home, which is located in an urban area.  She lives with her husband, Ramón, who is 40, and her 2 children, who go to school.  Juana sells women’s clothing and sandals.  She is very hard-working and does everything for her family.  Vacation days don’t exist for her because she doesn’t want to lose the opportunity or time to work.  She has had this business for several years, and thanks to God and her effort and creativity in business, she has succeeded in keeping in active.  Every day her customers prefer her more, and she is always a step ahead of the competition.  She is always looking for a way to stock the newest styles in clothing and sandals.  All of this has made Juana decide to request a loan from Integral to invest in her business and the purchase of a variety of clothes.  That way, her customers can find everything that they are looking for, and she can increase her clientele.  With this loan, she is planning to buy women’s clothing, since that is what she sells the most of, including:  sandals, blouses, skirts, pants, underwear, and other items that her customers will like.  She hopes that by doing this, her and her family’s economic situation will improve.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sandals, blouses, skirts, pants, and underwear

loans.name: Bear The Weather Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Bear The Weather” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of previous SMT/Kiva lenders loans, they were able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting for a new loan of 500,000.00 SLL for each in order to further expand their businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Born in the village of Makump, Isatu is 48 years of age. She is married to a security guard and the couple has 6 children – 1 in primary school, 2 in college and the rest are no longer attending school. Isatu sells pepper and onions. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy bags of pepper and bags of onions to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of peppers and onions to add to her business

loans.name: Jerome

texts.fr:
Jerome est né au Rwanda et il a 29 ans. Il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de secondaire. 

Jerome est transporteur (il a un taxi moto). C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter un taxi vélo moteur pour le transport. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de travailler beaucoup plus, jusqu'à ce qu’il peut même acheter de la moto.
Dans les prochaines années, Jerome voudrait finaliser les études universitaires. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’aider sa famille de se développer. Jerome est aussi salarie.
texts.en:
Jerome was born in Rwanda and is 29 years old. He is single. He attended secondary school for 6 years. 

Jerome provides transport services (he has a motorcycle taxi). This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle taxi for transportation.

He intends to grow his business by working much harder, until he is able to buy more motorcycles.
In the coming years, Jerome would like to complete his university studies. He will use his profits to help his family grow. Jerome also has a fixed salary.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle taxi for transportation

loans.name: Lucilo

texts.en:
Lucilo is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 
Lucilo has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. He has run this business for five years. He has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.
Lucilo has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяне нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы расширить ассортимент осенних и зимних шарфов.
Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Татьяна, увеличив ассортимент, смогла получить дополнительную прибыль.
Она провела газ и воду в свой дом, помогла детям с учебой в колледже. Благодаря своему бизнесу Татьяна оказывает финансовую помощь своей племянице.
texts.en: Tatyana needs additional funds to expand the assortment of autumn and winter scarves.  Thanks to the previous loan, Tatyana was able to expand her goods assortment and make an additional profit.  She was able to bring gas and water to her house and helped her children with their college education.  Thanks to her business, Tatyana provides financial assistance to her niece.

loans.use: to expand the assortment of autumn and winter scarves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 27 years old. He is married and has two children, who live in his own house with four family members in Karuguuza, Uganda. His goal is to have a self-sustaining family. He has been in the business of buying and selling cattle for three years. He faces the challenge of inflation in the Ugandan market today. His dream is to own a ranch. Charles needs a loan to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia, 42, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow with one child. She, together with her child, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Amelia maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are receiving as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy merchandise for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Amelia fervently hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise for her customers

loans.name: Samaki Shg Group

texts.en:
Hudson is the facilitator of the Samaki SHG group. Hudson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Hudson takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Hudson had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 13 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Hudson was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hudson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Hudson will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Samaki SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Hudson is pictured with his group members and the field officer, far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  BALIMAYA  sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  FATOUMATA en troisième position à partir de la droite fait le commerce de friperie.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une balle de friperie qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Médine à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group called  BALIMAYA  are essentially married women with an average age of 31 and on average four children. They mostly live in monogamous families in  HAMDALLAYE, one of the working class districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 

They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. Madame FATOUMATA standing third from the right sells used clothing. 

She intends to buy a bale of used clothing with her loan amount and she will resell it retail at the market of Médine in Sikasso and within her extended family, to a clientele of men and women, on a cash basis.  

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA of which a part will be used to pay off the loan and its interest and the rest will be put aside as savings.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Easy People Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Easy People” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking loans of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standards of living.

The leader of this group is Osman. Osman, 35, was born in Lunsar and is married with three children. He and his wife sell used clothes and their children are attending primary school. Osman has been a businessman for ten years. With this loan, he will expand his business by buying a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, sand, and cement in order to begin work mounting the concrete

loans.name: Maria Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 40 años, se considera una persona luchadora, humilde, emprendedora y responsable. Vive con sus tres hijos en Machachi en la provincia de Pichincha.

María trabaja sola en la venta de comidas rápidas ambulantes, es muy importante su trabajo ya que es la única fuente de ingresos para ella y sus tres hijos entonces tiene que poner todo el esfuerzo y dedicación. Es el cuarto crédito que realiza a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de dos tanques de gas y un coche para venta de carnes asadas, inversión que le permitirá dar variedad a sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida.

El sueño de María es crecer continuamente con su negocio gracias a Dios.
texts.en:
Maria is a 40 year old woman who is considered a responsible, enterprising, modest and hardworking person. She lives with her three children in Machaci in Pichincha Province.

María works alone as a street vendor selling fast food. Her work is very important since it is the only source of income for her and her three children. Consequently it requires all her effort and dedication. This is her fourth loan from Fodemi and she will use it to purchase two tanks of gas and a cart with a gas cooker so she can sell grilled meat, an investment that will enable her to provide variety to her clients, earn a higher income and improve her quality of life.

María’s dream is to continue growing her business with God’s help.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying two tanks of gas and a cart with a gas cooker to prepare grilled meat.

loans.name: Wangninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Georgette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Georgette est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un certain Simon. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Georgette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Georgette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Georgette exerce comme activité, la vente de crevettes, ails et piments de façon ambulante. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Georgette désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Georgette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs d'ails et de crevettes.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin is a mechanic since 16 years ago, he has 4 very young children and his family lives in San Juanito Chihuahua. He has a small mechanical factory, his pleasure for that area began since he was a boy, for that reason Fermin works so motivated and happiness. One of his worst worries is give a good education to his children and for that reason he works very hard every day.

The Fermin\'s biggest son is 16 years old and helps him in the factory in his free time, by this way the business has also become a place where the family is involved. He needs a loan of $1375 USD for the purchase of a forage machine, because is coursing the season of seeds gathering and Fermin is looking for a new business like he can rent the machine. He and his family expect your help and they thank your generosity. In a term of three month Fermin plans to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Fermin es un mecánico desde hace 16 años, tiene 4 hijos muy jóvenes y su familia vive en San Juanito Chihuahua. Tiene un pequeño taller mecánico, su gusto por la mecánica comenzó desde que era niño, por lo que Fermin desempaña su trabajo con mucho entusiasmó y alegría. Lo que más le preocupa, es darles una buena educación a sus hijos por lo que Fermin trabaja muy duro todos los días.

El hijo más grande de Fermin tiene 16 años y ayuda en el taller de su papá en sus tiempos libres, por lo que el negocio también se ha convertido en un lugar de convivencia familiar. El necesita un préstamo de $1375 USD para la compra de una maquina de forraje, ya que esta en curso la temporada de recolección de semillas y Fermin busca un nuevo negocio al rentar esta maquina. El y su familia esperan de tu ayuda y agradecen tu generosidad. En un término de tres meses Fermin planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a forage machine

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married with two children. Eight years ago she decided to start a business selling construction supplies when a difficult financial situation in the family forced her to look for a stable source of income. Today Olena rents a small store in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk and three vending kiosks in the local market. She currently has about $6,000 in working capital and her monthly net profit amounts to $1,200. She is the only breadwinner in the family. Olena is a focused hard-worker. Her experience in the construction supply trade and reasonable pricing policy has helped to keep her business stable for many years. Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have also had a big part in the consistent growth of Olena’s business. She has taken out and repaid a total of 15 loans. Recently, she was able to open three new vending kiosks in the market with financing from a loan. One of Olena’s long term plans is to rent another more spacious vending facility in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Olena would like to get a loan of $1,200 to purchase 20 fillet sets (200 items each) to sell in her stores. This financial assistance will help Olena increase her sales and grow her business as a result. Not only will it help her get the necessary inventory and attract more customers, but it will help Olena meet the needs of her family and provide a better livelihood for them.

Олена – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вісім років тому вона вирішила почати власний бізнес з продажу будівельних матеріалів, до чого її спонукало скрутне фінансове становище родини. Олена орендує невеличку крамничку в центрі Івано-Франківську, до того ж має три торгівельні точки на місцевому ринку. В неї зараз приблизно 6000 доларів робочого капіталу, щомісячний прибуток складає 1200 доларів. Вона одна забезпечує родину. Олена наполеглива та працьовита. Багатий досвід торгівлі в цій сфері та помірні ціни сприяли стабільному зростанню її бізнесу на протязі цих років. Позики від «Надії України» також відіграли неабияку роль в розширенні бізнесу Олени. Вона отримала та сплатила 15 позик. Завдяки фінансовій підтримці вона нещодавно мала змогу відкрити три нових торгівельних точки. В майбутньому Олена планує розширити власний бізнес та орендувати ще одне торгівельне приміщення в центрі міста. Олена хотіла б отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того щоб придбати 20 сортів багет (по 200 штук) для продажу у крамничці. Фінансова підтримка сприятиме збільшенню обсягів продажу та зростанню бізнесу Олени. Позика не тільки допоможе їй придбати необхідний товар та привабити більше покупців, але й забезпечить нагальні потреби її родини, якісно покращуючи рівень життя кожного з них.

loans.use: To purchase 20 fillet sets

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is one of the wives of her husband, and she has five children. With the polygamous background, she has had her own share of difficulties, including ill health. Pains from memories of her inability to buy medication for herself and her kids motivated her to take her first investment loans of $40 from GHAPE in 2005.

Given the moral support of her children and her experience in pig-farming business and the demand for pork, with a loan of $200she plans to buy 5 piglets and some pig feed.

With this increase stock, she will provide restaurant services, manure, meat, and a social relaxing and drinking place for her community.

loans.use: Selling of snacks, palm wine, and pig farming

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
As she was unable to afford school fees, Miss Afi G., 23, had to abandon her studies and learned sewing instead. Her mother's income does not permit her to purchase a sewing machine. Her father is an unemployed cook who also cannot help his daughter financially.

Having now reached the end of her training, Miss G. is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a sewing machine and set herself up in business. This will allow her to earn her own living and be financially independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 23 ans, Mlle G. Afi a du abandonner ses études fautes de moyens financiers pour apprendre la couture. Les revenus de l’activité de sa mère ne lui permet pas d’acheter une machine et son père un cuisiner sans emploi n’a pas les moyens nécessaires.

A la fin de sa formation, Mlle G. Afi sollicite un apport financier de $600 pour s’acheter une machine à coudre afin de s’installer. Ceci lui permettra de faire face à ses dépenses et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine and opening of a tailor shop

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim N., 55, lives with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a small stall selling pickled radish and beans to the people in her area, where together they can typically make around $6 each day. This couple is humbly requesting for a loan to purchase radishes from someone’s plantation so that they will resell them at a very good price.

loans.use: To purchase radishes from someone’s plantation so that they can resell them at a very good price.

loans.name: Marlin Joselinda

texts.es:
Yo me dedico a la venta de ropa de niños y adultos. Este negocio lo tengo hace 6 años. Yo vendo en oficnas y casas que visito a las amas de casa. Tengo varios pedidos porque se aserca la navidad por eso me urge el dinero para poder comprar lo que me hace falta, y  no quiero fallarles a mis clientes. El unico ingreso que tengo son lo de las ventas de la ropa. Soy madre soltera y tengo dos hijs que mantener.

ព្រឹតិ្តការណ៍បច្ចុប្បន្ន៖ របាយការណ៍ថ្មីៗពីប្រទេសកម្ពុជា
កិច្ចព្រមព្រៀងប្រទេសជប៉ុន និងវៀតណាម
ក្រុមអភិរក្សបិរស្ថានប្រឆាំងនឹងគំរោងសាងសង់វារីអគ្គិសនីរបស់ឡាវ

loans.use: compra de pantalones, jeans, camisas, camisetas, faldas y blusas.

loans.name: Sam Ath

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeung Sam Ath was married in 1989 and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She is currently in the business of weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1984 and began her silk production in the same year. Her husband, Mr. Prak Bunthorn is a carpenter. He learned this skill from his father in 1992. Sam Ath’s daughter is a cleaner in a club in Phnom Penh. Her other two sons are studying in a local school. So, Sam Ath and her husband are committed to their sons achieving a higher education.

Sam Ath has borrowed money from MAXIMA for the first time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila has been part of the Comunal Bank Bienestar II (meaning Well-being") for the last 14 years. She is 41 years old and has four living children. Two of her children have passed away. During the time she has been part of the Communal Bank, Teofila has learned many skills from the lessons she has received. The formative lessons have made her feel increasingly more secure in her abilities. She has also been able to receive several loans from her bank.
Teofila has learned to be more punctual and to care more for her family and the people she works with.  
She has a small grocery store in her house that she has been running for the last seven years. With a loan of 1200 soles, she will be able to increase the volume of merchandise she sells, such as rice, sugar candles, soap and toilet paper. 
She has learned to save, and, with her savings, she has been able to improve her house and business.  
For example, Teofila invested a part of her savings in a motorcycle taxi for her husband's use.
Her dream is to improve her business and to save for a car, so that her husband can improve his work as a taxi driver.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, candles, soap, and paper for sale

loans.name: Lugoba A 2021(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is N. Peace. She is currently in the business of operating a drug shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 800,000 to purchase more drugs to sell. N. is 39 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 3 to 7, all of whom go to school. Each week, N. makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profit and combined with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for future use.
