Janice M. is from the village of Makawa Aloran, Mis. Occ.. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Janice owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Janice has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Janice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Janice from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent, school fees, and food.   

Sarah owns a bar. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale and retail. She also generates additional income. The main business challenges for Sarah include the rainy season and thieves. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin. Her goal for her business is to own a fully-stocked bar.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean, a hardworking entrepreneur, has operated a RTW(clothing) business in the Philippines for 10 years. She also farms sugarcane. Mary Jean, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, is now requesting a loan of PHP 29,500 to buy more clothes to sell. She dreams of saving enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hendriah

texts.en:
Hendriah is a resident farmer in Kitale Town in Western Kenya. She is 24 and married, with one three-year-old child. She has been in farming for four years, producing milk and vegetables and selling them in the local market. She gets additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

Hendriah has requested a loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo for two purposes: 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and the rest to buy poultry birds. She says the previous loans have improved her family's standard of living and she hopes this third loan will make their lives much better through having milk, some of which they will drink and some of which they will sell to pay for other family needs.

She is glad that Juhudi Kilimo is advancing these loans. She notes, however, that animal diseases are still a great challenge in the farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn H. is from the village of Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Gemalyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gemalyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling green bananas & coconuts in the local community. Gemalyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gemalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemalyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts.

location.town: Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to buy a rickshaw for her son. Her husband sells ice blocks. He operates his business in the community. His business goes well in the summer season. Surriya has seven children: four of them are studying while three are working driving rickshaws. 

With this loan, Surriya's son will buy a rickshaw which will help him provide better transport services to passengers and earn more profit. Currently, he is using his brother’s rickshaw which is disturbing the work schedule for both of them. Surriya is confident that her son will be able to improve his income and her family will be better off financially as a result.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José tiene su propio negocio, en donde tiene diez años recorriendo la capital al dar su servicio como taxista, siendo de su propiedad, lo que ayudado en su economía. Su esposa es comerciantes y ambos cuidan de sus cuatro hijos todos estudiantes.
Don José ha mejorado su casa, a través de los préstamos, que gracias al plazo logra equilibrar sus gastos. Lo que ha logrado dar  a su familia seguridad y bienestar. Con este financiamiento será para la compra de puerta de madera, ya que solo verja tiene a si como la ventana. Terminando una obra más gracias al apoyo de la institución.
texts.en:
Jose has his own business.  He spent ten years gathering the funds to be a taxi driver, and  having his own cab has helped him with his finances.   His wife is a merchant and they both take care of their four school-aged children.

Jose has improved his house with the loans that have helped him stabilize his expenses.  He has succeeded in giving his family security and well-being.   He will use this loan to buy a wooden door since now he only has an iron gate like that which is on his window.  This will finish another part of the house thanks to the support of the institution.

loans.use: To buy a door and a window for his house.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 29 and married to Judy. The couple is blessed with three children ages three, four, and nine. For the past year, Enock has run a grocery shop. He also sells eggs wholesale. His businesses earn him a monthly income of 8,000 KES. 

This will be Enock’s first loan with KADET LTD. He will use his loan to buy groceries and eggs to sell and also to repair his grocery stall. Enock will use his profits to open a retail shop. He hopes to become a distributor of Coca-cola products.

loans.use: to buy groceries and eggs to sell and to repair his stall

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 27 años, vive en el caserío de Cayan. Ahí formó su familia con Amalio, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen un hijo, Brandon, de 6 años a quien aman y cuidan en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica esta abnegada mujer es la agricultura. Es así que hace 12 años viene sembrando una variedad de tubérculos como: papa, oca y olluco. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Tanto así que sus cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde recibe buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es mantener sus sembríos limpios con la ayuda de su esposo, quien esta con ella incondicionalmente. En todo este tiempo logró obtener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, eso le ayuda a obtener mayores ganancias, los cuales piensa invertir en los estudios de sus hijos. Ahora comenzará a sembrar papa de variedad “yungay” y “andina”, donde esta segura obtendrá buenos resultados. Ella desea para su futuro mejorar su casa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Por eso se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Reyna de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa que piensa sembrar.
texts.en:
Reyna is 27 years old and lives in the small village of Cayan.  There she has formed a family with Amalio, her husband of 8 years.  The couple have a son, 6 year-old Brandon, who they love and care for in their own home.  

This self-sacrificing woman works as a farmer.  For twelve years, she has been growing a variety of tubers such as potatoes, 'oca' and 'olluco' (both native tubers).  With a lot of effort, she has managed to work her land and make it very productive; so much so that she sells her harvests in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma and makes good profits.

What Reyna most enjoys about her work is keeping her crops clear of weeds with the help of her husband who is with her unconditionally.  Over the years, she managed to obtain her own farmland.  This helps her to make more profits which she plans to invest in her children's education.

Reyna is starting to sow 'yungay' and 'andina' potato varieties and she is sure that she will obtain good results.  In the future, she would like to improve her home.

Reyna is a member of the 'Corazón de Jesús' (Heart of Jesus) community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan so that she can continue reaching for her goals.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  With your support, Reyna will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of organic manure and natural fertilizers to spread over the potatoes that she plans to sow.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Shakira Del Carmen

texts.es: Shakira de 33 años es una mujer casada que tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, con el que sueña ver convertido en un profesional exitoso y esta es su gran motor para que cada día se despierte con una mayor  fuerza de trabajo y  fortalecer su bienestar en unión de su esposo. Ella tiene un negocio de miscelánea donde vende de contado y a crédito, mercancía variada como cosméticos, accesorios, prendas de vestir etc, a sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos  que cada día crecen y con los cuales debe ser oportuna en su respuesta. Su sueño más adelante es tener un almacén bien posicionado, pero su gran desafío para lograrlo es su pequeño capital de trabajo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva que es su primer financiamiento con el cual comprará nuevas líneas de cosméticos perfumes, prendas de vestir femenina en mayor volumen, porque mediante este sistema de compra de contado y al por mayor estaría ahorrando y fortaleciendo su competitividad en el mercado.  Mientras Shakira trabaja para lograr sus sueños, maneja en su negocio una rentabilidad no menor del 28% y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 18 días.
texts.en:
Shakira, 33, is a married woman; she has a two-year-old son that she dreams seeing become a successful professional.  This is the motivating force that impels her daily to wake up with stronger will to work and to strengthen his wellbeing alongside her husband.  

She has a business selling miscellany for cash and on credit.  She sells assorted merchandise like cosmetics, accessories, clothing, etc. to neighbors, friends, relatives and referred customers who every day are more numerous and who must receive prompt service.  Her dream for later on is to have a well-positioned store but the great challenge she faces is her small amount of working capital.

This is the reason behind her request for a Kiva loan which will be her first loan.  She will use it to buy new lines of cosmetics and larger amounts of women’s clothing because by paying cash and buying wholesale she saves and becomes more competitive in the marketplace.  While Shakira works toward attaining her dreams, she manages a profit margin of no less than 28% and an 18-day lag in accounts receivable.

loans.use: to buy new brands of cosmetics and women's clothes.

loans.name: Ndiaga Mahtar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur tient une boutique de vente de denrées alimentaires dans son village. Il s'approvisionne en ville à 15 km et a réussi à attirer une importante clientèle dans les villages environnants du fait de sa bonne crédibilité. Il assure avec les bénéfices générés par son activités l'essentiel des besoins de sa famille.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et satisfaire la forte demande, il sollicite un prêt e 400 000F pour acheter 15 sacs de riz et 100 litres d'huile. Il ambitionne de transformer sa boutique en magasin de vente en gros pour approvisionner les boutiques des villages de la zone.
texts.en:
The borrower manages a grocery store in his village. He gets his supplies from the city, 10 miles away, and has succeeded in attracting a large clientele from neighboring villages due to his good credibility.
With the profits generated by his business, he provides for most of his family's needs. To increase his working capital and satisfy the strong demand, he is requesting a 400,000 XOF loan, with which to purchase 15 bags of rice and 100 liters of cooking oil.
His ambition is to turn his shop into a wholesale store to supply the grocery stores in his area.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of rice and 100 liters of cooking oil.

loans.name: Sempati Utara 3 Group

texts.en:
Muniarti is married and has four children. She helps her husband to run a motorcycle repair business and sell spare parts. Their garage has been running since 2006 and is so successful that Muniarti and her husband are looking for a larger space since they have many customers.

Muniarti is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 IDR to buy an air compressor. She hopes that the profit from her loan will allow her and her husband to continuously send their children to school through college.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor

loans.name: Alister

texts.en: Alister is a focused business man. He is married and is blessed with a one-year-old child. For the last 2 years he has been operating a bakery so as to make a living. His dream is to be the proprietor of a chain of businesses. For the next 5 years he wants to be a leading bakery products supplier in his region. He is requesting for loan of 5,200 Kenyan shillings to buy a gas cooker.Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now  business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy a gas cooker

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, single, is an aggressive business man aged 27. For the last two years, he has been managing a health-care and weight-management busisness to earn a living. Previously, he was employed. He also sells casettes and DVDs for more income generation. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 34,085 Kenya shillings to buy cassette and DVDs. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become business oriented.

loans.use: To buy cassettes and DVDs

loans.name: Djumal

texts.ru: Джумал проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 55 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Джумал уже 20 лет как занимается торговлей. Она у себя дома продает ткани. Кредит берет для покупки новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Djumal lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 55 years old, married and has two children. She has high school education. Djumal has been working in retail for the last 20 years. She sells fabrics from home. She is taking out this loan to purchase new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells items used to prepare food, including salted and smoked fish, fresh pepper and onions. She does this at the Frami market, which is in the town of Abura. She is married to a farmer and they have six children. She has run her business for three years and very much wants to expand it, which is why she is applying for a loan for $800 to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 35-year-old married woman with a son. They live in Ho Chi Minh. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

Since 2004, Trang has been operating a general store, selling basic household necessities and many kinds of instant food to people in her local community. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of goods in bulk to stock her store. She would also like to use part of her loan to purchase materials to sew clothing from her house. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business.

Trang hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and set aside savings for her children's education.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of goods in bulk to stock her general store and materials to sew clothes from her house.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es D. la ciudad D. San Ignacio, Misiones. Está integrado por 15 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y solidarias. Se unieron con el objetivo D. ayudarse las unas con las otras y D. esa forma poder llevar los ingresos necesarios para paliar los gastos diarios.
El comité  es encabezado por la señora Edita, ella cuenta con un almacén que monto gracias al préstamo obtenido con su comité. Comenta que le va muy bien, y que ya tiene una buena clientela. Comenta que su deseo es fortalecer la unidad D. grupo para seguir creciendo con sus actividades y como persona, mediante las capacitaciones brindada por el programa.
Ella solicita la ayuda para abastecer su negocio con los insumos necesarios, como ser pastas, azúcar, panificados, verduras, carnes y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of San Ignacio, Misiones.  It is composed of 15 women, all of them very hardworking, enterprising, and supportive.  They came together with the goal of helping each other and, in this way, being able to bring home the necessary income to lessen the daily expenses.

Edita is the head of the group.  She has a store that she put together thanks to the loan obtained with her communal bank.  She comments that it is going very well for her and that she already has a good clientele.  She says her desire is to strengthen the unity of the group and so continue growing professionally and personally through the training offered by the program.

She is requesting the help to stock her business with the necessary supplies, such as pasta, sugar, bread, vegetables, meat, and others.

She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy pasta, sugar, bread, vegetables, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a thirty-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She used her locally generated savings from her monthly salary to start her transportation business. She faces the hardships of price fluctuation and inflation plus high fuel costs. However, her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent home. Elizabeth needs the loan to buy another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Keturai

texts.en:
Keturai is 30 years old, and is married to Nthambi, who operates a green grocery.  They have five children. He has been farming for the last three years, with an income of KES.15,000, a month.

He has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he is applying for his first loan of KES.30,000.  He will use the loan amount to buy pesticides, seeds, and livestock to raise.

With the anticipated profits, he plans to get more livestock.  He desires to grow his business, be financially stable, and buy a plot in the future.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds,and livestock to raise.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée mère de trois enfants.Elle tient une cantine au marché de sa localité et y vend des tissus. Elle a en charge ses trois enfants ainsi que ses propres besoins.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 250000fpour acheter des tissus divers. Son ambition est de se lancer plus tard dans l'import - export de produits vestimentaires.
texts.en:
Mariama is married and the mother of three children. She runs a small shop at the market of her town, where she sells fabrics.

She has to support her three children and herself. To bolster her business, she's seeking a loan of XOF 250'000 in order to buy various fabrics.

Her ambition is to later start an import-export business.

loans.use: to buy various fabrics

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 08 ans et le dernier a 02 ans.  
Koffi travaille comme revendeur de tôles ondulés depuis 2007. Il vend à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Koffi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tôles ondulés. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité de tôles 
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait rendre l’activité durable et productive. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Kofi is a 37-year old man. His wife works as a vendor. He has two children, one of whom is in school. The older child is eight years old, and the younger is two. Koffi has been selling corrugated sheet metal since 2007. He sells to the public at large in a store. His main challenge is a slump in sales. Koffi has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy corrugaged sheet metal. He would like to reinvest in his business. In the future, Koffi would like to make his business stable and profitable. He says that his revenues will help keeping his family happy.

loans.use: to buy corrugaged sheet metal

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 30 years old and lives in the town of Zana, in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has 2 school age children. For the past year, Aisha has managed her hardware selling business. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more supplies for resale, and will help Aisha generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  Aisha also hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for resale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba  de la provincia de La Convención y tiene 42 años edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos.  Actualmente, Carmen vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco donde realiza sus actividades económicas.    
 
Carmen se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos y telas, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio y la podemos encontrar fabricando sus productos en su taller desde muy temprano.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Carmen requiere el préstamo para comprar herramientas, plásticos y combustible (para hacer secar los ladrillos y las tejas). 

Carmen es integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Carmen was born in the city of Quillabamba in the La Convención province.  She is 42 years old, married and has three children with her husband.  Carmen lives in the historic city of Cusco where she works.  
 
Carmen makes bricks and tiles for a living.  She has a small shop in her house and things are going well for her.  Carmen is requesting a loan to buy tools, plastics and fuel (to dry the bricks and tiles).  

Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Pillao".  This group is made up of 13 members that live in the province of Cusco and the San Jerónimo district.

loans.use: purchase tools, plastics and fuel to fire her bricks and tiles.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua sells fanti kenkey (boiled maize dough) in Mbeam near Abura. Akosua has completed her education. She is married and has 8 children. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua has been selling fanti kenkey for 3 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku (fermented maize paste). She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her kenkey.

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes is a 38-year-old married mother who has been residing in Prey Chor district. 

She is dedicated to a rice-cultivating business, from which she yields in the neighborhood of $1.50 per day. Her husband also helps manage the farming projects. In addition, he is engaged in animal husbandry. He buys and sells animals, especially cows, in a local market of the province. 

Now Tes has requested some funds for her husband to supplement their existing capital to buy cows for trading. 

With the generated income from the animal-trading business, Tes intends to cover her wall, which currently is decayed, with wooden boards.

loans.use: to buy cows for trading.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Nan is 33 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is a dependent and still in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and peanut planting. Having been in this business for 12 years, she can earn about 42,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 22,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Nan has just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. Nan is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more healthy peanuts and rice so as to increase her family’s income to better her living conditions and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Suai would like to buy 6 steers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose i[. 51 year[. old and a civil servant in retirement. She i[. married with 6 children, some of who[. are attending school at the senio[. and junio[. level[.. She i[. a distribute[. of flou[. in he[. area. She i[. supplied by the Takoradi Flou[. Mill[. directly. With the increase in custome[. base, the need ha[. arisen fo[. additional capital to meet custome[. demand[.. Thu[. the KIVA loan will come in handy to help he[. to satisfy he[. client[..

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Yoslin Daniel

texts.en:
I make furniture like tables, dressers, and cabinets as well as picture frames. I have been in business for five years and work by myself. At this time I need to buy wood to fill orders for tables and chairs. I need the income because my children are in school and there are many expenses related to their education.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Mi negocio es hacer variedades diseños de madera (mesas, retrateras, sillas, llaveros armarios y otros. Este negocio lo atiendo personalmente. Tengo 5 años de tenerlo. ahora necesito comprar madera ya que tengo varios clientes que quieren que les haga unas sillas y mesas. Necesito ingros para estos mes ya que mis hijos estan estudiando y tengo mucho gastos con sus estudios.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Born in 1955, Afi S. is the mother of eight. She has run a small shop since she was young and knows the grocery business well. She works hard to satisfy her many customers' demands. Her village is growing and with it, her customer base. As a result, she is stretched to meet demand and so she is asking for a loan of $800 to stock up on merchandise. In doing so she will be able to meet the needs of her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1955, Madame S. Afi est mère d'une famille de hui (08) enfants. La vente des produits divers est son activité. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis son jeune âge. Avec cette expérience, elle métrise bien l'activité. Sollicitée par de nombreux consommateurs locaux, Madame S. Afi réussit toujours à satisfaire les demandes grâce à son savoir faire et à son dynamisme. Aujoud'hui, son village s'étend et les consommateurs augmentent en nombre. Par conséquent, la demande actuelle dépasse ses capacité. A cet effet, elle saisit cette opportunité pour renforcer son commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui lui permettra de s'approvisionner en nécessaires consommables afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d'assurer les besoins de sa famille surtout ceux d'ordre vital.

loans.use: To purchase various groceries for resale.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Mr Araz is a low income vulnerable person. He is 29 and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.Araz rents a butcher shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town. Every morning he goes  to villages to buy cattle and sheep. Then he sells meat in the bazaar. The working day lasts  until 2 o'clock. "I wish I had more money to buy more animals and sell them till evening. This would allow me to generate a higher income", he says. Araz needs a higher income to save money to fund his marriage.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Ani Antari

texts.id:
Quick, persistent and modest, description given to Ni Ketut Aniantari. Although aged 32, this mother of 3 has a steady income as a Cocoa seeds buy & sell sales lady. She has been in the business since 2 years. With an initial capital of Rp3,000,000 (about US$330), Ani, her nickname, within one day could buy cocoa up to 300kg from several farmers who directly came to her home. Price per kg varied depending on quality, and water content. After processed (dried in the sun) for half to 1 day, Ani resells it to the distributor, of course at a higher price. Usually she delivers once every 2 days. Sales results are around Rp3,200,000-Rp3,300,000 (about US$352-363). So within 2 days Ani could get a nett profit of Rp100,000-200,000 (about US$11-22) after subtracting labor and transportation cost. Additional loan from Dinari would be used to buy a scale and additional capital to buy more goods for sale. Her hope is that results / profits could increase, and help Ketut Suarba, her husband to pay for education expenses of their 2 daughters, who are already in Middle school & Grade school, and atoddler son.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Gesit, ulet dan bersahaja , julukan itu cocok di berikan pada Ni Ketut Aniantari meski usianya baru 32 tahun Ibu dari tiga orang anak ini sudah memiliki sumber penghasilan tetap yaitu sebagai seorang Pedagang Jual Beli Biji Kakao. Usaha ini telah ditekuninya sejak 2 tahun lalu . Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 3.000.000,- Ani, begitu orang biasa memanggilnya, dalam sehari bisa membeli kakao sampai 300 Kg dari beberapa petani yang datang langsung kerumahnya . Harga per 1 Kg nya berpariasi tergantung pada kwalitas barang dan kadar kandungan airnya . Setelah di proses ( dijemur ) kurang lebih ½ s/d 1 hari, oleh Ani dijual kembali kepada pedagang induk tentunya dengan harga yang lebih tinggi . Pengiriman yang dilakukan biasanya setiap 2 hari sekali dengan hasil penjualan berkisar Rp. 3.200 000;- s/d Rp. 3.300.000.- . Jadi dalam waktu 2 hari Ani mendapatkan keuntungan bersih Rp 100.000,- s.d 200.000 setelah di potong ongkos buruh maupun ongkos angkut. Mendapat tambahan modal dari Dinari oleh Ani dipergunakan untuk membeli sebuah alat timbangan dan sebagai tambahan modal untuk bisa membeli barang dagangan yang lebih banyak lagi . Dengan harapan hasil / keuntungan yang di dapat semakin banyak , dan dapat membantu Ketut Suarba, suaminya, dalam membiayai pendidikan 2 orang putrinya yang sudah duduk di bangku SMP & SD dan satu lagi putranya yang masih balita.

loans.use:
To add capital to buy more cocoa seeds and buy a sitting scale

Menambah modal usaha agar dapat membeli lebih banyak biji kako dan untuk membeli timbangan duduk

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Loeng (aged 49) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 18 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Mrs S. is a widow and has one daughter. She has been in the business of selling fruit since 2000 and her daughter, Voeun Maly (aged 22) helps her. Mrs S. buys fruit from the market in Phnom Penh and resells them in her village.

She is requesting her third loan with Maxima, for US$350, to expand her business. She and her daughter hope to continue to grow their business so they can create a better life for themselves.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for reselling

loans.name: Pirnazarova

texts.en: Pirnazarova M. lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan with her husband and three children. She has been a Microinvest client since 2006 and has proved to be a serious and highly-motivated businesswoman who has made effective use of her loans. Mrs.Pirnazarova works in the food bazaar, where she sells sweets popular with people in her area, including cookies and pies with traditional types of filling. Mrs. Pirnazarova has applied for a loan of  $475 to expand her business and continue making items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To expand her business selling candies and desserts

loans.name: Untouchables (Intocables) Group

texts.es:
"Untouchables" is the name of this community association that brings together this group of women workers, most of them with family responsibilities, (i.e., married, with children and husbands in some cases) who do not have a fixed source of employment.

Their personal situations has forced each of them to be responsible for their families in ways like: providing for the cost of housing, food, education and needs of their children. That is why they decided to engage in many different activities, ranging from handicrafts, textile weaving and sewing of fabrics, trading products,etc. in the various fairs in their area, or in the main exhibition fair of Alteña.

They now require working capital to be able to purchase raw materials for their trade, after taking into account that demand for their work rose considerably, during the busy time of carnivals. They plan to take advantage of this demand for their work, so they can generate sufficient income to cope with the beginning of school term in the month of March.

Translated by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Intocables, es el nombre de la asociación comunal que reúne a un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras, la mayoría con responsabilidades familiares, es decir, casadas, con hijos y esposos en algunos casos no tienen una fuente de empleo fijo. Esta situación las ha obligado a ser responsables de sus familias y y los gastos de la casa, como ser la alimentación y los estudios y necesidades de los hijos. Por tal motivo ellas han decidido dedicarse a muchas actividades distintas, que van desde las artesanías en tela y textiles, costura y otros. Productos que comercian en distintas ferias de su zona, o en la principal feria Alteña. Ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de materia prima, tomando en cuenta que la demanda de sus trabajos en la época de carnavales se incrementa considerablemente y debe ser aprovechada para generar los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la temporada de inicio de clases que se avecina en el mes de marzo.

loans.use: This group requires working capital to be able to purchase raw materials to use in their trade during the busy carnival season, and especially since they anticipate expenses with the onset of the school term which begins in March. (Ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de materia prima, tomando en cuenta que la demanda  de sus trabajos en la época de carnavales se incrementa considerablemente y debe ser aprovechada para generar los recursos suficientes para hacer frente a la temporada de inicio de clases que se avecina en el mes de marzo.)

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
My name is Zubaida R.. I am from Arifwala, a small metropolis in Pakistan. I am 30, married, and the mother of four: two boys and two girls. My husband is a rickshaw driver and he wants to buy an additional rickshaw. He will give this additional rickshaw for rent to supplement his income.

I request loans for my group members also. Mussarat B. will invest her share of the loan in her family’s restaurant. Sakina B. and Manzoora M. both are borrowing for their lumber yard.

loans.use: Buy an additional rickshaw

loans.name: Laura Veronica

texts.es:
Laura began her business because her husband's earning were becoming ever too small to cover their expenses. Their growing daughters also contributed to their increasing expenses so she began to resell lingerie that she bought from a catalog. The business went well and she soon had a strong list of customers. She now sources the lingerie from a distributor which gives her a better earnings margin and her business grows bigger each day.

Laura needs a loan for US$575, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Laura Vázquez emprendió su negocio debido a que con los ingresos de su esposo cada vez completaba menos, entonces al ir creciendo sus hijas también se incrementaban mas los gastos, por lo que empezó a vender lencería por catalogo, le fue bien y pronto tuvo su cartera de clientes, a la fecha ya surte dicha lencería en una distribuidora que le da mayor margen de ganancia y su negocio crece cada día mas.

Ella requiere un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Laura continuara su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa M. has dedicated herself to her business of raising pigs for the past 4 years in her home town of Villanueva de Chinandega. With much effort and sacrifice she is able to find the way to support her family despite the fact that she is a single mother. It is very difficult to try and maintain 5 children playing the role of both mother and father.

Today she is in urgent need of pigs for breeding. For this she is soliciting a loan from Ceprodel in order to obtain the help necessary to buy those animals. It must be emphasized that with her experience en this business she has been able to build up a customer base that acquire all of their animals through her.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La dama Narcisa M. se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio de la crianza de cerdos en su localidad en el municipio de Villanueva de Chinandega. Con muchísimo esfuerzo y sacrificio busca la manera de cómo mantener a su familia por el hecho de que es una dama soltera y con la difícil necesidad de mantener a sus 5 hijos haciendo el papel de padre y madre.

Hoy en día la necesidad que ella atraviesa es la urgente adquisición de los cerdos para su respectiva crianza en el Ganado. Para ello, ella solicita créditos en Ceprodel para obtener el apoyo necesario para la compra de estos animales. Es necesario destacar que con su experiencia en el negocio, ha logrado alcanzar clientes que adquieren de ella los animales o los productos derivados de estos animales.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
M. Uguloy is 37 years old. She is a widow. She has an adorable son for the sake of whom she is living and working. Uguloy is a market vendor. She sells clothing for teenagers in the local market. Uguloy travels to the neighboring city to purchase the goods for selling, and her son helps in selling at the market. In general, the business is stable with a strong trend for further development.

However, Uguloy stresses that, after loans provided by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON, she managed to accelerate the process of development of her business considerably. For instance, with one of the loans, Uguloy was able to rent one more trading place in the market.

Today, she is planning to increase the working capital in order to expand her business. For this purpose, she requests a loan of $475 US for the term of 4 months. Uguloy promises to mange the current loan with accuracy, as she did all the previous ones, and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Increasing of the turnover capital with the purpose of business development.

loans.name: Ehis

texts.en:
Ehis Erhhunmwonse is 35 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she runs a boutique. She learned how to sell men's clothing and shoes for 3 years before she started her own business in 1994. She is a dedicated and hard-working woman.

Ehis needs a loan for $1, 200 USD to buy more men's clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy  more men's clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey E. is 35 years old and single.  He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  He runs a cold room where he sells frozen fish. He has been in this business since 2002.  He needs the loan amount of $275 to buy more fish to sell from his cold room.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor B. is 46 years old. She’s married with 4 children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 10 years she has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, fattening and then selling them.

Gulbahor is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home. Gulbahor wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved mother.

Thanks to this activity she is supporting her children and providing them with education. Gulbahor wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) with a term of 12 months to buy calves in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of determination and strength to live. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth I. is 33 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she sells provisions and drinks, a business she started in 2006 after watching her mother run a shop as she grew up.

Ruth is asking Kiva lenders for a loan of $425 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks to stock her store. She says that the more selection she has, the more sales she can make to help care for her family. Ruth is very grateful for the assistance from LAPO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar Baji is a wife of S. A. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar of city Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a room and has been living in it for the last 24 years. She is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. Her elder daughter is married. The next to her is in 9th standard. Her younger daughter is in 5th standard. Her son is in 4th standard. Kosar Baji’s husband has a shoe-making business. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. Kosar Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy material (leather, nails and thread) to make more shoes to sell and earn a good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shamim Baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, sketches and beads) for her decorative embroidery business. Nargis Baji and Ishrat Baji each want a loan to buy leather to make shoes to sell in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material to make shoes

loans.name: Flora Maria

texts.es: Doña Flora Maria, casada, pequeña productora del municipio de Nueva Guinea, sus hijos todos son mayores de edad los cuales la apoyan en las labores agropecuarias, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido para los gastos familiares, solicita financiamiento a AFODENIC para comprar un semental de mejor raza lechera, para así aumentar sus rendimientos productivos y el numero del hato ganadero y asó ayudar al desarrollo de la económia del pais; esta señora es una mujer trabajadora del campo, le gusta ser una mujer empresaria, también se dedica trabajo de costura, es una mujer lider en la comunidad, de buenas relaciones humanas con las personas que necesitan de ella,  en la actualidad tiene buen record créditicio ante la institución, y afirma que con el servicio brindado de la institución a mejorado sus condicones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Flora Maria is married and a small producer in the municipality of Nueva Guinea. Her children are all grown and help her with her farming tasks. She has the financial support of her husband for the household expenses. She is requesting a loan from AFODENIC to purchase a stud (bull) of a better breed for dairy activities in order to increase her production and the number of cattle in her herd, as well as contributing to the country's economic development. This is a hard working woman from the countryside; she likes being an entrepreneur and also works as a seamstress. She is a leader in her community and has good relationships with the people that need her. Currently, she has a good credit history with the institution and affirms that with the service provided by the institution she has improved her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Daría

texts.es: Daría tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, desde hace 4 años, se inicia en este negocio al ser animada por sus amistades para emprender este reto. Ahora, nos cuenta que con esta actividad le va muy bien y desea expandir sus horizontes. Daría se siente contenta con esta labor porque le permite un ingreso más para su hogar, sobre todo para solventar los estudios de sus hijos. Diariamente, luego de cocinar los alimentos, su trabajo consiste en salir a ofrecer los productos de belleza y venderlos, en ocasiones da crédito, pero solo a personas que ha logrado tener confianza, esta actividad le permite disponer de tiempo para no descuidar las tareas de su hogar. Daría solicita este préstamo para invertir en la compra de más cosméticos y tener así mayor capital de trabajo (lo principal que comprará son lápices labiales y sombras de ojos).
texts.en:
Daría, 33, lives with her husband and their 2 children. She has been selling cosmetics by catalog for 4 years. She was encouraged by her friends to undertake the challenge of starting the business. Now, she tells us that it is going very well for her, and she wants to expand her horizons. Daría is happy with this work because it gives her more income for her home, above all to pay for her children's education. Daily, after preparing the meal, her work consists of going out to present and sell beauty products. She occasionally gives credit, but only to persons who have earned her trust. The work allows her to use the time when she is not needed in the home. Daría is requesting this loan to buy more cosmetics and to have increased working capital. (The main things she will buy are lipsticks and eye shadows.)

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of increased quantity of cosmetics

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom S. is a villager in Trapaing Lvea village in Kandal province, Cambodia. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to the villagers and others. Her husband, Mr. Tech Chum, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. He is also a farmer and he wants to cultivate rice during the dry season.  However, he does not have enough money to buy an ox to plow the field. Thus, Mrs. Rom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox for her husband. Mrs. Rom S. is 46 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining two attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow a rice field.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil viuda y con 01 hijo, posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado menor; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para engordar ganado menor y venderlo en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo.
Actualmente ella viene trabajando con el mismo negocio, con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; el dinero le servirá para comprar ganado (porcinos y ovinos) y engordarlos para su venta en la época de carnavales. Con las ganancias ella ayuda en el sustento de su hijo y su educación. 
Ella esta agradecida por la ayuda que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Valentina is a member of the community bank “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” in the center of Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 47 years of age, is a widow, has one son, and completed her elementary school education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year. She works in the purchase and sale of small livestock. Her first loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles served to fatten her livestock for her to sell at the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo.

Now she continues to work in the same business. With this loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles ($175), which she has committed to repay in 5 monthly payments, she will buy livestock (sheep and pigs) and fatten them for sale during the carnival season. With the earnings, she helps to support her son and his education.

She is grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos provides to her.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock (pigs and sheep) and fatten them to sell during the carnival season.  With the earnings she will help support her son and his education.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Mrs. Donna G. was born in the province of Antique in the Philippines. She lives at Caridad 36 of Antique Southwest Branch. She is 35 years old, married and blessed with 4 children, two in elementary and one in high school. They help each other in running their business. But that doesn’t mean that her husband is jobless; sometimes he is a carpenter and sometimes a tricycad (bicycle with sidecar used as public transport) driver.

Ms. G. is engaged in livestock raising, more specifically hog and cow fattening. She received her loan amounting to P 24,000 on February 9, 2009 with a term of 100 weeks. She learned this business since she was young; that’s why she is knowledgeable in this business. This amount serves as additional capital to purchase 2 pigs and one cow. She dreams that soon she will have a durable and spacious pigpen and have additional cattle someday. She dreams also that she will send her children to school and see them finish their studies.

Ms. G. wants to thank ASHI for all its initiatives for the poor and the Kiva lenders who will sponsor this loan.

loans.use: buying more livestock to raise

loans.name: Nghiêm Thị Phượng Group

texts.vi:
Nhóm chị Nghiêm Thị P. Ms 020201050051 năm nay 50 tuổi. Chị là một giáo viên nên ngoài việc dạy học ở trường ra chị có nhiều thời gian để chăm sóc gia đình và làm kinh doanh. Vợ chồng chị sinh được 2 con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình, 1 con đang theo học đại học. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay 4.256.000VNđ để mua gạo nấu rượu và đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hàng ngày chồng chị giúp chị trong việc bán hàng và công việc chăn nuôi lợn. Gia đình chị rất thích hình thức vay trả này, vì nó giúp gia đình chị có điều kiện tích luỹ tiền, đồng thời có kế hoạch lo cho con ăn học. Chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn hết 1 chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, chu kỳ này các thành viên trong nhóm của chị vay mức vốn như sau:
 Chị Lê Thị T. năm nay 33 tuổi Ms 020201050052 chị đăng ký vay mức 3.808.000VNđ để bán hàng tạp hoá.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị X. năm nay 27 tuổi Ms 020201050053 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để thêm vốn đầu tư vào cửa hàng mộc của gia đình.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 44 tuổi Ms 020201050054 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn. 
 Chị Lê Thị S. năm nay 52 tuổi Ms 020201050050 chị đăng ký vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để buôn bán hàng phế liệu.
texts.en:
This year Mrs. Nghiem Thi Phuong is 50 years old. She's a teacher. Besides teaching time at school, she has a lot of free time to take care of family and do some small business. Her husband and she have two children, one of whom has got married and moved out, while the other is in college. For this loan cycle she'd like to borrow 4,256,000 VND (or 245 USD) to buy rice to make wine and raise cattle. Everyday, Mrs. Phuong's husband also helps her with her store and the small farm. Her family loves the model of microcredit, because it enables to have small payments while still have some savings and plan to pay for their children's schooling. Mrs. Phuong and her group has fully repaid their first loan cycle. This time other members in Mrs. Phuong's group want to borrow at levels listed below: + Mrs. Le Thi Tan, 33 years old, wants to borrow 3,808,000 VND (or 220 USD) to sell sundry goods. + Mrs. Nguyen Thi X., 27 years old, wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (or 270 USD) to invest in her family's carpenter's shop. + Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 44 years old, wants to borrow 4,256,000 VND (or 245 USD) to raise pigs. + Mrs. Le Thi Soi, 52 years old, wants to borrow 4,704,000 VND (or 270 USD) to buy and sell scrap metals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy rice and raise cattle

loans.name: Jorge Martin

texts.es:
Jorge inició el negocio porqué siempre tuve la idea que era una actividad que dejaba buenas ganancias ya que siempre existirán personas que tienen la necesidad de utilizar transporte público como empleados, alumnos, maestros, amas de casa, etc. y de esta forma podría obtener un ingreso para sostener a su familia. 
Comenzó el negocio en Octubre de 1988 empezo como chofer de un microbús de ruta fija y posteriormente compro su propio vehículo para empezar a trabajar por su cuenta, aunque con el inconveniente de que tenía que rentar las placas, pero gracias a Dios ya cuenta con su propia concesión y con un carro de modelo más reciente. Por lo anterior, no se puede quejar ya que le ha ido muy bien y lo que le gusta de mi trabajo es que el puede establecer su horario. 
 

El necesita un prestmo por MXN $7,000 para  pagar la tenencia y derechos para estar al corriente y no tener problemas de circulación con los Agentes de tránsito.
texts.en:
Jorge started his business because he always thought that this would allow him to make good money, now that there are so many people who need to use public transport such as workers, students, teachers, housemaids,etc. and in this way he would be able to support his family. He got into the business in October of 1988, beginning as a driver of a microbus with a fixed route. Later he bought his own vehicle in order to start working for himself, although with the inconvenience of having to rent the taxi permit. But now, Thank God, he has his own permit and a newer model car. As for what went before, he can't complain now that things are going well for him, and what he likes about his work is being able to set his own schedule. He needs a loan of 7,000 Pesos in order to pay the road tax and permit fees, so as to be current and not have traffic problems with the Transit Police.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay road tax and permit fees.

loans.name: Usufono

texts.en:
Usufono S., 49, is married with 4 children. She has experience in the pancake business. She sells to the school and villagers 6 days per week. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 190 Tala (~63 USD). SPBD loans are Usufono’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan for her business.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, baking soda, vegetable oil, cooking gas,

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe  Soutoura sont toutes mariées avec en moyenne  38 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles monogames à Sanoubougou I,  un des  quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de savons,  des fruits, des pagnes wax et des céréales.
Elles sont à leur  troisième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but  de  satisfaire le besoin de leurs  clientèles et d’augmenter leurs profits. Les  deux prêts précédents  se sont  bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter  60 cartons de savon, 15 colis de fruits, 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 200 kg de céréales. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, Bamako et dans les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place, à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant, en détail et à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris à subvenir aux dépenses familiales et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Soutoura  ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
The nine women of the group Soutoura are all married and average 38 years of age and 5 children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do a diversity of work, including selling soap, fruit, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and grains. The group members are on their third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of satisfying customer needs and to increase their profits. The two preceding loans were settled. With this new loan, they intend to buy 60 boxes of soap, 15 packages of fruit, 15 bolts of Wax pagnes, and 200 kg of grain. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso, in Bamako, and in surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City, locally at home, and door-to-door, to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 23,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used to help their husband cover family expenses, and the other portion will be invested in business and for repaying the loan. Their ambition is to become wholesale merchants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 as additional working capital for his rice-farming business. He is 38 years old and married to Wilma, who is also a Kiva borrower. They have two children: Harly Dave is 9 years old and in grade school and Hedel Wyze is 3 years old. They live happily in the village of St. Tomas Alicia, Isabela. 

Alexander hopes to improve his farming business in order to give his children a better life in the future and send them to school. With the help of the loan and with hard work and patience, Alexander knows he and his wife will be able to overcome the hardships of life.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi T. est une femme de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 3 ans. Elle est revendeuse de charbons à Lomé. Le charbon étant la principale source d’énergie dans les foyers au Togo, la demande est très forte. Afi désire avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en achetant des sacs de  charbons pour la revente.
texts.en:
Afi T., 48, is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells charcoal in Lomé. Charcoal is the principal source of energy in Togolese households, so the demand is high. Afi wishes to use this loan to grow the size of her business by buying sacks of charcoal for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing sacks of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua N. is divorced and has four dependents. She has received schooling through senior high school. Ekua is responsible for paying her children’s fees and the electricity bill. Her husband is not employed.

Ekua sells foodstuffs like tomatoes, beans, yam and so on, which she does at Elmina Market. She has been doing this since 1995. She intends using the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie S. is from the village of Danlugan, Pagadian City. She is 45 years old. Vergie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Vergie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from PMPC. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 45000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Vergie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en:
The two people shown in this picture over are Yoeum P. and her husband. This older couple established a small family home years ago in the middle of the best territory of the capital city of Phnom Penh, and they have given birth to seven children, two of whom are married. Three of their children are employed at a variety of occupations: one is a vegetable seller, one sells clams, and one is a building worker. 

Yoeum P. currently sells different kinds of vegetables in the market to earn a living, and her husband assists her in selling her produce. Recently, the family has been facing a big problem: the area surrounding their house is full of bad water due to the coming heavy rain season. For this reason, Yoeum P. would like to obtain a loan of $800 from Kiva’s partner HKL and will be using this loan to purchase a piece of land to make up for the poor land surrounding their property.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to cover the bad place

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia R. D. H. vive en el municipio D. Apopa en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ana D. 42 años D. edad, vive con su  esposo, quien trabaja como motorista y sus cuatro hijo, todos menores D. edad. Tener una familia extensa fue siempre el sueño D. Cecilia, cuyos cuatro hijos son su razón D. vivir. Hace ya cuatro años  Ana Cecilia abrió una tienda donD. venD. productos básicos, y que poco a poco se ha vuelto el pilar económico D. la familia H.. En este momento Ana Cecilia solicita un préstamo para surtir su tienda con nuevos productos y mercadería, para obtener más ingresos y cimentar las bases económicas que se convertirán en el futuro D. sus cuatro retoños.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia R. D. H. lives in the municipality of Apopa in the department of San Salvador. Ana is 42 years old, lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and their four young children. Cecilia always dreamed of having a large family, and her four children give her a purpose to live. Four years ago, Ana Cecilia started a general store where she sells basic necessity products. Little by little, the store has become the financial pillar of the H. family. At this time, Ana Cecilia is requesting a loan to supply her store with new merchandise. She wants to increase her income to lay the foundation for her four children’s economic future.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Farkhanda Group

texts.en:
Farkhanda is the group leader of the Farkhanda group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their own business activities.  Leyna and Leyda want to take a loan for their tailoring business.  Farkhanda would like to take a loan for her business of vegetable selling. They all want to see progress in their business in order to earn more money to support their families. 

They say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to expand their businesses

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 48-year-old married woman who has four children. She works as a tailor since 2000 to help her husband in the household. Today, Leila is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase textiles and to make maintenance for the sewing machine in order to be able to serve her clients.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and to make maintenance for the sewing machine.

loans.name: Diabou

texts.fr: Diabou LÔ est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans et y a bénéficié de 14 prêts qu'elle a remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe une activité de vente de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois. Elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Diabou LÔ is a 53-year-old woman who is married and the mother of nine children, all attending school. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for seven years and has obtained from it fourteen loans, which she repaid without a problem. She is developing a business selling firewood and charcoal. She helps her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small-scale business

loans.name: Patrick Mulunga

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children. His business is located at Mbururu in Eldoret.

He was introduced to KADET by Patrick Mwangi.

With the loan he is taking from KADET he intends to add maize stock to sell to customers. In the future he intends to buy a vehicle to use to augment his maize business.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy maize stock.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus dos hijos en su casa. Desde hace 7 años ha venido sembrando café y plátanos, ambos productos son muy importantes para su economía. Pero el que le brinda más ganancias es el café, por ello en estos meses de noviembre a diciembre se preocupa en abonar adecuadamente y de forma uniforme.
Para Víctor, dedicarse a sus chacras le complace de sobre manera, y más aún cuando lo realiza junto a su esposa. Cuando termina de trabajar en sus chacras, no le gusta estar sin hacer nada, por ello trabaja las chacras de otras personas, por lo que le pagan 15 soles diarios, esto mientras espera la cosecha de sus chacras. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, demostrando ser puntual en sus pagos y asiste a toda las reuniones de su banco comunal, ya que le gusta estar enterado de todo los acuerdos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Victor, 27, lives with his life partner and mother of his two children in his house. For seven years he has been planting coffee and bananas. Both products are very important for his economy. But, the one that offers more earnings is coffee. Therefore, in these months of November and December he concerns himself with adequately fertilizing in a uniform manner. Working in his fields really pleases Víctor, especially when he works along side of his wife. When he finishes working in the fields, he does not like having nothing to do. So, he works on other peoples’ fields. They pay him 15 PEN a day. He does this while he waits to harvest his crops. This is his second loan with MFP. He demonstrates that he is punctual with his payments, and he attends all of his communal bank’s meetings. He likes to be informed about all of the agreements. He will use the money that he is requesting to buy chemical fertilizers for his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Amintu

texts.en:
Amintu is very hardworking and she makes sure she has food on the table every day through her hard work. She is 42 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria and assists her husband with the family expenses.

Amintu prepares and sells a native medicine call Agbo and also sells food spices and roots for preparing Agbo. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more roots for preparing Agbo. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more roots for preparing of Agbo to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle C. is from the village of Rosevelt , Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Michelle is single. To make a living, Michelle owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Michelle is just starting this business.

In 2009, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Michelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Unidos Por El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
UNIDOS POR EL TRIUNFO

Grupo conformado por diez mujeres emprendedoras, quienes se vieron en la necesidad D. trabajar independiente para mantener a los miembros D. su familia. En esta oportunidad conoceremos un poco más a otros D. sus integrantes: 

Yolanda tiene 50 años D. edad, hace más D. ocho años venD. productos D. belleza fue por una amistad que la motivó trabajar así debido a la separación D. su esposo cuando sus hijos tenían 15 y 12 años. Yolanda trabajaba en ese entonces como auxiliar en un centro educativo del estado, puso todas las ganas en vender sus productos a sus conocidos, amigos, profesores, padres D. familia; con el tiempo decidió inscribirse en otras líneas cosméticas como consultora D. belleza (Esika, Avon, Natura) las ganancias D. estas resultaron rentables para ello requirió D. un capital empleando el dinero en mercadería para su negocio. Su esfuerzo y el deseo D. superarse no dejó D. cumplir su deber D. madre así proporcionó alimentación, ropa, y apoyó en el estudio universitario a su hijo quien estudia ingeniería electrónica, éste no recibe del todo el apoyo D. su padre.  Tuvo altibajos su negocio el motivo fue cuando su hijo se enfermó ocasionándole gastos en atención médica y tratamiento, poco después se recuperó D. ello lo que posteriormente compró una pequeña refrigeradora para su hogar. Necesita del préstamo para invertir en mercadería D. cosméticos y espera tener más adelante una vivienda propia porque hace nueve años vive y es guardiana D. un centro inicial.

Angélica tiene 39 años, trabajé empezando a vender golosinas hace nueve años en una carreta, esto lo hacía afuera D. los colegios estatales, así mismo los fines D. semana iba con mi canasta a los parques, estadio y en fiestas patronales ofreciendo mis golosinas en la zona D. Chosica – Perú por lo general era en horas D. la tarD. y noche porque en las mañanas me dedicaba a los quehaceres del hogar. Los préstamos que recibí lo invertí en mercadería (maní, habas, cancha, gaseosas, galletas, piqueos, caramelos). D. igual forma hago trabajos en tejido a crochet y palitos como ajuares para bebés, boleros, chompa, gorros, ponchos a los que le pongo aplicación D. mostacilla, canutillo, conchitas, maderitas D. acuerdo a la moda, y a los pedidos D. mis clientes. Actualmente tengo pedidos D. ajuares y boleros para ello requiero el préstamo para invertir en crochet, palitos, hijo y lana D. color. Las ganancias que obtengo D. este trabajo ayudo a mi esposo en la educación a mis hijos, ropa y alimentación.
texts.en:
Unidos Por El Trunfo (United for the Victory)

This group consists of ten enterprising women who saw the need to work independently in order to support the members of their families. We take this opportunity to know a few of the members a little bit better.

Yolanda is 50 years old and has been selling beauty products for more than eight years. A friend convinced her to work after she separated from her husband when her children were 15 and 12 years of age. At the time, Yolanda was working as an assistant at a state school. She offers her products with great enthusiasm to acquaintances, friends, teachers, and parents at the school. Over time she decided to sign up to proviD. cosmetics from various lines (Esika, Avon, and Natura) and become a beauty consultant. Her business is profitable because the only capital required is the money needed to purchase merchandise for her inventory. Yolanda’s hard work and desire to succeed have enabled her to fulfill her duty as a mother to proviD. food, clothing, and an education for her son who is studying electrical engineering. Her ex-husband no longer provides financial support. Her business went through some ups and downs as a result of paying for medical expenses and treatment when her son became ill. He recovered quickly and afterwards she was able to buy a small refrigerator for her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics. She hopes to have a house of her own sometime later because she has been a caretaker at a children’s home for the past nine years.

Angélica is 39 years old. She began working nine years ago by selling candy out of a cart that she parked outsiD. of the state schools. On the weekends, she carried a basket of candy to sell at parks, stadiums, and patron saint festivals in the district of Chosica. She normally sells in the afternoons and evenings because she spends her mornings performing her household chores. The loans she has received have been used to purchase merchandise (peanuts, beans, popcorn, soft drinks, cookies, snacks, and candy). In addition she crochets and knits items such as baby outfits, jackets, sweaters, caps, and ponchos. Angélica also does appliqués with beads, tassels, shells, strips of wood, or whatever material is in fashion and requested by her customers. She currently has outstanding orders for dresses and jackets, so she needs a loan to purchase crochet needles and colored wool. Her earnings will enable to help her husband with paying for food, clothing, and education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
