Janet M. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in the village Brgy Taliban, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She and her husband support their family by selling food and by shuttling passengers around town on their tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar for passengers) for a set fee. 

Janet’s husband helps her in running her business. They have three children who are aged 7 to 11 years old, who are all currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Janet M. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a food-vending business.  Now she earns an average monthly income of $117 from her business activities.

Janet M. is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her food-vending business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 5th loan, in the amount of 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her food-vending business. 

Janet M. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for food vending business

loans.name: Sovannarith

texts.en:
Mr. Sovannarith S. (shown in the photo), 42 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kimheang Hi, 40 years old, were married in 1991 and have two sons, both of whom are in school. They are living along National Road Number Six about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sovannarith and his wife have been farming for ten years. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village. The couple doesn’t have enough capital to maintain their vegetable and rice farm, so Sovannarith is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and seed

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité LAS TRINFADORAS, están en el 5° ciclo del programa bancomunal la linea de crédito que manejan es de 100.000 Gs. Hasta 1000.000 ellas comentan en cada seguimiento que luchan cada día para seguir adelante y la rutina de muchas de ellas consiste en  levantarse a las 05:20 am todos los días, van a la ciudad de Clorinda (Argentina.), como es el caso específico de la señora Nancy quien se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de uso domestico al menudeo y esto lo reparte entra las integrantes del comité y otras vecinas quienes son sus clientas y le pagan cada semana por las mercaderías que ella les provee.
Quienes en este ciclo se integran al comité, comenta que se siente muy feliz ya que es una oportunidad para volver a emprender sus actividades. 
Ellas agradecen infinitamente a KIVA Y la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brinda.
texts.en:
The LAS TRIUNFADORAS committe are in their fifth communal bank loan cycle; they manage a line of credit that ranges from 100,000 to 1.000.000 guaranís. They comment at each follow-up that they struggle daily to continue forward. The daily routine of many of them consists of rising at 5:20am every day, they go to the city of Clorinda (Argentina). This is the case of Nancy, who sells articles for the home. She distributes these among her fellow committee members and among other neighbors, who are her customers; they pay weekly for the merchandise she provides. Those who are members of the committee this cycle comment that they are happy to have the opportunity to undertake their activities again. They are infinitely grateful to KIVA and to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they have been given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies like:  flour, cooking oil, sugar, baked goods, dairy goods.

loans.name: Adio

texts.en: Adio is a known business man in his community. He is a key maker. He has been in this business for a long time and he hopes to expand his business. He is married with two children and he is 41 years old. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. Adio is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more materials to increase his business. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to increase his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años tiene instalada en la vivienda en donde vive una bodega en la que ofrece artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus clientes. La idea de este negocio nació ante la necesidad de agenciarse de una fuente de ingresos adicionales con los cuales poder solventar la economía de la familia ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no con suficientes para mantenerlos.

Elizabeth trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su negocio, por ello trata de ofrecer productos de calidad y brindar a sus clientes un buen trato; pensando en satisfacer efectivamente la demanda de sus clientes y también percibir mas ingresos, ella se ha propuesto ampliar su negocio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Elizabeth es una mujer bastante emprendedora que siempre lucha por salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de darles una mejor educación. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two children in her parents' house, which is located in the Cayaltí district, one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the past six years, she has operated a general store in the house where she lives, offering groceries and basic necessities to her customers. The idea for this business arose from the need to create a source of additional income to cover the family's expenses, since her husband works as an agricultural laborer and his wages are not sufficient to support the family. Elizabeth works as hard as she can to succeed with her business; she tries to offer quality products and provide excellent service to her customers. In the hope of satisfying her customers' needs more effectively and also increasing her income, she has decided to expand her business. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 Peruvian new soles. Elizabeth is a very enterprising woman who has always worked hard to get ahead. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur and offer her children the opportunity to get a good education. She has previously worked with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic goods to expand her store

loans.name: Rosiris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rosiris T. M. tiene 37 años y vive en San Juan de Nepomuceno, departamento de Bolívar  tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 13 y 17 años. Ella inició su idea de negocio cuando no conseguía fuentes de empleo e hizo un curso en el Sena de elaboración de desinfectantes y no le fue muy bien; luego comenzó un curso de belleza y desde ese momento se ha dedicado a la prestación del servicio de arreglo de uñas, tinturado de cabellos, oficio que realiza a domicilio y tiene mucha clientela por la facilidad de llegar donde el cliente la solicita.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Santo Domingo dolicita $2.000.000 que serán invertidos en  la compra de herramientas para su trabajo como una plancha para el cabello, un secador, esmaltes para el trabajo de las uñas y para comercializarlo entre sus clientes, también comprará ropa para damas, niños, cubre lechos y toallas porque  simultáneamente vende mercancía  variada. Con su primer crédito  compró esmaltes, e implementos para cortar el cabello porque no tenia, e invirtió  en la línea de ropa para damas, es así  como su negocio ha ido creciendo. Su familia se sostiene con las utilidades de su negocio y con los ingresos que tiene su esposo en la actividad de construcción de casas y obras civiles. Así sus hijos están estudiando es que esta es precisamente una de sus  metas  ayudarlos  a   que terminen completamente sus estudios; otro de sus sueños es adquirir su casa propia, porque viven dende los suegros y  mas adelante desea realizar estudios profesionales de belleza.
Su negocio está ubicado en la vía principal de San Juan Nepomuceno en un barrio donde los vecinos se conocen y donde viven familiares profesores y empelados del sector  público.
texts.en:
Rosiris T. M., 37, lives in San Juan de Nepomuceno, Bolívar department. She has two children who are 13 and 17 years old. The idea for her business came when she was having a hard time finding employment. She took a course on disinfectant making at SENA (National Employment Service) but she didn’t do too well. She then started a beautician course and since then has done quite well providing in home manicures and hair dying services; she has a lot of regular customers thanks to the convenience of going to their homes to provide the service. This is her second loan with Fundación Santo Domingo; she’s asking for $2.000.000 to buy work tools, like a hair straightening iron, a hair dryer, nail polish for manicures and to sell to her customers. She will also buy clothing for women and children, bedspreads and towels because she also sells assorted merchandise. She used her first loan to buy nail polish and hair cutting tools because she didn’t have any. She also invested in a women’s clothing line and this is how her business has been expanding. Her family supports itself with profits from her business and with her husband’s earnings as a construction worker. Her children are in school because it is precisely one of her goals to help them finish school. Another of her dreams is to own her own home because they are sharing with their in-laws; she would also like to take a professional beautician course in the future. Her business is located on San Juan Nepomuceno’s main street in a neighborhood where she is well known and where her neighbors are known teachers and public sector employees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies and tools.

loans.name: Mayteh

texts.en: Mayteh, 50, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married and has four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own olive oil production. Today, Mayteh has requested her second loan in order to purchase raw materials for her business and change the décor of her home with the income. She reimbursed her previous loan on time. Her previous loan allowed her to produce more olive oil and increase her family’s income. Her family depends on her income because it is additional revenue for them.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for olive oil production.

loans.name: Lion Of Judah Group

texts.en:
Yaa is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are between the ages of four and twenty-four years old. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a food crop farmer.

Yaa is a hard-working and trustworthy woman. She is a petty trader. She trades in provisions and food items. She has been trading for twelve years and wants the loan to procure goods such as rice, tins of milk, sugar, etc., in bulk. Yaa buys her products from nearby towns. She hopes to give quality education to her children and put up a house for the family. 

Yaa is the leader of a twelve-member trust bank group called ‘Lion of Judah’. The group is made up of trustworthy members who are mainly petty traders and food vendors. They want the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es: Sandy tiene 21 años, tiene un hijo recién nacido, comparte su vida a lado de sus padres, viviendo en casa de ellos. Hace mas de 3 años se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, producto que lleva a vender de manera ambulante en las ferias locales de cada zona rural de su ciudad. En ocasiones viaja a otras ciudades de la selva para ofrecer éstas medicinas, que junto a su madre, que siempre la apoya, realizan las ventas y con el tiempo ha logrado tener experiencia y conocer las estrategias para vender al cliente. Asimismo ambos se dedican a buscar nuevos proveedores para que se puedan abastecer de medicinas naturales y a un bajo precio, por ello considera rentable su negocio, porque los productos que vende tienen acogida de los clientes, y por tal anhela tener un puesto estable. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, fue invitada a formar parte de su grupo comunal, en donde se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos naturales al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sandy is 21 and has a newborn child. She lives with her parents. For over 3 years she has sold natural medicines, and she travels to local markets in every rural area of her city. Sometimes she travels to other cities in the forest to offer these medicines. She has gained experience and an understanding of good marketing strategies. She and her mother, who always supports her, look for new suppliers in order to stock up on natural medicines at low prices. For this reason, she considers her business to be profitable, because the products she sells are well-recieved by her clients, and she so greatly desires a steady job. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to be part of her group, and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. Sandy is grateful to those who will support her loan and knows it will be very helpful to the growth of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural products

loans.name: Seob

texts.en: Seob S., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Batambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for good quality rice. She raises pigs at home for an income of $4.00 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $5.50 USD per day. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase pig food to feed the pigs. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 1, 3 Group

texts.en:
Belkis is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 1,3 (Love and peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children.

Belkis is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes and underwear. She will use the profits to build her home in a stronger structure from wood to concrete block. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy shoes and underwear

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena C. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el Benque Danli, Maria se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería, tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “GINA”.
Doña Maria tiene tres 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y se puede observar que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar ya que el crecimiento de su negocio es notable.
La señora C. esta casada con el señor Darío Funez quien se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (Agricultor). Actualmente depende solo una persona que es su hijo.
Las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con los estudios de su hijo.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia al por mayor y asi tener mas ganancias.
doña Maria es una mujer muy alegre y amable.
texts.en:
María Magdalena C., 54, lives in El Benque, Danli. She is a grocer. She has a small grocery store called Pulpería “GINA”. María has been in this line of work for three years and one can observe that during this time she has known how to administer it well because her business has grown quite a bit. Mrs. C. is married to Darío Fúnez who is a farmer of basic grains. Currently they only have one dependent, their son. Profits from her business help her husband cover household expenses and pay for their son’s education. She will use the funds to buy merchandise at wholesale thus generating higher profits. María is a cheerful and kind woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lard, cooking oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, churros, candies, salt, tortillas, pastas, sauces, toilet paper.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 39-year-old married lady with four children who are in school.

Regina sells second-hand clothes to earn a living and has been in the business for one year. She also farms for more income.

Regina is a member of Ametoni group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other’s loans. She has requested a 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of clothes.

Regina dreams of providing a quality education to her children. She hopes to be the major supplier of clothes in her local community.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia lives with her family in Lahore which is famous for its history and culture. Lahore is the capital of Punjab province and the second largest city of Pakistan. 

She is 43 years old, the mother of five daughters and two sons. All of them are getting their education and studying in different classes. 

Aasia does embroidery work. She has contracts with different boutiques and women's ready-to-wear garment stores. She supplies the embroidered clothes to them and generates a good profit. 
 
Her husband does a private job, driving a van to pick up and drop off college students.  He started this business two years ago and it is going well. He purchased the van on installments. Aasia has applied for her 1st loan from Asasah for her husband. The loan will help her husband pay the remaining installments on his van. so it will become his own property and he will be free to use it. 

Aasia is very confident that taking out the loan will be proven to be a good decision for her family, which will benefit her husband and family in the long term.

loans.use: Pay off the remaining installments of a van

loans.name: Mẫn

texts.en:
Mẫn Thị D. is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Mẫn runs a recycling service in which she hauls away junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. She has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2009 Mẫn joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA which she used to invest in expanding the business. Mẫn is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use all additional revenue to further improve and expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia P. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Cecilia is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as milk, canned goods, sugar, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which she will use to expand her business. This loan will be Cecilia's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices that cover the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template that allows its Field Partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
Fatmata K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Buya Romende village, about thirty-five years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children, two of whom are attending secondary school and two in primary school. 

For many years now, Fatmata has been selling market foodstuffs such as salt, rice, bulgur wheat, etc.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to expand her business, make more sales and consequently improve her living conditions. She will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to buy salt, rice and bulgur wheat wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy salt, rice and bulgur wheat wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Rwamugoma Women's, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
In a month, T. John says he makes 200,000 Ugandan shillings; a figure he admits will not substantively make his business see the light in the near future. He is therefore seeking a loan to provide capital for his business so that he is able to restock for his shop and look towards substantial growth. John, who is 64 years-old, has been operating a general merchandise shop from his home area of Rwamacengye, Rukungiri for over 20 years selling agricultural produce to the local population.

Alongside this business he grows bananas, coffee, tomatoes and onions which all help him earn revenue. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to help him purchase more goods for his shop so that he will be able to make more sales.

John belongs to Rwamugoma Women's, Rukungiri.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his business.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina, a resident of Kasur, a Pakistani city famous for its sweetmeats, is 51 years old, a mother of four daughters and three sons, and married to M. S., a laborer. Although he is a very hard worker, his job is not a permanent source of income because work is sporadic. To support him financially and to fulfill the basic needs of the family, Sakina started an embroidery business, taking orders from her nearby clients and completing them promptly to earn an income.

All of Sakina's children are illiterate because she couldn't afford to send them to school. She has, however, taught her art of embroidery to all of her sons, who now operate their own business from a rented shop in the market. They contribute to the family financially from their earnings, while her daughters are very young and stay at home.

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity that will enable her to complete orders on time and increase her income. A regular loan user of Asasah, this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and attended all meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items in bulk quantity for embroidery business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 34 años, convive con Juan Pablo, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Yaroka. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura, ahí siembra desde hace 16 años los diversos cultivos oriundos de la zona como: papa, arveja, choclo y gladiolos. Los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad. Sin embargo hace algunos años que se encuentra invirtiendo en la compra de su propio terreno agrícola. “ya estoy pagando una parte, pero me falta poco, para poder terminar de cancelar”, afirma. Por ello en cada cosecha se las ingenia para poder vender su producción a muy buen precio, pues está segura que cuando concrete su compra podrá obtener más ganancias. Pero no solo a ello se dedica ella, ya que tiene chanchos, a los que después de cebarlos, comercializa su carne en el mercado central de su localidad. Elvira, es una mujer muy inteligente y con ganas de progresar, ya que eso le enseñó MFP, en sus constantes charlas educativas. Ya es el segundo crédito que tiene, con su banco comunal, y como buena integrante es puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir 20 sacos de abono; 100 sacos de guano (fertilizante natural), ya que muy pronto cosechará sus 8 hectáreas de cultivo de choclo.
texts.en:
Elvira, age 34, lives with Juan Pablo, who is 44. They have three young children who they take care of and provide an education. Elvira and her family live in their own home in the rural area of Yaroka. She has been farming for 16 years and grows different crops that are native to the area such as potatoes, peas, corn, and gladiolas. After each harvest, she sells her crops at the local central market. A few years ago, she invested in the purchase of her own farmland. “I am making small payments, but when I fall a little short, I find a way to complete them,” she says. With each harvest she manages to sell her products at a very good price, thus ensuring that she is able to generate more income. In addition to farming, she raises and fattens pigs and sells the meat at the local central market. Being an intelligent woman who wants to make progress, Elvira takes advantage of frequent educational seminars provided by MFP.

This is the second loan she has received from her Communal Bank. She has proven to be a good member by being prompt with her payments. The loan she requested will be used to buy 20 sacks of compost and 100 sacks of guano (bird manure used as a natural fertilizer). She has eight hectares of corn that will be harvested soon.

loans.use: Purchase 20 sacks of compost & 100 sacks of guano

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris T. is from the village of New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 38 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Maricris owns a business harvesting and selling farm-raised fish. Maricris has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 25000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Maricris joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional fish to raise. This will be the second loan taken out by Maricris from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise

location.town: Liloy-New Calamba, Kalawit, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años D. edad, es madre soltera, y vive con 02 hijas en una zona urbano marginal que se encuentra situada en los alrededores D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo. Una ciudad bastante comercial, es L. capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

María se dedica a L. venta D.  abarrotes, elL. posee una bodega, L. cual viene funcionando desD. hace 03 años aproximadamente. En ese establecimiento elL. ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. uso diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Adicionalmente se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. patos y pavos.

ElL. desea comprar abarrotes para satisfacer L. demanda que suele aumentar debido a L. campaña naviD.ña. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que invertirá específicamente en L. compra D. panetones y champagne.
texts.en: Maria is 47 years old and a single mother.  She lives with her 2 children in an urban zone located  on the outskirts of Chiclayo.  As the capital of Lambayeque, Chiclayo is a busy commercial area.   For 3 years, Maria has run a small shop where she sells grocery items and other every day necessities.  She also raises and sells ducks and turkeys for additional income.    Maria would like to purchase more inventory for her store, including items in demand during the Christmas season.  To reach her goals, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store, including items in demand this Christmas season.

loans.name: Mariela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mariela Elizabeth V. P.  tiene 25 años. Es Soltera, vive con sus padres en  el Cantón Ventanas en la  Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Mariela Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la feria de Ventanas..

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte y la música.
texts.en:
Mariela Elizabeth V. P.  is 25.  She is singe and lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Riós province.  She has one son.  She likes sports and music.

The members of V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE live around Cachel y Grande, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas.  The group is dedicated to labor-intensive agricultural work, such as the cultivation of corn, rice, and beans.

Mariela Elizabeth grows corn, rice, and beans.  She buys her products at Agro Karlyta and sells them in the market at Ventanas.

She is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer to grow corn, rice, and beans.  This loan will help her meet her economic needs.  Farmers like her face challenges like blight, disease and weather problems.

She would to buy land some day.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Goyah Group

texts.en:
Jeneba A. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Jeneba was born in Tongo, a town in eastern Sierra Leone. She is twenty-seven years of age. Jeneba is married to a professional worker, and the couple has two children – one in primary school and one in secondary school.

For eight years now, Jeneba has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). This is the first loan that Jeneba and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve  their living conditions. 

Jeneba will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her business stock.

loans.use: To buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi was born in 1962. She has eight children; her eldest child is 28 years old while the youngest is 15. Naomi’s husband is currently retired.

She sells charcoal and has done this business since 2001. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more sacks of charcoal. She plans to buy Irish potatoes with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: Buying sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene F., from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental, is 49 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns and operates a specialized retail store selling dried fish and squid in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Irene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her sixth loan for 4000 PHP to purchase more dried fish and squid to sell. Irene plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish and squid to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw material and create a water well.

loans.name: Gombojav

texts.en:
Gombojav T., 45, is married and lives with his wife and three daughters in Uvruhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. 

His wife is self-employed and her two older daughters attend college while the youngest daughter goes to a secondary school. 

Gombojav began his food selling business in 2005. He purchased food stuffs from the city and sold them in the countryside using his own car. 

In 2006, he set up a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the countryside and operated it as a cafeteria and a shop where he sold food stuffs and consumer goods. Afterwards his business became less profitable so that he has recently begun operating a stall  at a local market in the city.

He is a hardworking and polite person who wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. He is requesting a loan of 2,700,000 MNT to purchase more food stuffs and consumer goods for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuffs and consumer goods to sell

loans.name: Compartimos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Compartimos está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedora una de ellas es Sugey Martínez de 30 años tiene una pequeña venta que inicio con la venta de dulces desde hace 2 años. Ella con el crédito compra arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son la joven Diana O. de 21 años quien vende ropa de paca y María Teresa Martínez  quien vende baho comida típica que se hace al vapor y lleva Yucas, Plátanos Verdes, Plátanos Maduros, Carne de Res (Cecina), Tomates, Dientes de Ajo, Cebolla, Agrio de Naranja, Hojas de Plátano y una ensalada de repollo
texts.en:
The Compartimos Group (“Let’s Share” Group) is composed of three hard-working, strong and resourceful women. One of them is Sugey Martínez, aged 30, who runs a small activity she started 2 years ago by selling sweets. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap and other products.
The other members of the group are young Diana O., aged 21, who sells clothes made of spotted cavy’s skin, and Teresa Martínez, who sells baho (a typical dish made of yucca, plantains, bananas, jerked beef, tomatoes, garlic cloves, onion, orange juice, steamed under plantain’s leaves and served with a cabbage salad).

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap and other products.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
Y. Nguyễn Thị (20203050015) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Y. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Y. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND per month from these activities.
In 2009, Y. joined Kiva partner, SEDA, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Y. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offering. Y. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. The loan will be her third from SEDA. Y. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Y. Nguyễn Thị (20203050015) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, Y. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Y. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Y. kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2009, Y. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Y. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguY. liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua dụng cụ & thiết bị khác để mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Y. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase tools and other equipment

loans.name: Yann

texts.en: Yann T. is a 56-year-old widow who livies in the Reussey Keo community of Phnom Penh City. To earn a living, she sells soup and meatballs at her house, earning an income of about $4 each day. She was widowed a few years ago, when her husband became ill and died. Now she lives with five kids, of whom two are single and three are married. She also relies on the income of her son, who is a building worker. Yann T. says she faces difficulties in travelling: when she needs to go out, she always hires a motor taxi. In order to solve the problem, Yann T. has requested a loan of $800, which she will use to buy a used motorcycle that she can use instead of hiring a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation need without hiring a taxi.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick O. E. is a young, married man with two children, ages 8 and 5. He hopes to give them a good education to the university level. His business is located in a busy area in Kitengela. Fredrick runs a fiberglass shop in which he makes carvings and sells them to local people and tourists. He has been doing this business for three years now and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and that financial constraints are his major challenge. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fiberglass to make nice carvings to sell. He loves his work and says that in the future he hopes to start his own fiberglass factory. He describes himself as very hardworking, determined, and results oriented.

loans.use: Fibre glass

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is from the village of Agora, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old, is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling chicken and duck eggs in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional chicken and duck eggs. This will be the fourth loan that Cristina has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken and duck eggs

location.town: Agora, Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es una madre de familia dedicada al bienestar de su familia, de 34 años vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa que adquirieron con sus esfuerzos. Tiene 11 años de experiencia en la realización de tejidos a mano y a telar que elabora en su casa, su mama también trabaja junto con ella  para lograr producir la cantidad solicitada por sus clientes. Sus tejidos en telar son tiras tejidas que sirven de correas para mochilas y carteras y para esto requiere fabricar por cientos; asimismo  también  teje chompas, gorros y chalinas de acuerdo al gusto de su clientela; de esta manera logra obtener ingresos mensuales que son muy  útiles en la economía de su hogar a la vez que le agrada realizar este trabajo porque le da la oportunidad de expresar su creatividad en la combinación de puntos y colores de las lana que utiliza en la elaboración de su prendas. El insumo básico de su trabajo es la lana en sus diferentes variedades y colores por lo que le es muy necesario abastecerse frecuentemente  para poder cumplir las exigencias de sus clientes. Es la tercera ocasión en que tiene un crédito con MFP en donde ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos porque en todo este tiempo ha invertido sabiamente sus créditos anteriores, en esta oportunidad no será diferente pues tiene claro el destino de su inversión. Por tanto espera la ayuda de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Con el crédito comprará al por mayor de lana de variados colores, así mismo renovará su telar.
texts.en: Doris is a mother dedicated to the well-being of her family.  She is 34 and lives with her husband and 3 children in a house they acquired through their hard work.  She has 11 years of experience making weavings by hand, which she does in her home.  Her mother also works with her to produce the quantity requested by their customers.  Her weavings serve as backpacks and satchels.  This requires fabric in large quantities.  She also makes sweaters, hats, and scarves according to her customers’ tastes.  In this manner, she manages to obtain good monthly income that is used for her home’s expenses.  She is thankful for being able to do this work because she has the opportunity to express her creativity in the combination of patterns and colors of wool that she uses to make her garments.  Her basic supply is wool in different variety of colors, and that is why it is necessary to stock frequently to be able to meet the demands of her customers.  This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She has proven herself to be punctual with her payments because in all this time, she has invested her loans wisely.  This occasion will not be different because it is clear where she will invest the loan.  That is why she is hoping for the support of each one of you to meet her objectives.  With this loan, she will buy wool of various colors wholesale so she can revonate her loom.

loans.use: Comprar lana de diferentes colores y arreglará su telar.

loans.name: Sanabar

texts.ru:
Санабар родилась в селе Шарк  (Карасуйский район, Ош обл., Кыргызская Республика). Ей 49 лет. Санабар вдова, имеет 4 детей. 
Санабар родилась в простой семье. Она была старшим ребенком в семье с 10 детьми, большую часть времени она посвящала домашним хлопотам: присматривала за младшими братьями и сестрами, занималась домашней работой и небольшим хозяйством. Санабар в детстве мечтала стать учительницей, но увы жизнь заставила ее пойти совсем по иному пути.  В 1980 году она окончила школу, а в 1981 году родители, в соответствии с древней традицией,  выдали замуж Санабар в  Алайский район.  В 1983 году у молодой семьи родился первенец,  по законам шариата молодожены остались жить в родительском доме, так как муж Санабар был младшим сыном.  Муж честно трудился в колхозе, сама Санабар занималась домашней живностью,  к тому времени у них уже было 2 малышей, земли выделенной колхозом было мало, так как в то время на каждую семью выделялся лишь участок в 2 сотки, на котором практически нечего было сажать, затраты не покрывались полученным урожаем. Шли годы, семья теперь уже состояла из 6 человек. Муж Санабар был преуспевающим фермером в родном селе, но в 2002 году на семью обрушалась беда - неизвестные убили мужа Санабар.  Через 5 лет Санабар с детьми  решают перебраться в Чуйскую долину.    В 2007 году семья покупает дом в селе Полтавка  и начинает бизнес в разведении скота с покупки одной лошади. С тех самых пор прошло 4 года, через многие испытания прошла семья, но благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Санабар, ее бизнес стал успешным. Сегодня в хозяйстве 2 кобылы и 4 барана, дополнительно занимаются выращиванием свеклы и продают кумыз (кобылье молоко). Санабар запрашивает кредит в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки двух кобыл для откорма. Доход от кредита Санабар планирует использовать для дальнейшего увеличения своего бизнеса.    
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающих интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en: Sanabar was born in the Shark village (Kara-suu district, Osh province, Kyrgyzstan).  She is 49 years, a widow and has four children.  Sanabar was born in a simple family.  Being the oldest child in the family of ten children, she spent the majority of her time taking care of the household, such as looking after her younger brothers and sisters, doing household and caring for a small farm.  During her childhood, Sanabar dreamed of becoming a teacher, but her life forced her to pick a different destiny.  She finished school in 1980, and, according to an old tradition, her parents married her off to the Alay district in 1981.  The young family had their first child in 1983.  According to the sharia law, newlyweds remained living in the parents' home because Sanabar's husband was the youngest son.  Sanabar's husband diligently worked at a collective farm, and Sanabar took care of the domestic animals.  By that time, they already had two young children.  The collective farm allotted them very little land because at that time, one family got only 200 square meters.  It was impossible to grow anything on such a small plot of land, and the family's expenses exceeded the profits.  Years passed, and the family grew to six people.  Sanabar's husband was a leading farmer in his native village, but disaster fell on the family in 2002, when Sanabar's husband was killed by unknown men.  Five years later, Sanabar and her children decided to move to the Chui valley.  The family bought a house in 2007 in the Poltavka village and started a livestock breeding business with the purchase of one horse.  Four years passed since then, and the family experienced many challenges during this time, but thanks to Sanabar's persistence and hard work, her business became successful.  Now the household has two horses and four sheep.  In addition, the family grows beats and sell kumyz (horse milk).  Sanabar is requesting a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two horses for fattening up.  Sanabar plans to use the loan for continued development and growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase horses and grow her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es natural de Hualahoyo, siempre ha vivido allí y en la actualidad vive con sus 3 hijos y su anciana madre en la casa que heredó. Desde su niñez se ha criando en una familia agricultora y ganadera de las cuales aprendió todo lo necesario para cultivar sus terrenos donde siembra maíz, papa, arveja, habas entre otros y criar a sus animales en su establo. Tras la separación de su esposo, esta ha sido su forma de vida, permitiéndole tener los ingresos necesarios. Ella vive de la venta de leche que producen sus vacas así como la venta de papa y maíz en el mercado local de su ciudad. Sus hijos la ayudan en estas tareas agrícolas y gracias a esa unión es que hoy tiene como recompensa sus ganancias. Ahora sus planes es la de  incrementar la cantidad de animales y adquirir vacas de buena raza para que produzcan más litros de leche al día. Tiene muchos años  que viene trabajando con MFP de manera  grupal, de las cuales es una de las socias más activas y puntuales de su banco comunal que siempre  demuestra su compromiso ante su grupo. El dinero lo invertirá  en la compra de sacos de abono y semilla para su próxima campaña de siembra en donde cultivará maíz y papa.
texts.en: Antonia is originally from the city of Hualahoyo. She has always lived there and she lives with her 3 children and her elderly mother in a house which she inherited. Since she was a girl she grew up in an agricultural and farming family. She learned all that she needs to cultivate her fields where she plants corn, potatoes, peas, fava beans, and other products. She raises her livestock in a stable. Following the separation from her husband, this has been her way of life and it has given her all the income that she needs. She lives from the sales of the milk produced by her dairy cows and from the sale of potatoes and corn in the city's local market. Her children help her in the agricultural work and it is thanks to this team effort that she is awarded with her income. Today her plans are to increase the quantity of livestock and to acquire a good breed of cattle to produce more milk per day. She has been with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) for many years in a group setting. She is one of the most active and punctual members in her communal bank. She demonstrates her commitment to her group. The funds will be invested in the purchase of sacks of manure and seeds for her next sowing campaign. She will cultivate corn and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase manure, and potato and corn seeds.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benita; la socia tiene 47 años; la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos ya son independientes y el menor de sus hijos tiene 11 años de edad;  La socia se  dedica principalmente a la agricultura, la socia tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz, también la socia cría animales menores, tales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos, ovejas, vacas, gallinas. La socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y ganados a la par que se dedica  a la administración,  siembra, cosecha y venta de maíz; así también a la cventa de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores para aumentarlos pocos que le quedan y comprar ovejitas también.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI” community bank which is located in Yungaqui district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Benita is 47 years old, married, and has five children.  Three of her children live independently and her youngest is 11 years old.  Benita mainly works in agriculture.  She has farmland sown with corn and also raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, cows and hens.  She raises small animals and livestock at the same time as she sows, harvests and sells corn.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying small animals to increase the small number that she has remaining.  She will also buy some lambs.

Benita is very happy with and grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying small animals and some lambs

loans.name: Calberina

texts.en:
Calberina is 29 years old and a livestock keeper. She is married to Peter. They are blessed with two children aged four and one years old. She has been keeping livestock for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.
 
She is applying for her second loan from KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy goats, sheep, and chickens to add her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will buy a lorry for transporting her livestock to far markets. Her hope is to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy goats, sheep, and chickens

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 31 years old and married with three children.

Cheryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as biscuits, detergent, and other miscellaneous items.

Cheryl has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Cheryl aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as biscuits, detergent, and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Kuña Aty Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres humildes y trabajadoras se unieron con el propósito de salir adelante mediante el apoyo conjunto y solidario de las demás. Ellas desean poder crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal, ya que saben que ese también es un aspecto muy importante. En este momento se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación, están trabajando muy a gusto y desean poder seguir dentro del programa.
La señora Rosalina se dedica a la venta de ropas, por medio de este trabajo ella obtiene los medios necesarios para poder mantener a su familia y a todos quienes de ella depende. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, como así también pedidos, lo cual le trae muy buenas ganancias. Desea poder seguir creciendo con su micro empresa y algún día poder tener un local propio donde ofrecer las prendas que tiene.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de estación, con lo que podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y clientas. Está muy contenta por la oportunidad que se le da.
texts.en:
A group of 18 modest working women got together in an effort to help each other get ahead through mutual support.  They want to grow not only economically but also personally because they know this aspect is also very important.  This is their second women entrepreneurs' cycle at the Fundación and they are working well and wanting to continue with the program.

Mrs. Rosalina sells clothing, and through her business has been able to maintain her family and all who depend on her.  She says she has many customers and many orders, so her earnings are considerable.  Her desire is to continue growing her micro-company and one day have her own clothing shop.

She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothing to fill orders that have already come in from customers.  She is very happy about being given this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tomas Regalado

texts.es:
Tomas, es agricultor y ganadero, vive con su esposa y 4 hijos de 8, 12, 13 y 17 años de edad, el lleva un buen tiempo dedicándose a la agricultura, pues inicio desde joven, inicia sus labores todos los días a las 7:00am hasta las 3:00pm.
Actualmente solicita el préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, con este dinero podrá tener acceso a los insumos necesarios y dar los cuidos al cultivo para que este se desarrolle y produzca buenos frutos.
El objetivo de él es como todo padre, preocupado por la educación de sus hijos para que tengan mejores oportunidades en un futuro.
texts.en:
Tomas is a farmer who also raises livestock.  He lives with his wife and four children aged 8, 12, 13 and 17.  He has been farming for a long time as he started out in this business when he was a young man.  He starts his tasks every day at 7.00am and works until 3.00pm.

Tomas is currently requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop.  He will use this money to buy the supplies he needs and to care for his crops so that they develop well and produce good fruit.  His goal, like that of every father, is to provide for his children's education so that they have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 46-year-old widow with eight children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a retail shop for two years, starting with capital from her late husband's salary benefits of 500,000 shillings. Now she has 2,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardships are price fluctuations and theft during transportation of her goods. Her vision is to own a wholesale business and to educate her children.

Mary needs this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 27-year-old young woman who is married with one son and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. Sahar has a project of raising poultry and benefits from selling its products. She wants to expand her project and purchase more poultry and more fodder to feed them, but the amount of money she has is not enough to pay for this. This is why she has requested a loan from FATEN. When Sahar gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to expand her project and purchase more poultry and fodder. This will increase her sales and increase her income, which will offer better life conditions for her and her family. Sahar is a conservative woman, so her husband Tha'er appears in the photograph instead.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and fodder.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en: Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver.  He wants to change the body of his rickshaw to help him drive it more smoothly and provide better quality transport services to his passengers.   Sughran herself is very active and performs her household duties very well.  She has given birth to 3 children, 2 of them are studying while her youngest child is not of school-going age yet.  Sughran is hopeful that this investment will help her husband save his business asset and increase his income.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 38 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and she has six children age 8 to 16. They are currently in school and live at home. Her husband is a security man.

For the past two years she has been selling coal in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 26-year-old single man living in a semi-permanent house with four people in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to work hard and earn income to sustain him and his family. He has been in the transportation business for the last three years where he has been working for other people. He has been challenged by high fuel prices and a bigger percentage he must remit to his boss. John needs a loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 44-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-aged children. 

Hussein has been working in selling computers for the past 20 years, and owned his shop since 2009. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. Today, he’s asking to borrow $1500 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more computers and products such as cables, keyboards, and many other items to sell in order to serve a wider range of clientele. In the future, he hopes to further enlarge his business.

loans.use: To purchase more computers and products such as cables, keyboards, and many other items.

loans.name: Salomatkhon

texts.ru: Саломатхон занимается купле-продажей фруктов и овощей. Она вдова и имеет 3 троих детей, она сама воспитывает их и ей тяжело одному. Более 5 лет она продает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищные условия и устроит своих детей в школу и ВУЗ-ах. Саломатхон запрашивает займ для покупки овощей и фруктов. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Salomatkhon works buying and selling fruit and vegetables. She is a widow and has three children. She is raising them herself, and it is difficult for her. For more than five years she has been selling produce. She wants to improve their standard of living and to enroll her children in school and college. Salomatkhon is asking for a loan to buy vegetables and fruit. She looks forward to your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Tity B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of one of the primary schools in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. Their school was set up to promote girl-child education in the district. The school is staffed with nineteen employees and has an enrollment of 750 pupils.
 
The staff of this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT (a partner of Kiva.org) to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their mere salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Thirty-nine-year-old Tity is the leader of this group of teachers.  She was born in Makeni. Tity is a widow. Her one child is attending primary school. She has served in the teaching profession for five years now. She has requested this loan in order to invest in her business. She has been doing business for four years now. With this loan she is going to buy women’s clothes, weavons, and sandals to sell.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes, weavons, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis sells fire wood and second-hand clothing at Abuenu.  His educational background was up to middle form 4.  He is married and has 5 children.  His wife is a trader.  Francis has been selling firewood and second-hand clothing for two years now. He uses his income to take care of his children and their school fees as well.  His loan will be used to purchase more firewood and second-hand clothing to sell. He would like to use the profit he will get from the business to cater for his children`s school fees.

loans.use: buy firewood and second-hand clothing

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en: Leonia is in her late thirties, married and has two children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by running a grocery store where she works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. and earns a good monthly profit. She is applying for her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her first three loans to buy more groceries to sell to her customers, and paid all the loans fully and on time. She hopes to use this new loan in the same way. Her goal for the future is to open a second grocery store in a different area. Leonia will share this loan with her 14-person loan group, which is called Faraja. The members of this group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 15 Octobre 2012  à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles commencent à  comprendre le programme car étant au deuxième cycle. Des qualités comme  solidarité et l’esprit d’épargne commencent à émerger. Ces  femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadidiatou (assise à l’extrême droite dans le deuxième ranger), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans  est  mariée et mère neuf enfants dont cinq garçons.  Elle est tient table au village où elle vend du sucre, du thé, des bonbons et batteries pour recharge radio et torche. 

Avec son  nouveau prêt elle compte acheter un sacre de sucre à 20 000 F CFA un carton de piles grand et petit modèle et des sachets de bonbons à la menthe pour la revente au village.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle tient à mieux assister son  mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group is composed of women from the same village. It was established on October 15. 2012, when their Banc Villageois was inaugurated. They start to understand the program since they are seeking their second loan. Qualities such as solidarity and a savings state of mind start to emerge. These women's main business is retail.

Mrs. Kadidiatou (sitting on the far right in the second row) is the group's featured borrower. She's 33 years old, married, and the mother of nine children, five of whom are boys. She has a stall in the village, where she sells sugar, tea, candies, and batteries to power radios and flashlights.

With this new loan, she intends to buy one sack of sugar costing XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40), one box of batteries (large and small sizes), and bags of mint candies to resell in the village.

With the profits earned from her business, she wants to better help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sack of sugar, one box of batteries, and bags of mint candies

loans.name: San Juana Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe has 3 beautiful children and every one is studying, her husband is a worker and works in a private company. She began her business since 4 years ago. With the necessity of supporting her husband with the family expenses, because the incomes that he receives are not enough to cover the family expenses and their child\'s education. She began to selling different articles like gifts. That is the way as every body knew her around her neighborhood, so she started to acquire more and more clients. Her family love has allowed her to undertake her business and she wants to offer a better education to her boy.

Guadalupe needs a loan of $275 USD to purchase merchandise for this Christmas season. She hopes an excellent season to sell her products; she expects your help and generosity. In a term of 4 months Guadalupe plans to return the loan.

\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Guadalupe tiene 3 hermosos hijos y cada uno se encuentra estudiando, su esposo es un tornero y trabaja para una empresa privada. Inicio hace 4 años su negocio ante la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que el salario que el recibe, no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de la familia y la educación de sus hijos. Por lo que comenzó vendiendo diferentes artículos para regalos y novedades, fue así como se dio a conocer a los alrededores de su colonia y empezó adquirir más clientes. Su amor por la familia le ha permitido emprender este negocio y tener la esperanza de ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación.

Guadalupe necesita de un préstamo de $275 USD para comprar mercancía como regalos y novedades para esta temporada navideña. Ella espera una excelente temporada para vender sus productos, por lo que espera de tu ayuda y generosidad. En un plazo de 4 meses Guadalupe planea devolver el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for this Christmas

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham is 29 years old and single. He runs a general store in the central business district of the city. Items for sale include flour, sugar, margarine, and heavy-duty transformers. With a big client base, he intends to use the KIVA loan to  increase his stock in the coming months to able to meet customer demand. He has undergone 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Miss Chung‘s husband died in an accident while he was digging a well for a neighbor. Miss Chung is supporting 3 children by herself. They are 11, 8, and 4 years old. All the children are going to school.

Miss Chung has only a little land, about 1000 square meters, for growing rice. Their main income is from Miss Chung’s sales of second-hand clothes at a small market.

Miss Chung took a second loan of $50 and she has already repaid that loan in a timely fashion. The loan helped Miss Chung’s family to increase their income by $1/person/month. Their average income is $13/person/month. Now, she would like to borrow $75 for her used clothing business.

loans.use: used clothes sales

loans.name: Wangang

texts.en:
G. is married and has seven children. His father died when he was a young boy. The death of his father deprived him of education as he had no one to support him. This memories coupled with the hardship he faced when he was sick are reasons he wants to earn and provide for his children.  He joined GHAPE in 2006 and took his first loan that same year. He succeeded in repaying the loan completely. He also provided excellent umbrella repair services to his community. Umbrellas are used during the rainy season which lasts from March to October. During the dry season the burning sunshine also calls for the use of umbrellas.

G. plans to increase his stock by buying needles, threat, spokes, handles and tarpaulin. This investment shall provide the community with shades (umbrellas) during the rainy season and the damaging sun rays.  He plans to repay his loan in 15 months, the first repayment installment  commencing at the end of the first month after disbursement.

loans.use: Repairing Umbrella

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: I learnt how to tailor but could not engage in it as a profession after my marriage. My husband used to be the only one providing for our family of six. However, last year I took out a loan and started a tailoring business so that I could add to my husband's earnings and support my family. With the money I earned I put all four of my children in school. I am managing very hard to make ends meet but still worry about paying the school fees and meeting my children's other needs. I therefore am requesting a loan of $300 with which to expand my tailoring business.

loans.use: Wants to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Esohe

texts.en: Esohe E. is 56 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells food. She learned the business from her mother and has been in this business since 1980. She is requesting a loan of $250 to buy more food items and soup things to improve her business. She is a LAPO member. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman (her husband is pictured) is married and has three children. Her family lives in Khachmaz region, in the village of Gusarchay. Khuraman has done orchard farming for two years. Now they need a loan of $850 to buy  fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Sophia's Omax Group

texts.en:
Sophia, age 28, is married with 2 children (ages 6 and 10). She owns a small cafe where she sells breakfast and lunch foods and snacks from 5am to 6pm daily. She opened this business in 2005 and now makes a monthly profit of about $55 from it.

In the past, Sophia took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy food stock for her cafe. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in sales of timber, food, and drinks.

loans.use: To buy food stock for her cafe

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba (her husband is pictured), who was born in 1974, is a mother of 2 children. The Aslanov's family lives in the Khachmaz region. Mahbuba has run this business for 2 years. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy seedlings and pesticides for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pesticides
