When she was young she learned the trade because her parents taught her agricultural work. She has been working in this business for seven years now, and it is going very well for her. At the moment Francisca needs the loan for personal use, in other words to pay university expenses for her two daughters.

The "Caminando Juntos" (Walking Together) communal bank belongs to Asociación Arariwa, and the members' meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Papel Pata, Echarate District, La Convención Province, Cusco Department.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her two daughters.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 49 years old and married to Phyllis. He has been running a motorcycle taxi as his primary business and hawking milk as his secondary business for two years with a monthly income of KES.10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to service his motorbike to help him supply milk to different places. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children. His hopes are for them continuing their education up to the university level.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 45 years old and married with three children.

Leonida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Leonida has taken out and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns extra income from raising pigs.

Leonida aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Maria Venancia

texts.es: María venancia tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, hace más de seis años que tiene este negocio la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda en donde llegan muchos clientes, familiares y amigos. Su negocio es como una alternativa para obtener ingresos. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosina, granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénico. Sueña con con tener una gran distribuidora en donde obtenga más ganancias.
texts.en:
María Venancia has a grocery store.  She has had this business for over six years.  The business is located at her house; many customers, relatives, and friends come to her store.

Her business is an opportunity to get income.

The loan is to buy sweets, basic grains, detergent, soup, canned goods, and toilet paper.

She dreams of having a large distributorship when she gets more income.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, detergent, soup, canned goods, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia, se dedica a la venta de verduras, vive con su familia y tiene una hija de 12 años, el negocio lo tiene desde hace un año, su familia le apoya mucho para atenderlo.
Ella necesita realizar la compra de plátanos, güisquil, tomates, cebollas, papas, para incrementar la mercadería, esta inversión le ayudara para tener mayor variedad y frutas frescas.
El propósito de ella es ser una microempresaria de éxito, mejorar el negocio, aumentar los ingresos al hogar y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia sells vegetables. She lives with her family and has one 12-year-old daughter. She has had her business for one year, and her family helps her greatly in tending to it.
She needs to buy plantains, pear squash, tomatoes, onions, and potatoes in order to increase her merchandise. This investment will help her to have a greater variety, and to have fresh fruits.
She intends to be a successful microentrepreneur, to improve her business, to increase her household income, and to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy plantains, pear squash, tomatoes, onions, potatoes.

loans.name: Sadiye

texts.en:
Sadiye is 55 years old and married. She has four children. The youngest child is 23 and the oldest one is 35 years old.

"Before I started the trading business, I was a housewife. I raised four kids, but while I was struggling against financial problems, I could buy and sell a very little amount  of goods. Later I decided to open my own shop. Taking the support of my husband and my oldest son, I  opened my own shop. However, I have been through very hard times, and unfortunately I had to close my shop when I could not afford the rent. Back at home, I finished the remaining products by selling them to relatives, and I somehow managed to pay my debts." 

"Just when I thought I was desperate, I discovered Maya. With the loans I borrowed from Maya, I bought new products from a wholesaler and I am back in business in my house. With the loans I borrowed from Maya, I can buy more products with a cheaper total price. My plans for the future are, if my affairs continue to go as fast and as well as they are going now, to open a shop--not in the city center but in a closer spot to my house--and to support my children and grandchildren as much as I can (by means of both financial and psychological support). My family is really important to me. I love my children and grandchildren so much."

This person’s distinctive characteristics: an ambitious and unyielding woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff


Sadiye Hanım 55 yaşında ve evli.Dört çocuğu var.En küçüğü 23 ve en büyüğü 35 yaşında.Ticarete başlamadan önce ev hanımıydım 4 çocuk büyütmüştüm ama maddi sıkıntılar içinde zorlanırken az az mal alıp  evde satıyordum.Daha sonra dükkan açmaya karar verdim başlarken eşimin ve büyük oğlumun desteğini alarak dükkan açtım. Fakat çok zor dönmenlerden geçtim kiramı,vergimi ödeyemez hale gelince dükkanımı kapatmak zorunda kaldım. Elimde kalan mallarımı ise evde çevreme satarak bitirdim ve borçlarımı bu şekilde ödedim.Tam ümidimi yitirdim derken Maya ile tanıştım.Maya'dan aldığım kredi ile tekrar toptancılardan mal aldım ve evimde ticaret yapıyorum.Maya'dan almış olduğum kredi ile daha çok mal alabiliyorum ve daha ucuza alabiliyorum.Gelecek için planlarım ise eğer işlerim böyle hızlı ve güzel giderse bu sefer çarşı merkezde değil, evime daha yakın biryerlerde dükkan açmak ve çocuklarıma torunlarıma maddi anlamda elimden geldiği kadar yardımcı olabilmek.Ailem benim için çok önemlidir. Çocuklarımı ve torunlarımı çok seviyorum.Hırslı ve yılmayan bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy new products.

loans.name: Mawutin Group

texts.fr: MAWUTIN est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Chantal. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Chantal est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Chantal est mariée à un frigoriste du nom de Maurice. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant.Chantal n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Chantal mène comme activité, la vente de la farine de maïs. Chantal s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Chantal et aux autres membres du groupe MAWUTIN de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Mawutin is a group with three members.  The group's representative (who is raising her hand in the photo) is called Chantal.  The members of this group live in the same area of Benin. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group are requesting their third loan from ALIDé.

Chantal is 42 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to a refrigeration technician called Maurice.  The couple do not have any children.  Chantal never went to school.  In order to provide for herself, Chantal runs a business selling cornstarch.  She stocks up in one of the markets in Benin.  This business makes her income which helps her to cover her family's various expenses.  This third loan will allow Chantal and the other members of the Mawutin group to expand their businesses and increase their number of customers and their income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 55 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She also earns an income from farming rice.

Salvacion is requesting a loan for 18,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  Salvacion has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 23 años, vive con su madre en Ibarra que es la Capital de la Provincia de Imbabura en el Norte del Ecuador. Jorge se describe como una persona alegre, tranquila, paciente y muy trabajadora.

Jorge trabaja junto con su madre en la venta de ropa, en un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que será invertido en la compra de mercadería como es camisetas, calentadores, ropa interior, etc, que le servirá para incrementar los productos en su negocio y sus clientes tengan variedad para escojer y así generará buenos ingresos económicos que le servirá para ayudarle a su madre.

Jorge sueña con tener una casa propia y tener un local grande de ropa.
texts.en:
Jorge is 23 years old and lives with his mother in Ibarra, the capital of Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador.  Jorge describes himself as a cheerful, calm, patient and very hard-working person.

Jorge works together with his mother selling clothes on a stall in the town market.  This is the first loan that he has requested from Fodemi.  He will invest it in buying merchandise such as t-shirts, legwarmers, underwear, etc. which will help him to increase the products that he sells and his customers will have a wider variety of products from which to choose.  This will make him good income which he will use to help his mother.

Jorge dreams of owning his own home and having a large clothes store.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, legwarmers and underwear to increase his business

loans.name: Rechilda

texts.en:
This is Rechilda, 52, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Ramon, a market vendor. Rechilda is a mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rechilda operates a plastic-ware retail business. What she does is buy plastic-ware products from wholesalers and sell them per item at a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offered. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 25,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rechilda dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 16  filhos dos quais 2 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 2ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ele. 

É pedreiro ha mais de 30 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa(areia, pranchas, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros).O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 25.000.00mt para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alexandre was born in the District of Boane, Province of Maputo, South of Mozambique, is married and the father of 16 children, 2 of which still attend school. He completed 2nd grade and didn’t continue with his education due to his parents’ lack of financial means.

He has been a stonemason for more than 30 years and has a monthly income of around 9,000.00 meticals (MZN) which he uses on household expenditures and saves in his bank account (BIM).

He has never has loans with other banks and he came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase construction materials for his house (sand, planks, cement, stone, iron and others). His first loan was for: 25,000.00 MZN also for his home.

Alexandre commits to paying off his loan and in future intends to complete the build of his house and to furnish it, for which he will solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for his house (sand, planks, cement, stone, iron and others)

loans.name: Takou Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Groupe crée depuis l'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui haibitent pratiquement la même localité. 

Madame Khady, debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46  Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a aussi en charge les 3 enfants de sa co-épouse. 

Elle fait comme activité l'embouche ovine. Avec son financement elle va acheter des brebis pour l'engraisser et les revendre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple en participant à l'amélioration de la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group, created at the opening of the banc villageois, is composed of 10 women who live around the same location. 

Madame Khady, standing on the far right of the photo, is the leader of the group. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is also responsible for the 3 children of her co-spouse. 

She works as a sheep fattener. With this loan she is going to buy sheep for fattening that she can then resell. She is experienced in this domain, having practiced this trade for many years. 

Her profits will permit her to support her husband in taking care of the family, for example, by helping to improve their nourishment.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en:
Ajoh is a 42 year old a married woman who has six children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in bor, south Sudan for three years.

Ajoh has requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Diro Enrique

texts.es: Diro con su credikiva, adecuó su local y compró una mesa de billar , ahora hay mas comodidad para sus clientes y él está mas satisfecho con su inversión. Su meta mas adelante es cambiar el piso del local y hacer una segunda planta para hacer un apartamento y tener una vejéz tranquila. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará bebidas al por mayor, para tener su negocio bien surtido y responder a su clientela, en las fiestas de fin de año, que es el mes donde mas se consumen cervezas, gaseosas y demás redrescos y licores.Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Que continuen con las proyecciones sociales para ayudar a los microemrpesarios. "
texts.en: With his Kiva loan Diro modified his place of business and bought a pool table.  Now his customers are more comfortable and he is more satisfied with his investment.  His future goal is to change the floor of his place, add a second floor for an apartment, and have peace in his old age.  Currently, he is applying for a new Kiva loan with which he will buy beverages so his business will be well-stocked.   This way he will be able to serve his customers for New Year's celebrations as this is when the most beer, soda and other refreshments and liquor are consumed.  His message to Kiva lenders is he hopes that "you continue with the social projects to help small businesses."

loans.use: purchase beverages wholesale.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca de 53 años convive con Luis, su incondicional pareja con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, los menores. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María, provincia de Chanchamayo. Rebeca es una mujer de campo. Se dedica a la agricultura, en sus 2 parcelas de terrenos siembra de café y plátanos. “Es muy cansado este trabajo por eso me ayudan mi esposo y mis hijos”, comenta.
De esa manera sus 2 hijos que ya son independientes, pudieron salir de la familia con una base educativa y de emprendimiento para formar sus nuevos hogares. 
Lleva más de 30 años en esta actividad y ha tenido que afrontar problemas como la falta de personal, el clima, y las enfermedades de sus plantaciones. A sus 53 años cree que puede solucionar con facilidad e inteligencia esos inconvenientes. Sus fuerzas no serán las mismas unos años más adelante, así que piensa adquirir un pequeño automóvil para movilizar sus productos hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki y para uso personal.
Así ahorrará en el gasto de traslados o fletes. Éste sería su primer préstamo que obtendría gracias a su ayuda de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se siente contenta y emocionada por el trabajo en grupos.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos, los que esparcirá en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
53-year-old Rebeca lives with Luis, her unconditional partner, with whom she has 5 children. Only 3 of the children live with her, the youngest ones. They live in their own home in the indigenous community of Villa María, in the province of Chanchamayo. Rebeca is a rural woman. She works in agriculture, and on her two parcels of land, cultivates coffee and bananas. “This work is very tiring, so my husband and children help me,” she comments.
In this way, her two children that are already independent were able to leave the family with a base of education and entrepreneurship to form their own homes.
She has been working in this activity for over 30 years and has had to face problems like the lack of workers, climate and sicknesses on her plantations. At 53 years old, she believes she can easily and intelligently solve these inconveniences. Her strength will not be the same a few years in the future, so she is thinking of acquiring a small automobile to transport her products to the city of Pichanaki and for personal use. 
In this way she will save on relocation and transport expenses. This would be her first loan that she would obtain thank to the help of MFP, so she takes the responsibility to be punctual in her monthly payments. She just became a member of the communal bank “Los Productores Yaneshas” with which she is happy and excited for the group work.
She will invest the money in buying 10 sacks of organic fertilizer, which she will spread in her coffee cultivation.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man, 39, and he has 4 children between the ages of 1 and 11. 

He operates a boda (bicycle transportation) business in an urban area; he has been in this business for six years. He will use the loan of Kes 15,000 to buy another bicycle for transportation purposes. 

George plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in his business. He is a committed person, hopes to open a transport company in the future, and to own some motorcycles in five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy another bicycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Ihusi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zahiga est une commerçante depuis 3 ans et membré d’un groupe d’affaires « Ihusi », âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse  des  poissons  frais. Elle étale sa marchandise tout au long de la route dans un quartier animé. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 250 poissons frais. Son conjoint,lui aussi, est commerçant. Elle avait commencé ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital,  scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancable. Il sied de signaler certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Zahiga has been a merchant for three years and is a member of the business group "Ihusi." She is 31 years old, married, and a mother of four children, who all go to school.

Zahiga sells fresh fish. She displays her fish along a road in a busy part of town. She is seeking a loan with Hekima in order to expand her business. She is going to buy 250 fresh fish.

Her husband also is a merchant. She had started her business with funds she received from her husband.

In the future, she wishes to increase her capital, and educate, clothe, and feed her children. 

Zahiga thanks Hekima for their support to female entrepreneuers who do not qualify for banking services. 

To note, there are some clients who are carrying their children and some other curious children who have climbed on the wall in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 250 fresh fish

loans.name: Mohamed E.

texts.en:
In 2012, Mohamed established his land pure water production business. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are adults. He began his business to develop his family.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,450,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to add to his business capital and to produce more pure water for resale.  

Mohamed does not meet his target of expanding to new areas, based on the profit he raised that is not enough. However, he still plans to expand his business by producing gas and locating another landscape company to all district headquarters.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy water processing equipment.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix sells a variety of household products from his tricycle cart. He has been in this line of work for more than 20 years. He began as an assistant for his father in law and moved on to start his own operation with the help of his wife. She is an integral part of the business as she helps him purchase and distribute products. He sells to many of his clients on credit and she also helps him with the collection of payments.

Felix is seeking the loan in order to continue investing in products for the Christmas season such as lights and decorations. He and his wife have 3 kids together. They have been living in their home for over 12 years and they aspire to continue improving it. When they first moved in they lacked most basic services but things have been slowly getting better.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Fali

texts.en: Fali does not want to waste any working day of the week. From Monday to Friday, she spends and manages her time well.  She goes out to fish and then sells her seafood on the roadside. The income of two hundred tala daily makes it possible for her to put her children in school, pay for family obligations, and repay her debts to SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear (spears, goggles, bottles) and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en: Nafisa lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and she does housework. Her husband is a taxi driver. She took her 3rd cycle group loan and her husband bought new equipment for his car and makes a good monthly income. Now his wife wants to take anther loan for her husband to buy new tires for his car. He is very happy now that he can expand his business and help his family. He would like to thank his wife for helping him.

loans.use: To buy new tires

loans.name: Fon

texts.en:
M. is married with seven children. Her children's education is her primary motivation. She borrowed from neighbors at a very high interest rate before receiving her first loan of $40 from GHAPE, which she invested in crop cultivation. Before receiving her first loan she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline, which has been reinforced by bi-monthly meetings.

Given a loan of $200, M. plans to expand her pig-farm by constructing 2 stalls and buying a piglet. She plans to cultivate foodstuffs using manure from her pigs. She will then supply food and manure to neighbors and consequently increase the supply of foodstuffs and meat in the community.

M. plans to pay her loan over 18 months. Loan repayment will begin four months after loan disbursement.

loans.use: Pigs and retailing of foodstuff

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Mrs. Khin K., 25, lives with her husband, 28, in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with their 2 children. She earns $3.60 a day breeding pigs and also works at the grinding mill.

Her husband adds $4 to the family's earnings by working as a mechanic. He buys broken motorcycles, fixes them, and then resells them.

Khin K. has applied for this loan so that her husband can purchase more spare parts for this business. She would also like to purchase more pigs to breed, to add to their family's income. ( her husband pictured here because Khin K. is unavailable)

loans.use: Spare parts for motorbikes

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Sr. Elias D. is married to Enriqueta Villalaba and they have 3 children, two sons and a daughter. All the children are grown, with jobs of their own, but they still live with their parents, pooling their earnings together to support the household. Sr. Elias repairs and sells mobile phones with the help of his wife. He started the business with capital raised from the sale of part of his property in 1994. He subsequently learned to repair mobile phones, a highly income-producing skill. One of his projects is to add rooms to his house so that they no longer have to share the same rooms.

He's applying for a loan to buy more merchandise--cell phones, cases, batteries, chargers, etc.--for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Elías D. es casado, su señora se llama Enriqueta Villalba, tienen 3 hijos, dos varones y una mujer. Todos son mayores de edad, ellos trabajan en forma independiente, pero siguen viviendo en la casa con los padres aportando con los ingresos mensuales. El señor Elías vende y repara celulares, ayudado de su esposa. Se inició en la venta con un pequeño capital que obtuvo al vender un terreno de su propiedad en el año 94, posteriormente se capacitó en reparación de celulares, cuya profesión le es muy rentable. Uno de sus proyectos es la de construir más piezas de modo a distribuir mejor la casa ya que viven entre varios en la misma.

Solicita el crédito para comprar mas mercaderías para el negocio, como celulares, estuches para celulares, baterías, cargadores de baterías, etc.

loans.use: Buy mobile phone products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to meet client demand

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en: I am Suriya L. Ali. I have lived all my life in the small town of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I have five children: four boys and one girl. My eldest son is a truck driver, my second son works in a hotel, and the youngest two are tailors. My daughter is married. My husband is a farmer and works on someone else's fields on contract; he also keeps a few cows on his field. Now, I would like to buy an additional cow for my husband. The loans that we took out earlier helped us expand our business and construct a brick house for our family. I am the leader of a group of several women; we formed our loan group three years ago. My group members are: Koser B. needs a loan for their grocery store, Haneefan B. requires a loan for their restaurant, Sughran B. wants to invest loan in her embroidery business. All these women are very hardworking entrepreneurs and play an important part in supplementing the family income.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: 3 years ago, this single man started taxi business. He lives in Khachmaz region and was born in 1980. Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy spare parts for this car so he can improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina Y. is a polite and hard-working entrepreneur in Berdyansk, Ukraine. Known for her honesty and dedication, she works long hours running her own small clothing store, which sells mainly athletic wear and socks.

Irina's lucky because her store is located in an excellent location, so she has an excellent sale rate. That's why she's confident she will be able to repay a loan of $500 U.S. dollars in full. Irina is single and lives with her parents, but the high inflation rate in the Ukraine is making it difficult for her family to maintain their basic standard of living. With the loan, Irina hopes to purchase more inventory to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for a small retail store

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Remansito Group

texts.es:
This group is named "Mujeres Trabajadoras de Remansito" (Remansito Working Women). When one of its members heard of the program Committee of Women Entrepreneurs from a participating neighbor, and realized its benefits of and the progress attained, she decided to contact her neighbors to get their own committee together. The information sessions were a success and the group was formed. Its members, hard working and active women, are devoted to different activities, such as sales of natural medicines, bijouterie, cosmetics, ice cream, fast food, spices, meat and entrails, as well as clothes confection.

The group has 16 members and is located in the Remansito neighborhood of Ciudad del Este, a city in the border with Brazil characterized by great commercial activity.

These women, apart from being housewives and micro entrepreneurs, also organize diverse activities to raise funds in order to improve their neighborhood. They are a united group that pays the loans timely. They know that responsibility in making payments is crucial, as is communication between them and solidarity. The requested loan will be used in the purchase of merchandise to sell in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Este grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Trabajadoras de Remansito. Se inició gracias a que una de las integrantes tuvo conocimiento del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, a través de una vecina que ya formaba parte de un comité. Al ver el progreso logrado y los beneficios del mismo, esta señora decidió contactar a sus vecinas para formar su propio comité. Las reuniones informativas fueron un éxito y se logró formar el grupo que está compuesto por señoras muy trabajadoras y activas. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como venta de medicinas naturales, bijouterie, cosméticos, helados, comidas rápidas, carne y menudencias, especias o condimentos y confección de ropas.

El grupo está conformado por 16 integrantes y se encuentra localizado en el Barrio Remansito de Ciudad del Este, una ciudad en la frontera con Brasil, caracterizada por el gran movimiento comercial.

Estas mujeres, además de ser amas de casa y microempresarias, también realizan actividades con el fin de recaudar fondos para mejoras en su barrio. Es un grupo unido y muy puntual en sus créditos, ya que ellas saben que es primordial la responsabilidad en los pagos, la comunicación entre ellas y la solidaridad principalmente. El crédito retirado será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías para la venta en sus negocios.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing items (shirts, pants, skirts, etc.), ice cream, sugar, meat, spices, natural medicines, bijouterie and other merchandise.

loans.name: Akpénè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akpénè F., maiden name D., was born on September 29th, 1961 in Gbalavé. She is married and the mother of two children. She has sold cloth in the Hédzranawoé Market in Lomé since 1993. She usually buys cloth that comes from China at the Main Market in Lomé, and sells it at her stand in the Hédzranawoé Market. She also helps her husband who sells beverages. She currently has a wide variety of cloth, so with her first loan she would like to diversify her business by selling cosmetic products. To that end, she would like to buy two boxes of cream and one box of perfurme. She will also augment her stock of cloth with twenty seven new pieces of cloth, each in different styles and designs.

Translated from French by Megan Berwick, Kiva Fellow at WAGES.

Madame F. E. D. Akpénè est née le 29 septembre 1961 à Gbalavé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 1993, elle exerce le commerce de pagne dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle a l’habitude d’acheter les pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et de la chine avant de les revendre dans le marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle aide son mari qui est un revendeur de boisson. Actuellement son stock de pagne n’est pas épuisé mais avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle désire associer le commerce des produits cosmétiques. A cet effet elle désir acheter deux (2) cartons de crème, un (1) carton de parfum, et vingt sept (27) pièces de pagne.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to diversify her business, as well as new types of cloth.

loans.name: Bashira

texts.en: Bashira O. lives in Shibiri, Ekunpa, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells rubber shoes and sandals in her community. It took her 4 years to learn this business, and she has been in business since 1996. She is 42 years old and is married with 5 children. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more rubber shoes and sandals so that she can keep her business booming and satisfy the demands of her numerous customers, thereby increasing her profit margin. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more rubber shoe and sandals

loans.name: Yawogan Sekonou

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawogan Sekonou F. was born in Lomé on May 10, 1985. He is a bachelor whose occupation is the sale of electronics in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. He began this occupation in 2006 and gets his merchandise at the autonomous port of Lomé. He restocks monthly.

This, the first loan that he is requesting, will allow him to purchase five TVs, ten radios and five DVD players. All the appliances he wishes to buy are second-hand and will be bought at relatively low prices, allowing him to gain considerable income.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 10 mai 1985 à Lomé, monsieur F. Yawogan Sekonou est un célibataire qui a pour activité la vente des appareils électroniques dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Il a commencé cette activité depuis l’année 2006 et s’approvisionne au port autonome de Lomé. Sa fréquence d’approvisionnement est mensuelle.

Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 postes téléviseurs, 10 postes de radio et 5 lecteurs de DVD ; tous ces appareils qu’il désire acheter sont des appareils d’occasion et sont achetés à un prix relativement bas ce qui lui permet de tirer assez de revenus.

loans.use: Purchase of electronics

loans.name: Umuru

texts.en: Umuru A. is 33 years old and married with one child.  He lives in Jattu, in the Edo state of Nigeria, and is in the business of selling bags of garri, which is a product of cassava that has been ground and fried.  Umuru sells the bags of garri at the local market in his community for a profit, and has also been a long-time secretary of the microfinance lending group in his area.  In order to expand his business, Umuru is requesting a loan of $1,025 to purchase more bags of garri for resale.

loans.use: To buy more bags of garri for sale.

loans.name: Non

texts.en: Mrs. Non N., 31 years old, is a vegetable grower; she earns around US $3.2 per day. Her husband, who is 37 years old, is a construction worker. Non grows vegetable crops such as beans, cabbages, and cucumbers and she sells to the market. Non lives with her husband and two children. All of their children are young and in school. To increase their family's income, she needs a loan to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El sr. Eusebio González tiene 53 años y esta casado con la sra. Francisca González de 45 años, tienen 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están trabajando actualmente en la Argentina , los mismos tienen 27 , 24 y 22 respectivamente. Los 3 restantes viven con el y el mayor que tiene 29 años trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transporte de cargas , uno de 26 años que se encarga de atender a los clientes de la parrillada y una de 20 años que esta cursando la carrera de ingeniería comercial.

El sr . Eusebio posee la parrillada desde hace 10 años sobre la Avda. Acceso Sur donde prepara carne asada a la parrilla y a la estaca. También preparan minutas como empanadas, tortillas y otros tipos de comestibles.

El mismo desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de un refrigerador panorámico para poder tener mayor volumen de bebidas para la venta, también en la compra de mesas y sillas para poder brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Eusebio G. is 53 years old and has been married to Mrs. Francisca G. for 45 years. They have 6 children, 3 of which are currently working in Argentina and are 27, 24 and 22 respectively. The other three live with them. The oldest is 29 years old and works as a driver in a cargo transport company, one is 26 and is in charge of taking care of the customers at the grill and one is 20 years old and is studying for a career in commercial engineering. Mr. Eusebio has had a barbecue for 10 years on Access South Ave. where he prepares roast meat on the grill and on large stakes over coals. He also prepares dishes such as empanadas (stuffed pastries), tortillas and other items to eat. He wants to invest the loan in the purchase an industrial refrigerator to be able to have a greater volume of drinks for sale, and also to purchase tables and chairs in order to provide greater convenience to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase industrial refrigerator, tables and chairs

loans.name: Ana Amelia

texts.es:
Ana inició el negocio para poder ayudar en los gastos familiares, es madre de un niña de 6 años y un niño de 1 año, ya que como su esposo trabaja por su cuenta a veces no le iba bien y batallaban económicamente, además de los imprevistos como cuando se les enfermaba alguno de sus hijos, es por eso que ella decide emprender un actividad por su cuenta para tener un ingreso extra. Comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo bolsas a sus amigas y hoy en día tiene un mayor numero de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $450 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía en su negocio con la finalidad de poder abarcar a mas clientes.
texts.en:
Ana started the business in order to be able to help with the family expenses. She has a 6-year-old daughter and a 1-year-old son. Her husband is self-employed and sometimes things would be rough and they would be struggling financially. Also because of unforeseen events, such as one of their children getting sick, she decided to start a business on her own in order to earn extra income. She started selling handbags to her friends 2 years ago, and she now has a greater number of customers.

She needs a loan of $450.00 USD, which will be repaid in 5 months, in order to purchase merchandise for her business with the aim of attracting more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar was born in 1987 and lives in Baku city. He is single. He has been in the business of selling music discs for a year. Now Vugar needs a loan of $625 to buy more discs to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy music discs to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank.   Teresa is 45 years old and married with three children. Teresa sells cheese from door to door; sometimes she also sells on credit. She buys the cheese in the town of Alpachaca, and sometimes buys milk to make the cheese herself.  

Teresa is requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy a stove.  Teresa dreams of building her own home, improving her business and providing her children with a good quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a stove to increase cheese production

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en:
Mr. Chhea A., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Sun Leng, 45, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1980 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other children attend school and help their parents in their farming business when they are free from school.

Chhea and his wife have been growing rice for 29 years. Beside farming, they also buy mangoes from their villagers on contract for re-sale in their village. Chhea is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a rice-milling machine.

loans.use: To purchase a rice-milling machine

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda  tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. DesD. hace 5 años trabaja cada día en el comercio ambulante, y en este tiempo ha visto el fruto D. su esfuerzo por lo que está muy animada D. seguir adelante con su trabajo. Yolanda venD. productos nativos D. su zona (queso, choclos y truchas), con varios días D. anticipación adquiere su mercadería D. las zonas rurales lejanas. Como los productos que venD. son frescos y a bajo precio garantiza la venta rápida D. toda su mercadería por lo que ha decidió aumentar su capital D. trabajo y D. esa manera tener más ganancias. Esta es la quinta vez que Yolanda tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es una D. las socias D. su grupo más comprometida y solidaria para realizar diferentes actividades, además los impulsa a todos para emprender labores nuevas en su banco comunal. Yolanda esta solicitando este dinero para incursionar en al venta D. carne, al cual comprará al por mayor para venderla en el mercado D. su ciudad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and she lives with her husband and two children. For the past five years she has been working every single day as an ambulatory salesperson. During this time she has seen the fruits of her labor and she is very excited about continuing to move forward in her job. Yolanda sells products that are native to her region, like cheese, corn and trout. She obtains the products from rural areas a few days before she begins to sell them. Since the products that she sells a fresh and her price is low, she always sells out of her merchandise quickly. Because of this she would like to increase the capital of her business and purchase more merchandise. This way she will be able to increase her earnings. This is the fifth time that Yolanda has received a loan through MFP, and she is one of the members of a group that is most committed and shows the most solidarity. She also helps to motivate people to do jobs in the communal bank that are new to them. Yolanda is asking for this loan so that she can begin to sell meat, which she with buy wholesale and then sell it at the main market of her city.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Get into selling meat

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat K.  is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Shahodat started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses, and she also needed her own income in order to afford her home. She began 6 years ago selling clothing for kids and shoes. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then. With the purpose of expanding her business, she is requesting a loan of 600 USD, which she is promising to repay over 9 months. This way, Shahodat hopes to earn more and to meet her children’s expenses.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for her business

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Муаззам клиентка в Микроинвесте уже третий год.Она каждый займ использует для завоза товаров.Следующий займ она хочет погашать в течении 8 месяцев, т.к. её оборот на сегодня достаточен для частого пополнения.Она говорит, что при необходимости она даст заявку на параллельный займ.В течении трёх лет кредитования по словам Муаззам, ей удалось расширить свой оборот в несколько раз,у неё была одна точка , а на сегодня три, где торгуют её сыновья.Муаззам благодарна Микроинвест и KIVA за поддержку.
texts.en:
Muazzam is in her third year as a MicroInvest client. She uses her loans to procure goods. She wants to repay the loan in eight months. Her sales are good enough that she must restock often. She says that if necessary, she will request a secondary loan. During three years of taking out loans, according to Muazzam, she has managed to expand sales several times. She had one shop, and now she has three in which her sons work. Muazzam is grateful to Kiva and MicroInvest for their support.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: women's shoes

loans.name: Amenyo

texts.en:
Amenyo Afaokpah is thirty-six years old. He is married with two children. Both children are still in junior high school. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 
Amenyo is a trader. He trades in agrochemicals. He purchases the chemicals from the agricultural offices in the district capital. He stocks chemicals like insecticides, pesticides, herbicides, and all types of fertilizers.  He owns a shop in which he sells his products. According to him, farmers in the nearby small communities come to buy the chemicals to apply on their farms. He says he also treks to other towns to supply customers there. Amenyo has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure agrochemicals in bulk so that he can distribute to more customers.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
M. Betty, together with her group members, has successfully completed the repayment of her loan and she is now applying for another one.

Her matooke-selling business is doing well and this is possible because the yields of the matooke (green bananas) from her farm are of high quality, hence being favored by her customers. Also, the pricing is good since the bananas are not so much in plentiful supply. Betty also buys from other farmers that have quality yields in the far away villages and this enables her to have much more to sell to her ever-increasing number of customers.

Betty needs a new loan to help with clearing another piece of land where she can put in fresh cultivations and to buy more bunches of matooke for sale.

loans.use: To pay for manpower on her farm and to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia V. is from the town of Cabatuan. She is 54 years old. Nelia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a business making and selling fried foods in the local community. Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman someday.

About ASKI:

ASKI, a Kiva partner, is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Khalida Parveen Qasim Ali Group

texts.en:
Nabeela baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 
Muniran baji and Arshad baji each want a loan to buy auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 
Shamim baji wants a loan to buy vehicle oil to sell. 

Khalida parveen baji is a very hardworking lady and a group leader of these above-mentioned ladies. She is a very responsible and good-natured lady. All of her members respect her a lot. She runs her decorative embroidery business. She takes orders from the cloth shops and charges them according to the work. Her husband has a juice corner in the community where he sells different fruit juices and earns an income. People come to him from different communities for juice. Khalida baji is applying for a loan to buy another juicer machine for her husband’s juice corner. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another juicer machine

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: N. Daniel est né le 22 Octobre 1973. Daniel est marié et est père de quatre (04) enfants dont un (01) seul est scolarisé. Daniel réside avec sa famille à Amouloko dans la Commune de Akpro Missérété. Daniel est couturier et les moyens financiers dont il dispose actuellement ne lui permettent pas de bien développer son activité de couture et de satisfaire bien la demande de ses clients dont le nombre ne cesse de s'accroître. C’est la raison pour laquelle Daniel s’est dirigé vers ALIDé pour avoir un crédit.
texts.en:
N. Daniel was born on October 22, 1973. He is married and the father of four children, of whom just one is in school. Daniel resides with his family in Amouloko in the community of Akpro Missérété. He is a tailor, and the financial means he has at his disposal do not currently allow him to develop his tailoring business and to satisfy his customers, who are every-growing in number. This is the reason why he inquired with ALIDÉ for obtaining a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.en: The members of this group all live in the same community, and know each other very well. They have a surprising diversity of businesses. One woman buys and sells pigs, and would like a loan to buy more pigs to increase her business. Other women have stores that sell cosmetics, meals, and groceries, and would like to buy more stock for their stores. One member is a bricklayer who works in the area. In addition, some women have bread shops, fruit stands, and soft drink stands. All of the women are committed to improving their businesses by increasing their stock and paying back their loan on time. This group have previous experience with loans.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to increase her business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is from the village of Pag-asa, Dumalinao, Zambaonga del sur. She is 40 years old. Mercy is married. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets for fattening. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mercy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu L. is from the village of Dullan. She is 43 years old. Marichu is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Marichu owns and operates a nipa hut-making business in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling nipa hut products in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marichu joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marichu is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and utilized as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Marichu from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Tonkolili Group

texts.en:
This is a photo of Isatu S., Posseh C., Mamusu F. and Alpha C.. They named their group Tonkolili Group, after their district of origin. They are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their living standards. 

Isatu S. (second from right) is the leader of this group. Isatu is now age thirty-six, married to a businessman, and they have four children. Two of her children are in primary school and the other two are in secondary school. Isatu was born in Magburaka town, Tonkolili district, but now resides in Makeni where she sells local products like rice, palm-oil, ground-nuts, etc. Isatu has more than five years of experience in business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rose Nyambura

texts.en:
Rose is married to John M., who is a businessman. The couple has three children, aged 15, 12 and 7. Rose has been operating her retail shop for a while now. Her business is strategically placed and thus she is able to serve many customers. 

Rose was introduced to KADET through existing clients. She does not have a previous credit history with any other micro-finance institution. She has applied for a loan, which she plans to use to add stock to her retail shop with things like tea leaves, soya and coffee. With the extra profits, Rose wants to open a stall to buy bulk stock thus getting maximum profits.

Rose believes that she is very hardworking and thus her future hopes and dreams are to start another business of selling cereals to add the family income.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to add stock of tea leaves, soya and coffee.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
When people live on different islands with different cultures, livelihoods, and practices, they tend to be regionalistic and can sometimes be biased against migrants. This was the experience of Manuela P. and her family when unavoidable circumstances forced them to move from the island of Panay to the village of Sitio Napulo, Barangay Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental.

When they lived in the Province of Iloilo, Manuela's husband earned his living through farming, but when they moved to Escalante, a seaside town where the main activity was fishing, they were like fish out of water. At first life was hard as they adjusted to their new life and new circumstances. Once they adapted to their new environment and assimilated into the local community, the couple started looking for better ways to support their family.

Once settled, she started making new friends in Escalante, and one of them invited her to do something that literally changed her life. When she said yes to her friend to attend an orientation at NWTF-Project Dungganon, Manuela opened a new door in her life. With 3 kids to raise and a family to support, she was receptive to new ideas, and when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997, she decided to invest her first loan into a fishing business, because she observed that it provided a decent living for most of her neighbors. Even with no previous experience, the couple was able to make a go of this new venture, and they were able to payback the first loan.

Striving hard to move out of poverty, they kept focus on their goals, and as the loan amounts available to them increased because of their good business practices and prompt payments, they were eventually able to buy a motorized fishing boat which allowed them to go farther out to sea. They also bought additional fishing nets and crab traps, increasing their income potential.

The business earns a net income of PHP 4,000 per month which helps a lot in supporting their family. She just paid off her previous loan of PHP 7,000, her 8th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, which she used to buy fishing tools. Now she is borrowing PHP 9,000 for her 9th loan cycle to repair their fishing boat and nets so that she and her husband can continue earning a livelihood for their family of five.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To repair their fishing boat and buy fish nets.

loans.name: Ester Violeta

texts.es:
La señora ESTER VIOLETA G. P. , tiene 57 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 1ero de Primaria, refiere que en su época los padres no se preocupaban por darle estudios a sus hijos sino porque aprendan a trabajar .
Por ese motivo ella dejó de estudiar y desde niña empezó a trabajar cuidando niños y en los que haceres domésticos. Se caso la edad de 17 años y tiene 12 hijos ,todos casados e independientes.
Violeta se dedica compra y venta de leña. Así como también a la venta de azúcar y arroz. Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compro leña al por mayor para luego viajar a Trujillo a venderla en los mercados mayoristas.
Con este crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará leña al por mayor y sacos de azúcar y arroz. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas y poder ahorrar algo de dinero para afrontar el invierno que es la temporada en donde bajan las ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ester Violeta Guzmán P. is 57 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the San Luis Communal Bank and has a 1st grade education. Violeta says her parents were not concerned about providing their children an education because it was more important for them to learn how to work. For this reason, she quit school so that she could start taking care of her siblings and help with the household chores. She got married at age 17 and now has 12 children who are all married and independent.

Violeta buys and sells firewood. She also sells sugar and rice. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased firewood in bulk and sold it at the wholesale markets in Trujillo.

With her current loan of 2000 soles, Violeta will buy firewood in bulk and sacks of sugar and rice. She hopes to generate more business so that she can save for the winter season when sales are lower.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood in bulk & sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Ireda Agali One Akor Suzan Group

texts.en: Akor S. is 40 years old. She is a married business woman with three children, all of whom are going to school. In total, she has seven dependents that she is looking after. Akor has been in the produce business for over 10 years. She buys beans, peas, maize flour, etc to sell. She is requesting for the loan because she wants to improve on her capital by expanding her stock and in turn her business. Akor hopes to have at least thirty bags of produce or more for sale. She is a hardworking business woman and her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock (produce) for her business.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya S. is an entrepreneur and a Tanzanian married woman with eight children. Seven of her children already work and one child is still in secondary school. She started a charcoal business, which enabled her to open up a new grocery business, and she plans to open a wholesale rice shop. The business income also enables her to meet her family's daily demands and pay school fees for her son. She is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,400,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia ROSA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijas mujeres. La socia y sus hijas viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende productos de snack como: galletas, golosinas, helados y muchos más. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender mercadería como: golosinas, panetones, tortas, y helados para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Llankachinapac Communal Bank. She is 38, in a common law marriage, and has two daughters. She and her daughters live in the Urubamba province, which is located north of the city of Cusco. She has a small store where she sells snack products like crackers, sweets, ice cream, and much more. She has been working in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who wants to get her children ahead. She needs a loan to buy and sell merchandise like sweets, “panetones” (an Italian sweet bread which is a Christmastime staple), cakes, and ice cream for the Christmas festivities. That way she will be able to increase her business capital, have better income, and give her children a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to complete her payments on the respective due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell merchandise like sweets, “panetones” (an Italian sweet bread which is a Christmastime staple), cakes, and ice cream for the Christmas festivities

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.ru:
Хафизова Лилия – лидер данной группы. Ей сорок два года. Лилия вместе со своей семьёй живёт в г. Карабалта. Это провинциальный город. Из–за безработицы многие жители города уехали в столицу, г. Бишкек или за границу на заработки.  В этих условиях, Лилия и её муж, смогли обеспечить себя работой. Они занялись сельским хозяйством. Ведь, местный климат и ландшафт довольно благоприятны для разведения скота и занятия земледелием. Некоторую живность Лилия получила в наследство, и уже на протяжении двадцати лет животноводство явилось их основным источником пропитания. За счёт имения собственного скота, Лилия смогла дать своим детям образование. Старшему сыну девятнадцать лет. Он работает в пельменном цехе. Младшему сыну семнадцать лет. Он пока находится дома и не работает. Оба сына Лилии активно принимают участие в ухаживании за скотом. Поэтому Лилия не испытывает никаких трудностей в своём деле. Лилия обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить ГСМ для обработки пахотной земли весной. Они хотят закупить ГСМ сейчас, так как весной они будут значительно дороже. 

Султанову Камзе пятьдесят два года. Жена Камзы работает учительницей в школе. Сам Камза занимается излюбленным занятием – животноводством. Он также продаёт молоко и подрабатывает обрабатывая участки земли. Камза вместе с женой растят троих детей. Старшей дочери двадцать лет. Камза отправил её на учёбу в медицинское училище. Камза надеется получить кредит и вложить средства в покупку ГСМ для переработки земли. 

Ниязовой Дилдепурус пятьдесят один год. У неё трое детей. Дети уже вполне самостоятельные. Старшая дочь замужем, живёт отдельно. Средняя дочь работает в Бишкеке, а младший сын учится в ВУЗе. Муж Дилдепурус работает электриком. Дилдепурус, пять лет, назад открыла своё дело. Она арендовала помещение на рынке и начала предоставлять услуги швеи. Она делает реставрацию и берёт заказы на индивидуальный пошив.  Дилдепурус обратилась за кредитом с целью купить ГСМ для пахоты земли. 

Абдылдаевой Моркан сорок восемь лет. У Моркан трое детей. Муж работает охранником на мельничном комбинате. Две дочери живут отдельно, а сын живёт с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. Моркан занимается животноводством и продаёт молоко. Благодаря своему хозяйству Моркан смогла без особых трудностей выдать замуж дочерей и дать им образование. Сейчас Моркан надеется получить кредит и купить ГСМ для вспашки земли. Весной они собираются сеять пшеницу.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Lilia K. is the leader of the loan group. She is 42 years old and lives with her family in Karabalta, a provincial town. Because of unemployment, many residents left town for the capital Bishkek or to go abroad to find work. In these conditions, Lilia and her husband could secure their own work. They are engaged in agriculture. You may know, the local climate and landscape are pleasantly agreeable for raising livestock and agricultural activities. Lilia inherited some livestock and already for the duration of 20 years raising animals has provided them a fundamental source of survival. Owing to the fact that she owns her livestock, Lilia was able to provide her children an education. Their older son is 19 years old. He works in a “pelmeni” (ravioli) shop. The younger son is 17 years old. For the time being, he is at home and is not working. Both Lilia’s sons actively participate in tending the livestock. Therefore, Lilia does not encounter any sort of difficulty in her work. Lilia applied for a loan, in order to purchase gasoline and motor oil for working plots of land in the spring. They want to buy gasoline and motor oil now, because in the spring they will be significantly more expensive. Kamza S. is 52 years old. His wife works as a schoolteacher. Kamza by himself is engaged in a favorite occupation – raising livestock. He similarly sells milk and earns additionally by working plots of land. Kamza and his wife are raising three daughters. Their oldest daughter is 20 years old. Kamza sent her to study in medical school. Kamza hopes to receive a loan and to utilize these resources in buying gasoline and motor oil for working his land. Dildepurus N. is 51 years old. She has three children. Her children are already fully independent. Her eldest daughter is married and lives separately. Her middle daughter works in Bishkek, and the youngest studies at a university. Dildepurus’ husband works as an electrician. Five years ago, Dildepurus opened her own activity. She leased a space in the market and began to offer sewing services. She does restorations and takes orders for individual seamstress jobs. Dildepurus applied for a loan with the goal of buying gasoline and motor oil for plowing the land. Morkan A. is 48 years old. Morkan has three children. Her husband works as a guard in a milling plant. Two daughters live separately and the son lives with his parents and helps with the farm. Morkan raises livestock and sells milk. Thanks to her farming, Morkan is able without particular difficulties to offer her daughters in marriage and provide them with an education. Now, Morkan hopes to receive a loan and purchase gasoline and motor oil for plowing. In the spring, they gather to plant wheat. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil to plough the land

loans.name: Pasikalia

texts.en:
Pasikalia is 34 and married with 7 children.  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Pasikalia needs a loan of WST $2700 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 35 talas or US $15 per week) to make improvements to her house.

Pasikalia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pasikalia's 7th loan with SPBD. 

Overall Social Metric Score:*               1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD : http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, age 30, is divorced and has two children who are both currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in one of the mining towns in Ghana. She works hard to be able to provide for the family.

Agnes is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice porridge. She sells from a tabletop on the roadside in her community. Agnes has been in business for six years. She wants a loan in order to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen N. was born in 1971 in Kapan and was able to go to school for several years before he began to work. He lives with his parents, wife and two sons, both of whom are in school. Armen's father is retired, and he supports the family by working as a wood-cutter and a farmer. In his work, he gets help from his parents and wife, all of whom help him produce meat and milk. They begin work at 6 a.m. and continue until 9 p.m. Armen has applied for a loan to buy young pigs, calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy pigs, calves and fodder

loans.name: Vladimir Ilichn

texts.es:
Vladimir, tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos y es guía espiritual. Vladimir tiene una tienda de servicio técnico de celulares movibles en el centro comercial “El Paraiso” de la ciudad del Cusco. Vladimir también hace ceremonias como dar ofrendas a la tierra (pachamanca) acompañado de turistas. Una sesión al turista le cuesta 50 dólares para apreciar la ceremonia. Vladimir requiere el crédito para comprar accesorios de celulares móviles.
    
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
